A number of other features help make face-to-face play attractive, including a number of scenario variants and optional rules, a free-setup full battle scenario, and the move-and-countermove of event chit play. Nation-specific event chits also inject some period flavor.

name: Strategic Decision: World War II
description:
Strategic Decision: World War II covers the entire Second World War, from Poland to Nagasaki, from the Panama Canal to Bombay to Archangelsk to New York. High Strategic level gaming at the Army/Army Group level, and with unit production. No dice, no cards, nothing random used - you've only got yourself to blame if you lose! Two joined vinyl water-resistant maps: the Pacific (~21" x 14") and European/African/MidEast (~27" x 20") theatres are included.

For 2-6 players, the belligerents include Germany, Britain, France, Italy, the Soviet Union, China, Japan, the USA and major neutrals such as Poland, Yugoslavia, Greece, Turkey, Sweden and Spain. In the two-player game, it's the Axis (Germans, Italians, Japanese) against the Allies (USA, Britain, Soviets, France, China). There are three counter sheets of 88 5/8" counters each representing the land, air, naval and logistical units, mostly at the Army/Army Group level (infantry, tank/panzer, mech, shock, guards, SS, etc), with specialty units such as marines and paratroops. Air units represent tactical attack aircraft and strategic aircraft, including heavy strategic aircraft (B-29) and even atomics. The naval forces are flotillas of fighting ships, carrier task forces, landing craft and convoys. Logistical units play a major role in the game - no supplies, no attacks.

Turns are quarterly, and proceed over two maps, one of Europe/North Africa/Middle East and one of Asia and the Pacific, with the US East Coast on the former and the West Coast on the latter. Units appear historically, but their entry can be altered when the players change historical invasion dates. There are many political rules that reflect the limits that the historical leaders faced.

As units are eliminated, they enter replacement pools and it is then up to the players to decide what branch gets priority in production: will the German player seek panzers for the Eastern Front, supplies for North Africa, or Tactical aircraft vs Britain? The allies can share resources up to a point, and lend lease may be all that keeps the Soviets from folding early.

Players are free to try alternate strategies. Should the Germans hit Turkey to open a back door to the Middle East, the Suez and Baku? Should the US hit Japan hard early, or put the emphasis on stopping Germany? Should Japan join Germany's crusade against bolshevism or put the emphasis on naval victories?

Weather is incredibly important, affecting every turn except Summer. Winter slows everything down - except the Soviets.

There are no dice in this game! Hitler didn't roll the dice, and neither did Stalin, Roosevelt, Hirohito, Mussolini or Churchill. They made decisions and lived with them. You'll do the same. There are no randomization of effects at all. Each of your actions determines your fate, as does your opponent's. There is no dice to bail you out or ruin your plans - you have only yourself and your opponent to blame for that!

Yet each game takes a different path. It is possible for Italy to be the last Axis player standing. It's possible for the Allies to knock Japan out a year early or liberate Eastern Europe without the Soviets. The Soviets might just take all of Europe. All of these outcomes happened in actual games. Each turn requires you to plan ahead, to anticipate enemy moves and your counter to them.

name: Double Play: Cement Shoes
description: All Double Play card decks can be combined to make larger decks. Each deck includes a trivia game for 3 or more players. All cards are plastic. Cements Shoes is a game of elimination where players that collect two “cement shoes” sleep with the fishes.

name: Bulwark: Hemi Szakma
description:
Contains one Hero deck for Bulwark.

Hemi is a merchant, and a damn fine one. Once a rapacious profiteer, he now turns his resources to more socially-aware ends. He knows the cost of war and the value of freedom, and however frail he might be in person he has tricks and resources that can save even a seemingly-doomed town.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Bushido: Temple of Ro-Kan starter set
description: The serene martial artist masters of the Temple of Ro-Kan have long viewed themselves as above all mortal and mundane conflicts. Now, following the Savage Wave, and the rise of the Cult of Yurei, the monks of Ro-Kan are being dragged into the clandestine wars of universal balance – a war in which they will reluctantly turn out to be key players. The monks follow an age-old path and know the secrets of Ki better than any others, but they are few and divided – will they be able to unite and join forces until it is too late?
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Smile & Money
description:
In Smile & Money you should try to take more cards as possible. Play a card and take a card of the same color from the table. Each card has a coins value. Be careful; at the end of the game the coins count as points.
Who has the most points win the game!

Very easy to learn, simple to play and a nice game for everybody!!!

Similar game play as seen in Casino and Scopa

name: Motdingo
description:
Have fun building words using syllables categorized by frequency they are used in the French language. Play 5 different minigames including 'Top list' that allows players of all ages to play together and to use texts as a resource.
A fun way to enhance writing and vocabulary of the CP to CM2 students (grades 1 and 2, roughly)!

name: ATS Gazala Monster
description:
From the publisher's website:

As the morning of 27th May dawned the 8th Panzer Regiment under Lieutenant Teege led Rommel’s wide sweep around the British southern flank at Bir Hacheim. With one hundred and eighty tanks, the regiment was arrayed in spearhead formation with the first section moving forward on a wide front of one and one half miles by about a mile deep. At about 0715 hours, the call rang out in the headsets, “Enemy armor, twelve o’clock!” A British lieutenant of the 8th Hussars also dryly noted enemy armor to his regimental HQ by radio. “It looks as if Jerry’s come with a Panzer brigade,” only to correct himself moments later. “There’s more than a brigade, its the whole bloody Afrika Korps. Alert! Alert!”

And thus began the historic Battle of Gazala. It was May of 1942, Hitler’s armies were still the masters of Europe, with more conquests to come. And yet YOU, tactical-level gamer and ATS devotee ... has only experienced this battle in ‘penny packets’, a tank here, two tanks there. Until NOW. Because the ATS GAZALA MONSTER is here to rescue you from never being able to cross off, ‘big, real Western Desert warfare experience’ ... from your bucket list. Imagine the old Tobruk orders-of-battle ... with all of their one-to-one representations ... then knife forward with your formations of 10, no 15, wait add in Troop Leaders and panzer leaders ... and make that 17 AFVs ... in a full-blown presentation that gives you ALL of the tanks, guns and men (i.e., all combat counters; just bring your ATS rulebook and markers) ... and the playing area to duke it out in.

The set also debuts the first collection of 11” × 16” folding DESERT GEO boards and a selection of overlays to go with them.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: ATS Core Module: All American I – Capture of the La Fiere Bridge 1944
description:
From the publisher's website:

All American 1 - The Capture of La Fiere 1944: A brand new take on the battle at La Fiere, the ultimate small-unit struggle, a microcosm of a much larger battle. In addition to the Amercan airborne soldier, the star of the battle is the bocage country located along the Merderet River between Ste. Mere Eglise and the UTAH Beach exits. Securing the battlefield on D-Day 1944 was the responsbility of the 82nd Airborne Division, an elite unit with the drop into Sicily already recorded in the annals of airborne warfare the year before.

Welcome to the ATS CORE MODULES, all new for 2014. New map, larger, on cardstock, folding with no trimming needed -- did we mention new terrain art throughout AND larger hexes? Perfect for those classic -- YET ALL NEW ATS COUNTERS -- the you'll have on the map deciding history ... all ... over ... again! This module is for owners of the ATS 2014 Color Rules plus ATS Standard Small Markers + Large Markers but may also be used easily by owners of any past edition of the ATS rules. All Special Rules and AFV Cards needed for play are included, along with ALL NEW FOLIO STYLE packaging.

name: Gilded Devils
description: Gilded Devils is an asymmetrical game of negotiation and economic conflict for 2-8 players. Set in America's Guilded Age, half the players take on the role of Industrialists, building railroads and factories in an attempt to make more money than their fellow industrialists, while the other half of the players take on the role of politicians, selling political favors to the Industrialists, and using those profits to fund their political campaigns, attempting to garner the needed votes before the competing politicians.

name: Ophidian 2350 CCG: Rise of Champions
description:
The first 140-card expansion for the Ophidian 2350 CCG, Rise of Champions continues the storyline for Ophidian and introduces new gladiators, additional level cards for some gladiators from the original set, new effects, new card types, and more! This series is offered in 30-count booster displays.

Unfortunately a printed expansion never got green light as the publisher Fleer/Skybox International has announced that '...based on current market conditions,' it is canceling its Rise of Champions booster for the Ophidian 2350 CCG.

In making the announcement, Fleer Senior VP Sales and Marketing Lloyd Pawlak noted Fleer's inability to get retailer support as the determining factor in ending new release support for the game. 'The strong core support of our players and volunteers and the only 5 star gameplay rating for CCGs in Scrye this year... was not enough to convince more retailers to carry and support the game,' he said.

Fleer Director of Gaming Initiatives David Chase told ICv2 that not all support for the game is ending.'We are still soliciting sales for Ophidian 2350,' he said.'Ophidian still runs Organized Play along with supporting various conventions with product and tournament support.'

And due to the Fan support, Ophidian Inc, the creators/designers of the game, managed to release the expansion as a print and play version.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Queue, Deck Construction, Player Elimination

name: Brave and Noble Fights Expansion: The Battles of Foochow and Pung-do Island
description:
Brave and Noble Fights Expansion: The Battles of Foochow and Pung-do Island. This expansion game portrays the first battle of the 1894-95 Sino-Japanese War of Pung-do Island, and extends the period covered to the climactic battle of Foochow of the 1884 Sino-French War.

The historical Battle of Foochow can be played as a stand-alone game. However, to play the mini-game Battle of Pung-do and the many variants of Foochow and other “what if” battles of the Sino-French War you will need a copy of Brave and Noble Fights: The Battles of the Yalu and Wei-Hai-Wei.

name: Cartatoto Multiplication
description: A fun way to learn to multiply with these 110 cards. On one side of the card is the sum and on the other the answer. All you have to do to win is solve the problem first. Plus you can learn tricks to solve the times table more easily.

name: Mako Destroyer
description: Family game where players compete to move their destroyers to a safe location while laying mines in the paths of their opponents. Game uses a thin card pinboard but with some plastic components.

name: Warning!Signs
description:
In this party game, players are all tourists, or strangers in a strange land. They come across signs, and must decipher their meaning. Players are dealt three Sign cards, and at the start of each turn, a Where card is drawn (depicting a location). Each turn, one player will act as the Tour Guide, and choose a Sign card to play with the Where card. All other players write a Caption for the Sign based on the Where. The Tour Guide collects all of the Captions, and after reading all of them aloud, will select the "best" one.
Captions are funny, outrageous, completely irreverent, or an earnest attempt to give the sign appropriate meaning.
Each time a Tour Guide picks your Caption, you win a Sign card. The first player to get 5 cards wins!

name: Ninjan!!
description:
Publisher's summary:

忍ジャン!! (Ninjan!!) is a children's card game from さとーふぁみりあ (Sato Familie). "This game is a fighting game between ninja. Young children can play this game. It is possible to rise quickly." The game is for two players.

The time is the Sengoku (Warring States) period. While Busho military commanders engage in fierce battles on history's center stage, ninjas risk their lives for their commanders. When two ninjas meet, one of them must die, because whoever discovers their identify shall not stay alive.

This is a one-on-one ninja battle game. The player on the offense plays Attack cards from his hand. The player on the defense guards against the attack with his cards. The player who manages to exhaust his opponent's Strength deck wins the game.
publishers: さとーふぁみりあ (Sato Familie)

name: The Buildings
description:
The Buildings uses the gameplay found in Sky Scrapers, but creates new goals for new playing areas.

In each game, you start with pieces of the two players on the game board. Each turn, a player moves one of their own stacks a number of spaces equal to the height of the stack, stacking it onto of another stack. A stack is owned by the player whose piece is on top.

In the original Sky Scrapers game, included in this set, whoever has the most stacks that contain at least four pieces wins the game. A different game board crowns the player who has created the tallest stack. A third game board gives the win to whoever controls more of the six inner spaces on the game board.

name: Jinmenken Haunted School Escape
description: This unique game takes the classic motif of the haunted school to new levels. In Jinmenken Haunted School Escape Game, your character must move around the scary school board, all while being chased by a so-called Jinmenken, a dog with a human face that is a staple of Japanese urban legends. Collect three matching items that spring from the clock tower to various rooms in the school, and then escape back to the starting point. Whoever gets there first is the winner! Spin the clock tower face to see how many moves you can make each time. But the clock may tell you to move the Jinmenken, who has three different speeds! If he catches your character, it's game over for you! There are also numerous other tricks and secret gimmicks depending on where you land on the board. This is a great game for Japanese language-learners and fans of Japanese ghost stories.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Wings of Glory: World War 1 – Macchi M.5
description:
From the publisher:

The Macchi M.5 was an Italian single-seat fighter flying boat, designed and built by Nieuport-Macchi at Varese. It was extremely maneuverable and agile and matched the land-based aircraft it had to fight.

The M.5 was operated by five Italian maritime patrol squadrons as a fighter and convoy escort. By the end of World War I, these aircraft were flown by both United States Navy and United States Marine Corps airmen. The three versions of the airplane proposed include the model flown by the Italian pilot Domenico Arcidiacono, an American plane flown by Willis B. Haviland and a captured Austrian plane piloted by Friedrich Welker

Designed to be used with the popular air combat game system created by Andrea Angiolino and Pier Giorgio Paglia, each WW1 Wings of Glory Airplane Pack is a ready-to-play model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other WW1 Wings of Glory game product. In each pack you will find all you need to play with the airplane: a special base with gaming stats, a variable altitude flying stand, and a specific deck of maneuver cards.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Action Queue, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Battles of the English Civil Wars 1642 - 1651 Volume I
description:
Battles of the English Civil Wars (1642-1651) Series was originally published by TCS Games as several Desktop Published games. In the LCD tradition, they are perfect for those wanting a game that is fast to learn and quick to play. These games will include all new graphics, corrected errata, and consolidated rules.

Volume I features four of the most famous and significant battles from the First English Civil War (1642-1646) which saw Royalist ('Cavalier') supporters of King Charles I against the Parliamentarian ('Roundhead') supporters of the Long Parliament.

Edgehill (1642): Charles marched on London intending to force a decisive battle with the main Parliamentarian army under the Earl of Essex.. They met at Edgehill in the first pitched battle of the war. Both armies were inexperienced and ill disciplined, and many fled or simply set about looting the enemy baggage train. As a result the battle was inconclusive and the war would continue for another four years.

First Newbury (1643): Almost exactly a year later and we see Charles again facing the Earl of Essex. The Royalists had enjoyed a series of successes which had left the Parliamentarians in disarray. As Charles besieged the town of Gloucester, the Parliamentarians mustered a force under Essex and through surprise succeeded in breaking the siege. They then fell back towards London. The Royalist rallied and, overtaking the Parliamentarians, blocked the path to London at Newbury. A surprise dawn attack saw the battle initially going in Essex's favour. Royalist counter-attacks were bloody and Essex was at risk of being encircled but fought back and pushed forward again - only to be slowed by Royalist cavalry. The Parliamentarian force was split in two but the Royalists attempt to drive through and encircle the wings was unsuccessful. With night falling and both sides exhausted the battle drew to a close. Next day, short of ammunition, the Royalists were obliged to allow Essex to continue his march to London.

Marston Moor (1644): This was to be the largest battle of the Civil Wars and saw the Royalists under Prince Rupert and the Marquis of Newcastle facing a combined English Parliamentarian /Scottish Covenantor force under the Lord Fairfax, the Earl of Manchester and the Earl of Leven. Rupert marched to break the siege of the Earl of Newcaste at York. The armies met outside York on Marston Moor but Rupert, who had sought battle, hesitated from attacking due to being outnumbered. Towards evening the Parliamentarian and and Covenantors took the initiative and launched a surprise attack. After two hours of fighting Cromwell routed the Royalist cavalry following which the Royalist infantry were annihilated.

Naseby (1645): Though the war would continue for another 18 months, Naseby was the decisive battle of the First English Civil War, seeing Charles' main army, led by the King and Prince Rupert, destroyed by the Parliamentarian New Model Army under Fairfax and Cromwell. The Royalists held a strong position on a ridge between two villages but left it when they saw Parliamentarian cavalry withdrawing. Having redeployed the Royalists attacked and the two centres were soon locked in melee. On the Parliamentarian left the two cavalry wings engaged. The Parliamentarian cavalry broke and the Royalists pursued. After an initial face off on the Parliamenraian right, the cavalry wings engaged and the Royalists were routed by Cromwell. Unlike the Royalists on the other wing, only part of Cromwell's horse went in pursuit, with the rest attacking the Royalist centre - at the same time as a smaller attack on the other flank. The King sought to assist his beleaguered centre by personally leading his lifeguard to the rescue but was restrained . Rupert eventually rallied the horse attacking the Parliamentarian baggage and returned to the field - but too late.
categories: Civil War, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Bedlam: AKA The "Can Someone Take Me Off this Game?" Game
description:
From the box:

BEDLAM EULA: This is a personal project from an employee. By opening this box, you acknowledge that this game is not designed, licensed or intended for use in the design, construction, operation or maintenance of any nuclear facility. You should also probably have a sense of humor, like ninjacats, love this company and enjoy working here but still enjoy some good-natured poking fun at ourselves, find transcendenant joy in reading EULAs and typing in 6 character PINS to access your email, like reading long, comma-separated sentences, and will not hold said employee or anyone else responsible if your delicate sensitivities are troubled by the occasional swear word or crass humor that may or may not be inside this box.

In other words, this is a Microsoft-themed set of cards for Cards Against Humanity style play.
categories: Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Akvateka 3+1
description:
This is compilation of 3 games + puzzle.

Delfinarium is a water polo game between seals and dolphins. Players move figurines of seals and dolphins and push figurine of ball in order to score a goal. The winner is player who scores more goals.

Svet tišine is educational game. While playing children can learn about classification of sea animals. Players move figurines and collect counters by stopping on the field next to counter. The winner is the player who collects the most counters.

Trka puževa (Race of snails) is a simple game for younger players. Board has 3D elements. Each player has one figurine of a snail. They race along sea bed. There are several paths that are intertwined. Shorter paths have more obstacles that slow them down. The winner is the player who first gets to the finish line.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Educational
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement

name: For the Crown: Sceptered Bundle
description:
The For the Crown: Sceptered Bundle includes the following:

For the Crown (Second Edition)
Shock and Awe (Expansion #1)
Between Heaven and Earth (Expansion #3)
the Vanguard Promo Pack
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: QUBQST: Expansion One
description:
This expansion to the QUBQST base game adds characters, creatures, catacombs and more magic items to the game.

QUBQST (cubequest) is a dice rolling, dungeon crawling game, that takes classic elements from early fantasy role-playing games, and mixes them with simple to pick up gameplay, and retro computer game style graphics!

QUBQST plays like a casual computer game - generate your catacombs, take your party of characters through, encountering creatures, traps, secret rooms, items and treasures, until you reach the Golden Cube, your final destination in the catacombs!

Only by defeating all of the creatures on the Golden Cube, can the party win, calculate their score, and see how they rank - will they be Hopeless Heroes, Average Adventurers, or Catacomb Conquerors?!

name: Marooned 5
description:
After a boat tour, you crash on an uncharted island where you find five castaways willing to help you. The problem is that others on the island — other players, that is — are also using YOUR people, and they are not being honest about where they are or what they are doing. You might want to get them exiled to insure you fare the best.

In Marooned 5, use the five castaways to help build your raft and get off the island; lounge at the resort sipping drinks with a famous actress; gather and monetize water; or exile all the other players. The player with the most victory points or the last player standing wins.

Players are dealt one worker and one location and use these two cards to create worker placement. You can be honest and safe, or get ahead by claiming the best roles, locations and combos.

name: UP
description:
Other than being colorful and fun, this game has no relation to the hit Pixar film. UP is a unique abstract game for 2-6 players that combines the strategy of limited actions, with the luck of dice, and the joy of building blocks. Games last about 30 minutes. Basically, you're all building one stack of multicolored dice and moving your pawns up the stack along paths of color that match your pawn.

You start out with a handful of dice. There's no numbers on these dice, just 6 different colors; and the dice themselves are different colors. You have to get rid of all your dice to win the game, but you also have to be the highest pawn on the stack after you've used up all your dice.

The color that you roll determines where a die can be placed on the stack (that's the luck part), but rather than spending a die, you can use your turn to move or rotate a die that's already on the stack (that's the strategy part). You might want to move a die to open up a path for your pawn to climb higher, or rotate a die to make it harder for an opponent.

The competition gets hotter as the game progresses, and there seems to be a good "catch the leader" dynamic, so that by the end, everyone is often at the edge of their seats to see if a lucky roll or a tricky maneuver will win the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Push Your Luck

name: One Page Fantasy
description: One Page Fantasy is a strategy battle game designed to be played with WHFB miniatures. The game offers simple mechanics based around alternating phases, allowing you to play highly tactical games of regimental warfare.

name: Knights and Knaves
description:
Knights and Knaves is a supplement for the Battlesworn: Bid for Victory miniatures rules.

18 new Classes: Tested against the basic classes of Battlesworn: Bid For Victory, Knights and Knaves adds rules for Acrobat, Alchemist, Assassin, Bard, Beast, Berserker, Chaos Warrior, Construct, Druid, Giant, Monk, Paladin, Pistoleer, Priest, Ranger, Swarm, Witch, and Witch Hunter.

More Magic: This book adds generic magic melee and ranged weapons, Talismans, Amulets, Potions, and 12 new spells, all formatted as cards that can be printed or photocopied.

Solo Play: Guidelines for solitaire play are included.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Firestorm Taskforce Starter Set: Aquan Prime vs. The Directorate
description: Firestorm Taskforce Starter Sets are an exciting way for players to start gaming spaceship combat in the Firestorm Galaxy. Inside this set are 14x highly detailed spaceship models (2x Medium, 1 of which can be upgraded to a more powerful design using modular components) and 5x Light Frigates. Also included is a Firestorm Taskforce fast play Rulebook, 15x Dice, Token Sheet, 2x Acrylic Movement Templates and 14x Flight Stands.

name: Monster Melee
description:
Monster Melee is a "Meta" game of up to 30 players.

A "Meta" game is a game that is played while doing other things. Monster Melee is an ideal game to be played inside a convention game room. You play while playing any other game or activity.

In Monster Melee, each player will assume the role of one of the following: Human, Vampire, Werewolf, Ghost, or Alien.

These roles are not only secret to other players, but also secret to you as well.

Once Monster Melee starts, a player may approach another player to conduct a duel. They will choose a weapon card from their hand to use on that target player. The target player will then scratch off the appropriate monster section that is harmed by that weapon. If they reveal a red X, they have been killed and are out of the game. If they reveal nothing, they have survived and can now counter attack by giving the other player another weapon card back. Once that combat is over those two players may not conduct another combat with each other for two minutes.

At the end of any combat/duel, surviving players may return to the main Monster Melee table and log their results.

Last monster alive wins.

name: Vanor: Champions of Fate
description:
Vanor: Champions of Fate is a co-operative card game in which 1-3 players explore locations in the magitech infused Vanor campaign setting to complete encounters and stop the plots of evil villain masterminds.

Each player pick a deck from one of three classes: the Fighter, Thief and Wizard. Each class has unique moves and abilities to overcome encounters and help the party progress in the adventure.

When discovering new locations, player face encounters, which can be both friendly- and offer special advantages- or hostile, and need to be overcome. Completing encounters uses a similar mechanics to crisis resolution: each encounter require a number of different stat tokens, and the party work together to combo cards which will allow them to build enough tokens to defeat the encounter.

The goal of the game is determined by a set of scenario cards the players pick at the beginning, and would usually require defeating a villain encounter. The players may lose the game if one of their characters dies, or if they’re forced to remove every card from their deck.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Blitzkrieg: règle de jeu avec figurines pour la seconde guerre mondiale
description:
Third edition of H.Caille's game.

BlitzKrieg is an easy and quick game to play World War II battles with 10, 15 and 20mm miniatures.

It also plays well with 1/72 plastic models.

The scale is cie. A cie is +/- 10 bases of 3 minis.

The V3 improved the game with the Player's return on the french forum of the game. New OB
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Sticknia
description:
From the publisher:
Pick a team. Use the cards to enhance your team, or to sabotage others. Battle to dominate the board and be the last team standing.

user summary:
Start by drafting a squad of six Stick cards, each with it's own attack/defense rating and special ability, then placing their corresponding Stick Markers on the battlefield. Play then goes around the table with each player moving their Stick Markers into position, playing cards to enhance their Sticks or harm their opponent's Sticks, and rolling the dice to resolve battles until only one squad remains on the board.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Player Elimination

name: Quantum Link
description: In Quantum Link, 2 players take turns placing their dice on empty spaces of the board with a fixed face value, betting on how many friendly dice will surround each of them at the end of the game. Quantum Link is the evolution of Quantum Leap and Adaptoid, by the same designer.

name: Twisted: A Steampunk Miniatures Game
description:
From the publisher:
Twisted is an immersive new tabletop skirmish game for 2 or more players, with a world-class range of 32mm miniatures representing your characters.

Set in an uniquely interesting steampunk universe, Twisted’s absorbing gameplay and linked story-driven missions create a real emotional connection between you and your characters on the tabletop. Every character has an original backstory and distinctive role within the Twisted universe: guiding them through our richly-developed environments and exciting encounters will have you on the edge of your seat and wanting more!

But beware the power of the Engine! The ever-present influence of the mysterious steampunk Engine pervades the world of Twisted. What makes playing Twisted excitingly unique is that the Engine itself brings a new and intriguing element to every encounter: the Eye of the Engine card deck and the unique ‘Favour of the Engine’ game mechanic give the Engine an active role in the actual gameplay.

Maintain the favour of the Engine to enjoy rich rewards, or tempt fate and risk it all!

The Engine is the hidden source of steampunk power permeating the world Twisted. But it is more than just a god-like machine: it has a selfish consciousness seeking to transform the world according to its own designs, and a jealous ego unwilling to share this power!

Rumours of the Engine’s influence are spreading throughout the world of Twisted, and competing factions have emerged seeking to discover the secret access points to the Engine’s power: the Nodes.

The first faction to stumble upon one of these Nodes is the Dickensians: their discovery of an Engine Node hidden deep beneath the darkest sewers of London triggers an explosion of raw steampunk power as the Engine – sensing danger – fights back by summoning the Servants of the Engine!
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Legends of the Ancient World: Ebon Rebirth
description:
Ebon Rebirth is a programmed adventure using Dark City Games Legends of the Ancient World rule set. These rules provide gameplay very similar to that of Melee and Wizard from Metagaming. This adventure is compatible with those games as well.

Battles are fought with counters on a hex map that is included with the game.

From the publisher:
"...You are here for one simple reason; these are lean times. Resources are scarce, not enough for the various peoples of the Wildlands to survive, much less the scavengers. Symbonn has a reputation for providing opportunity to the desperate. It will take some bloody work, but you are confident that you will rise to the challenges that you will face, and survive..."
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing

name: RanaDrama
description:
In RanaDrama, the Apprentices of an old Wizard got accidentially polymorphed into Little Frogs. Still in the Wizard's Tower, they have to try to overcome all the defence mechanisms that are targetting them now as "vermin". The final cure is outside of the Tower but only one of them can win. Be either clever or fast ... preferably both.

The game works with a modular board, where the different rooms of the wizard's Tower can be influenced and moved with different magic spells. While exploring the rooms for spells and wonderous items, the frogs have to avoid the guardians and traps of the tower... and sometimes even the rival apprentices, which are in the same Situation now too.

RanaDrama is a highly competative game where creative use of the numerous spells is the key.

At the start of every turn a Player has to determine by a dice roll, which persona (the one of the wizard's apprentice or the frog's) is dominant. Based on that, and modified by certain magical effects the movement Points are determined.

A Player can use theese Points to hop around on the room Cards, casting spells or searching their square on the room Card to find the key out of the Tower or other useful magical artefacts.

Only the Player with the Crystal key can pass the Guardian at the end of a floor, but all the other Players can hunt him down to get the key from him.
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: The Pyramid of the Flying Marbles
description:
The Pyramid of the Flying Marbles is a Shibumi game for 3 players derived from The House of the Flying Blades, by the same designer.

Players take turns capturing a marble of the next player in turn or passing. When all players pass in succession the game ends. The player with more marbles remaining on the board wins.

name: Dirty Cops: A Game for Scoundrels
description:
Dirty Cops: A Game for Scoundrels is a fast paced 2-4 player game where players work cooperatively against criminals, then stab each other in the back to gain the most money.

Games take place over 3-4 crime scenes, depending on player count, with each player taking on the role of lead detective during the course of the game.

Players choose how much they work together, making (and breaking) alliances with each other to survive the criminals (and other cops). Players also choose how ruthless they want to be with each other, allowing the group to set the tone for the game.

Cops, drugs, and guns...what kind of cop will YOU be?

name: Torii: Buke Starter Box
description:
Torii is a skirmish wargame set on Feudal Japan, created by Miniatures and Wargames to use Zenit Miniatures’ range of miniatures (specifically Kensei’s)
In Torii you’ll have to lead a group of about 8-12 warriors that will have work together to accomplish their clan objectives.

Every game is different. Scenery, main and secondary missions will change, so you’ll never get bored of playing Torii.

Torii is quick to learn, with great tactical and strategic depth, with a duration of about 45-60 minutes.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: TIME
description:
The Card Game where running out of TIME is Good!
A lightweight, interactive game for everyone. Discard cards in your hand according to the numbers on a clock. The first player to run out of TIME and saying "TIME" is the winner. Enhances basic math skills.

name: Fall Barbarossa: 1941-1942
description:
Grand-operational-level wargame simulating the entire Eastern Front (including Finland with the same map scale or holding boxes above the Arctic Circle) from June 22, 1941 to April, 1942. 10 miles per hex. The map area and some charts have been made to fit on a 4' x 8' table. 4-8 day turns based on weather.

German units are: Divisions, Brigades, Regiments, Kampfgruppen (ad-hoc Panzer Division formations) and specialized Regiments and Battalions (that are only attached to higher units). Russian units are Corps, untried Divisions and Brigades with specialized Regiments and Battalions (that are only attached to higher units). Both sides have their own unique manner of play to show their historical capabilities and tendencies. Air and naval.

Designed for ease of play. Lot's of decisions but not tons of detail. Lots of maneuver room (due to the size of the game map). Since it is focused on being about the land campaign. Command and variable movement system that includes cards that add random events for historical flavor, but do not drive the game.

Additional game will be added (with more maps going East): Not A Step Backwards!! May, 1942 - April, 1943. And, possibly a 3rd game that goes to the end of the War with the Soviet invasion of Germany.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Phase Order

name: Bulwark: Savages of the Marsh
description:
A new foe deck for Bulwark.

Contains the following cards:

1x cover
5x Troll Whelp Troop
5x Human Troop
5x Beastling Skirmisher
5x Brainwashed Blood Drinker
3x Troll Heavy
2x Manual Mangonel
1x Bethari Elf Eater, Troll Berserker
1x Agung Two Teeth, Troll Vandal
1x Setiawan Double Knock, Troll Enforcer
1x Metali Paired Axe, Troll Gladiator
1x Ratu Four Cry, Troll Chief
1x Beastling Ambuishers
2x Dwarf Shock Troops
2x Elf Cavalry
2x Goblin Wolf Cavalry
2x Human Cavalry
1x Knights Ecclesiastes
2x Lizard Saurian Cavalry
1x Squires' Auxiliary
1x Supply Train
3x Unified Lance Charge
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Interstellar Envoys
description:
Achieve political dominance of known space!
Discover planets, aim the rockets, send envoys, protect trade routes, and meet political objectives in this medium weight strategy game.

Gain influence among the galaxy’s races

Discover planets and visit them to build relations with the natives. Rivals might travel to distant planets with you, but only dominant factions increase reputation.
First impressions matter, but rival factions can steal a planet’s allegiance.
Patrol planets’ shipping routes to gain even more respect.
React to changing goals. As political climates change, respond with flexibility to ensure your prestige among the peoples of the galaxy.


Key features

A blend of worker placement, tile placement, and area majority
Changing goals and special actions keep game play fresh
Unique worker deployment mechanism
Scales well from 2-6 players
Moderate player interaction

name: Rustle: the Card Game
description:
Rustle: the Card Game is a card drawing farm animal themed game where the goal is to possess the most points by the end of the game. There are two decks - the Animal Deck and the Action Deck.

The Animal Deck contains only cards that give you points. The Action Deck contains cards that let you draw more Animal cards, steal Animal cards from other players or remove their Animal cards from the game.

Players start with two animal cards in their farm (in front of them) and four action cards in their hand. Each turn players draw an Animal card and an Action card. The Animal card is played in front of them straight away. Players then choose to play one of their Action cards or discard one.

Points are earned through collecting farm animals which are all worth different points. Game play ends when no more cards can be drawn from the Animal Deck.

name: Bloody Broadsides
description:
Bloody Broadsides – is a fast paced Napoleonic Naval game which allows you to Captain one or more massive ships of the line from the Age of Sail. Most games can be played in 3 hours. This game is intended to play with miniature ships on a large hex mat. These rules were written specifically for Portsmouth Miniatures and Games 1:900 scale ships but may be used with any miniatures.

Games may be as small as one on one Captain Duels, up to massive 60 ships or more historical battles like the Battle of Trafalgar. There is a point system to allow you to design your own scenarios.

Features:

Plotted Movement
Simultaneous Combat
Point System
Crew Grade
Morale Checks
Ship Classes (1st rate through 4th rate)
Critical Hits (including Ship Explodes)
Raking
Grappling
Capturing Ships
Drifting

name: Rally On
description:
Rally On is a rally racing tabletop game that uses a risk and reward dice system to play out events during each rally stage.

Rally On has been a dream of mine for the last five years. I have always been an avid rally and all around race fan. I started to design a game based on what I wanted a table racing game to be and something that I had never played before. Once, I got together with Ben M, the game really started to pick up steam. He brought the same passion I had for making a fun and exciting table top rally game. When we decided to bring on randomly laid out stages every time you play, dice driven events and a driver confidence system really brought the project to life.

Playing a different track varies the game dramatically. Never again will you have to have to play the same board over and over again or are you forced to spend money to buy a new track, just to add variety. The confidence system allows the player to push their luck with a smaller risk of an event happening, but the catch is that you only have a limited number of confidence points to start the entire rally with. The points are also carried over stage to stage, so you have to be careful not to use all yours up at the beginning or you won't have any left for later stages. This really helps to determine how hard you want to attack a turn or how fast you want to push your driver. You also get penalties for running out of confidence, so that is always on your mind. There are various ways to regain confidence points and also many ways to lose them. During Event rolls you might gain more back by taking a turn perfectly or lose a point for botching it. At the end of each Stage the players each get four driver points to spend to repair drivetrain or add confidence points. You can also use those to buy more Pace cards. Pace cards are various cards that the players can use to benefit themselves or play against their opponents. There are six, six sided dice that the players use to play out events throughout Rally On. Each die side has a unique symbol that corresponds to an event that could happen to player. Some are good and some are bad. Depending on how hard you are pushing your driver determines how many dice you will be rolling for the event. You could come out a head and gain a few extra movement spaces, shave some time off your current run, damage your car, lose time or wreck. Don't forget you always can use your precious confidence points to re-roll an event die if needed.

The goal of Rally On is to complete each stage of the rally with the least amount of time ticks. It is meant to be played as a three stage rally, but you can do less. At the start of each turn the player decides if they will up shift or downshift their gear. Once that is determined they roll the corresponding gear die. They then move that number of spaces on the stage. Each time the player comes up to a turn tile they have to decide which lane to take the turn in. Each lane has a maximum gear the player can enter in. The player has the option to attack the turn in the inside lane or outside lane. The inside lane is usually safer, but slower. The outside lane will be faster but adds a higher chance of rolling a bad event, due to rolling a higher number of event dice. This makes the outside lane a higher risk and you could potentially take damage, slide, spin off track, lose time or even gain confidence for a perfect turn. At the end of each stage the players tally their time. The player with the least amount of time wins that current stage.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Turn Order: Time Track

name: The Horrible Truth
description:
The Horrible Truth is a party game for 4-10 people where you test how well you know your friends while strategically revealing things about yourself.

Test your friendship knowledge through three card types: Question, Write It, and Draw It cards. Play a question card to ask the group a question about yourself, and the other players must try to guess the correct answer. Some questions are relatively benign, whereas others can get extremely awkward. It is called The Horrible Truth, after all.

If you play a Write It card, your friends must answer by writing a funny or factual phrase in response. If you play a Draw It, your friends must sketch whatever uncomfortable or absurd scenario the card describes. For both Write It and Draw It cards, you will choose your favorite response, so your friends must create something that stands out in order to win. There are also Challenge Cards, which you can use to try to force your friends to play the most horrible cards from your hand.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Malifaux Second Edition: Hog Wild – Ulix Box Set
description:
Box set for Ulix's Crew for Malifaux 2nd Edition. The Box contains, Ulix, Penelope (Totem), Old Major (Henchman), Three Wild Boars.

All figures are in plastic with associated character and upgrade cards. Figures come unpainted and unassembled.

Ulix is a master for the Gremlins faction. He specializes in pigs and almost all his abilities, actions and upgrades are pig related.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Hurry-Up Offense
description:
A fast-paced dice game that simulates the most exciting part an of American Football game, the final 2-minute drive.

The Offense player is down by 4 with two minutes to play. With simple play calls and fast-rolling dice, the Defense player guesses the play call for chance at a big play while the Offense player works to fill up the board with successes and drive down the field to score the winning touchdown!

A perfect two-player filler game for tailgating, halftime, road trips, and more, Hurry-Up Offense offers the flavor of live-action American football for both casual and die-hard football fanatics.

name: Elites
description:
The leaders of the planet ECHO are showing interest in the conquest of the solar system and offers attractive subsidies for all entrepreneurs who want to join the race. In Elites, players assume the role of entrepreneurs who try to take the control over the solar system.

Elites is a competitive game played in team of 2 players in real time over a period of 5 minutes exactly. During the game, players move their units on different points of interest in order to carry out missions (mini- games). There are 3 types of missions, hacking missions, infiltration missions and trade missions . Each mission will bring a certain number of points. The objective of Elites is to be the team with the most points at the end of the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Dice, Racing, Real-time, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Cave Pilot 55: Nathus Promo Expansion
description:
The goal of this prehistoric themed expansion is to fly the cave, collect reputation points and destroy or face the flying Nathus.

In a game of Cave Pilot 55 that makes use of the flying Nathus, the cave is slid outward to create a small corridor. This corridor can be used to place the large flying beast in the center of the cave.

On top of the regular 'static' challenges, the flying Nathus presents an extra moving obstacle affecting its surroundings.
Each turn the beast moves 1 or 2 positions through the cave. Based on the strengths and weaknesses of the flying Nathus, players need to strategically plan and time their route through the cave.

name: Wings of Glory: World War 1 – Phönix D.I
description:
From the publisher:

The Phönix D.I was a single–seat biplane fighter with a stout and compact design, used by both branches of Austro–Hungarian air service. It was a fast airplane, well–armed and offering good vision, but it was quite difficult to maneuver and had a poor climb rate. Employed first as an escort fighter and fighter, in spite of structural weaknesses, it was favorably received by many pilots, who found it stable, robust, and easy to fly. The D.I was also used effectively as a photo–reconnaissance aircraft.

Phönix D.I (Lang)
Scoring his last three victories against Macchi seaplanes, Friedrich Lang became one of only two naval aces of the Austro–Hungarian Empire.

Phönix D.I (Urban)
Karl Urban flew in the Phönix D.I on the Piave Front. He became an ace fighting with this airplane, scoring his fifth victory on May, 19th 1918.

Phönix D.I (Gruber)
Kurt Gruber received glory and honor for the Austro–Hungarian Empire by claiming 11 victories, including five victories in the Phönix D.I.

Each WW1 Wings of Glory® Airplane Pack is a ready–to–play model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other WW1 Wings of Glory game product.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Action Queue, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Friday 13th: Jason in San Juan
description:
Viernes 13: Jason en San Juan ("Friday The 13th: Jason in San Juan") Board game is a fan made tribute mostly to Viernes 13, a song made by urban songwriter and singer Vico-C and Friday The 13th franchise.
In this coop game the goal is get to Joseph Café before Jason does. Every player starts at "El Morro" and after choosing who's going to be the 1st player at random; each player takes turns rolling dices and running thru the streets of San Juan trying to survive the Jason's Hideouts spaces and the Event spaces. The first time a player ends his/her turn on Jason’s Hideout space or an Event card states an action that includes Jason, this “personaje de viernes 13”(Friday the 13th character) enters in play. Jason will play on the last turn (after the last player). Whoever wants to can play as Jason (even your mom who hates horror films). Try to stay alive while everything on the board is depleting those important Group Points. Every one wins if one of the players reach Joseph's Cafe. Everyone loses if Group points reaches zero or Jason gets to Joseph's Cafe before any player.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Search and Survive
description:
Search and Survive is a cooperative, zombie apocalypse deck building game for 1-4 players. In Search and Survive players must work together to rescue survivors, gather resources, and complete objectives; all while attempting to keep the growing zombie threat in check. The zombies have unique abilities to challenge players with, and the Horde moves towards the players with the potential of moving off of the play area and damaging them.

Unlike many games within the deck building genre, Search and Survive offers a unique combat system that blends card values with dice rolls. Failed attacks, zombie advancement, and zombie abilities can all cause players to take Damage cards. These cards not only dilute a player's deck, but are also a finite resource. If any one player takes their 10th Damage Card the game ends in defeat.

In Search and Survive players must decide how far they want to push their luck on their turns. As ammunition depletes attacks become more dangerous. Melee attacks must also be considered carefully as close combat is riskier than ranged, but also has some powerful rewards. As combat resolves players take the spoils of war and add them to their decks, increasing their strength.

Players must work together to complete the objective of the session. Rescued survivors, locations, useful items, and powerful weapons must be combined to ensure the survival of the human race.

name: Interdimensional Travel Agency
description:
"Dream up your next reality, and we'll take care of all the details!"

In Interdimensional Travel Agency, each player plays as a travel agent responsible to manipulate an interdimensional gateway to create alternate realms explicitly tailored to various travelers' designs. At the beginning of the game, each agent must choose two Travelers to attempt to satisfy, in secret. On each turn, a player plays cards from their hand in one of three ways: As a dimensional "trait" that they configuring the gateway with, as an action that manipulates the gateway or players' hands, or as a discard to be replaced.

Once a Traveler is satisfied, it is revealed and added to the discard pile. The game is over when one player has satisfied both of their assigned Travelers!
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Advanced Platoon Leader
description: Advanced Platoon Leader (APL) takes the basic game Platoon Leader to a whole new level. Gone is the single map which is replaced with terrain cards that will allow you to configure a ton of map variations. The detail and number of options have also been ramped up such that this game is guaranteed to be better than ever!
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Roar of War
description:
Roar of War is a tactical card battle game for 2-4 players. You will play as one of the four race leaders and try to locate and defeat your rivals’ King or Queen. Each race has asymmetrical Attack / Defence / Counterattack Powers; therefore, a different strategy applies for each player. Orcs and Humans have balanced Attack and Defence Power whereas Elves have high Attack Power and Dwarves have high Defence Power. With each turn, players will have the chance to try different strategies and cover their King/Queen to win the game.

Roar of War packs pure Strategy Game mechanics and beautiful art in one box. Each additional copy of Roar of War adds 4 more players to the game and enables large team plays.

The goal is to eliminate your rivals by attacking and defeating their King or Queen cards. The last player with the King/Queen card wins the game.

name: Stashed: Accumulated Treasures
description:
Stashed - A Solitaire Card Game

The Story So Far...
You step inside your collection room to admire your lovingly collected treasures when you notice that instead of them being neatly organised into their trays they are scattered all over the place. Your precious items are in a mess and you need to get them sorted, luckily you have a system!

You have a deck of item cards that must be organised into designated spaces. If you can complete them all you win!

You also have some special actions that may be used to help you achieve your goal. Stashed is designed to be played by a single player, and can be played in around 15 mins. Co-operative variant rules are also included so you can play with a friend (or three)

name: Race to the White House
description:
From the publisher:

Race to the White House is a sophisticated two-player simulation of the upcoming presidential election. Its mechanics are board-and-card driven with some dice-influenced results; the game flow is controlled by action and reaction cards, dice rolling, hand management, and area influence. A quirky, humorous tone keeps the mood light, despite the deep gameplay.

The game takes place over the final eight weeks of the campaign and concludes with the assignment of electoral votes on Election Night. Each player chooses a candidate they are trying to propel to victory. Play as one of the leading lights of the 2016 campaign, or bring back a proven winner! Some candidates are better at speaking, some bring more skill at fundraising, some are from swing states, and others are simply rich.

Each week is divided into two turns, one for each player, and is affected by an environment card that may temporarily alter the cost or effect of your actions. You’ll begin with five action cards, representing various things you can do during that week’s campaign, such as uncover a scandal, criticize Cuba, collect an endorsement, or even start a war. You’ll also start with five state cards, which determine where you can play your action cards. Each turn gives you the opportunity to draw or purchase new and more powerful action cards, some of which can be combined to extraordinary effect.

Each week you’ll spend time and energy visiting swing states, building up influence points that hopefully will lead to winning that state on election night. If you build up enough influence, you’ll get momentum in that state, which will make it harder for your opponent to come back—but be careful; spend too much time in any one place and they’ll start to get sick of you.

Have you sold out to major donors to finance your campaign? Of course you have! This gives you money, which you can spend on state or national advertising. Again, this can give you momentum, but you risk overexposure.

You can do all sorts of things in Race to the White House by playing Action Cards. You can come out against the Keystone XL pipeline (if you’re a Democrat) or promise more mining permits (if you’re a Republican). If your party is in office, you can start a war, or respond to a major natural disaster—but be careful; either one can backfire badly, and your opponent might have an October Surprise ready. You can cheer for a swing state’s baseball team in the World Series, or you can stick your opponent with bad weather. You can uncover a scandal in state government that puts a safe state in play, or you can send hecklers into your opponent’s rallies that neutralizes their effects. It feels just as crazy, exciting, and dirty as an actual campaign!

Over the course of eight weeks, you’ll build up a strong position in some swing states, and if you’ve been smart about it, you’ll have managed to play defense and prevent your opponent from doing the same. But you never really know, do you? When election night rolls around, you’ll be on the edge of your seat waiting for the networks to call the states in the order that their polls close. Some states will be easy, but others will be too close to call, potentially until early in the morning. If you’re behind, do you concede and save some victory points? Or do you hang on until the bitter end? It’s all up to you… in Race to the White House!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: The Pursuit Card Game
description:
"Ever since you became aware of that laptop, and the stolen data held within it, you have been caught up in a dangerous game of cat and mouse. The company, from whom the data has been stolen, are offering a substantial reward for return of their laptop; a reward some people are willing to kill for.
If you are to stay alive, you will need rely on the support of emergency services, acquire weapons to protect yourself, and hope that your mysterious guardian angel is watching over you.
So find the laptop and keep hold of it until the end of the day to claim your reward"

The Pursuit, is a fast paced card game for which is best with 3 or more players, but can be played with 2 people.
Players will take it in turns to draw a card, or play a card, trying to acquire the Target Card (a laptop containing stolen data). Once a player has possession of the Target Card they will soon discover that keeping hold of it is a different challenge as their opponents steal, and attack, to gain the advantage.

name: Konflikt '47: US Army Starter Set
description:
As World War II continues beyond 1945, the battling countries have become even more desperate to develop new super weapons to give them a winning advantage. Exploiting new technologies revealed from the first nuclear explosions, the Axis and Allied forces quickly develop new tanks and strange armoured walkers to become the vanguard of their armies, supported by new highly equipped or terribly twisted troops. With the Soviet Union seceding from the Allies the war now becomes a three-way conflict!

Konflikt ’47 is a standalone game inspired by the hugely successful Bolt Action, designed by Clockwork Goblin Miniatures and produced by Warlord Games and Osprey Publishing. Adding to the core rules that many gamers are familiar with from Bolt Action, Konflikt ’47 allows the addition of completely new types of units and models to existing 28mm Bolt Action armies and the creation of completely new forces set in the alternate future of 1947.

Konflikt ’47 introduces ‘Weird War’ weaponry – including the stunning range of walkers and other mechanical monstrosities!

Contains:

A5 softback Konflikt '47 rulebook
1 M5A2 Coyote light walker
1 M4A9 Sherman-T medium tank
20 US infantry
5 US heavy infantry
pin markers
6 six-sided dice
6 Orders dice
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: Jean Grey
description: A founding member of the X-Men, a mutant with telepathic and telekinetic powers and the love interest of Cyclops and later his wife. She is both a caring and nurturing person, but also has to deal with being one of the most powerful mutants around and is in a constant struggle to control her powers. An Omega-level mutant, that once she could not control it took on the physical manifestation of the cosmic Phoenix Force or Dark Phoenix.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Mystic Miners
description:
High in the Mountains of Daggerstone, There once existed the most amazing city. A great and wealthy city, Lost. Swallowed up by the very mountains that acted as its strongest defense from invasion. Though its name has been lost to the ages, its legend lives on. Some say, deep within the mountain’s caverns, deep within The City’s ruins, The City’s greatest treasure remains. The Allstone. A gemstone so saturated with magical energy, that whomever possesses it can do the impossible. It’s also REALLY shiny.
Now, The best Petramancers in all the land race to find The City and lay claim to The Allstone.

Players draw Ore Cards in order to claim Tool Cards with matching ore types. Claiming Tool Cards earn you Depth Points. First Player to 10 Depth is the winner

name: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: Iron Man Mk44 Hulkbuster Armor
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Mark XLIV Armour, better known as the Hulkbuster, is Tony Stark's forty-fourth Iron Man suit, made with the help of Bruce Banner for use in case Banner lost control of his alter-ego, Hulk. It is a modular suit that is operated from within while being linked to the Mark XLIII Armour. This armour is launched from an orbital tracking platform, known as Veronica. This modular suit of armour has many of the traits of the classic Iron Man armour and a few impressive upgrades to take on the Incredible Hulk. These include, Advanced Strength, Advanced Durability, Flying, Repulsor Beams, Prehensile Technology, Grappling Hook, Extended Punches, Chemical Spray and Missiles.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Tube Heroes Racers
description:
You've seen them all over YouTube, now they're racing on your table top!

Tube Heroes Racers, the mobile racing game app, has been transformed into a fast-paced card game! Race Tube Heroes DanTDM, Captain Sparkles, Ssundee, Vikkstar123, ExplodingTNT, and Ali-A are all in a fantastic race to the finish line, but watch out for mines, tarantulas, and lost penguins! Play Pit Crew cards to trap your opponents and blast through the track with booster cards!
categories: Card Game, Racing, Video Game Theme

name: As Seen in the Sky
description:
Description from the publisher:

You and your fellow midshipmen are fresh recruits on a British frigate heading to the West Indies. As part of your training, you have been tasked with the navigation of the ship. Compete against your peers to see who can guide the ship on the best course.

In As Seen in the Sky, each player must use their skill to reveal stars and gain way to the vessel's destination. As you practice, you will gain skill and learn tricks to outwit your fellow midshipmen. Earn points while revealing stars and if you can, reveal your hidden constellations to give you a step up on the competition. There will be many challenges in your wake before this trip is over, with squalls and seas that will push your limits. Many can learn the trade, but only one of you can expect a promotion. Who will it be?

On your turn, the player will roll a die to see what the current sea conditions are. Then based on the sea state, the player can use talents they have acquired to manipulate tiles in the night sky, move talents around on their player board, lock visible star coordinates in the sky, gain skill for adding talents to their arsenal, or gain course points for getting your ship closer to its destination. Before handing the die to the next player, you can take one visible unlocked tile from the night sky and place it in their play area, paying the skill needed for the placement. The game ends when all the tiles in the sky have been revealed. Players then reveal their completed constellations to gain bonus course points and the player with the highest course points is declared the winner.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Assimilation
description:
Description from the publisher:

Enter a futuristic utopia. You are a citizen living an idyllic life among your fellow Cybrids when the entire world falls apart around you.

A sinister force known only as The Machine has sent a wave of corrupting Drone programs to infiltrate your safe haven, absorbing you one by one. To save yourselves, you must deactivate the drones before all of you are assimilated.

Use intuition, items, special abilities and blind luck to solve the mystery and save your peaceful city! Play as a citizen, drone, or special character who can use special abilities to help or hinder the search. Item cards add to the chaos and fun!

Each round you have a chance to find and eliminate the drones but be careful: you can eliminate normal citizens too! If all the citizens are eliminated you lose.

Accuse. Eliminate. Win.

Or face Assimilation.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Murder/Mystery, Negotiation, Party Game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Player Elimination, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Datopolis
description:
Datopolis is a board game about open data. It's set in a fictional town called Sheridan.

Sheridan is gradually declining as shops close, teachers quit, hedgehogs go extinct and pollution rises. Can you work together to create apps, services, research and devices using data to turn the town around? Datopolis is a game for two to five players where you take turns to contribute to a town’s data infrastructure and create tools that use it. You’ll need to trade and negotiate with each other to improve life in Sheridan and win!

Datopolis has both a warm up version and a full version of the game. In the warm up version, players lay tiles (datasets) to match patterns on tool cards and negotiate with each other to exchange and open data. The first player to build ten points of tools wins. In the full version, players take on roles that change how they negotiate with each other, and their incentives to win. Bad things are happening in the town, and players need to keep the social, economic and environmental health of Sheridan from declining.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Tile Placement, Trading

name: Optimo+
description:
Game description from the designer:

Optimo+ is the reimplementation of Optimo! It contains the base game and an expansion for younger players (7+) with different cards and rules, but using the same mechanism.

Optimo! is a fast-paced word game in which you have to be the quickest to find the best word with each round's setting. In each round, you have a combination of six cards with constraints (letter or lexical). These constraints can be a requirement (i.e. you must use the letter "E" or you must have six letters in the word) or a ban (i.e. you can't use verbs or you can't have a word with 4 or less letters). Then you must find a word that corresponds to at least 4 constraints, then trigger the timer to give the other players 30 seconds more to find a better word than yours. Pondering if you should find a 5(or 6)-constraint word or go fast with a 4-constraint word to get the fastest-player bonus but risk losing it all to a better word is the core mechanic of the game.

Optimo kids is an easy and fast-aced word game in which you have a combination of 4 cards with constraints (letter, lexical and theme) which can be requirements or bans. Players must find a word that fits the 4 constraints or launch a "dare" to the other players, leaving them 30 seconds to come up with a word or else, the "darer" wins the round.

name: O.O.P.Art.
description:
INTRODUCTION AND PURPOSE OF THE GAME

In several parts of the world there are many unsolved mysteries, with the presence of mysterious artifacts, the so-called O.O.P.Art. (Out Of Place Artifacts) and other evidence left by ancient entities.
Scientists from different disciplines and different places in the world, to solve these mysteries, should work together to formulate hypotheses that may initially seem bizarre.
This game is a journey through the O.O.P.Art. and in the mental faculties, to formulate a fantastic hypothesis of solutions to the many still unsolved mysteries. The U.F.O. and the Crop-Circle (Crop circles), represent the last still undeciphered signs to have a possible interpretations.
In the role of "Illuminati" men with particular mental powers, you will have to travel to the world sites where Crop-Circles have appeared and find the Artifacts (oopart), increase your mental energy, discover the key to understanding them to accumulate Knowledge Points.
.... before the "Ancient Astronauts" return to Earth !!!
Man uses only 5% of his mental abilities. What man perceives of the world with his senses is only a small part. Some men are gifted, or have developed particular mental faculties for which they have a more accentuated way of perceiving, Gustavo Adolfo Rol was an enlightened example, and we dedicate this game to him.
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Movement, Grid Movement, Memory, Set Collection

name: ATS: The Fight For Hue – Apex of The Vietnam War
description:
The Advanced Tobruk System returns to Vietnam with this recreation of the bitter street fighting in the city of Hue, January 31, 1968.
An all new, super detailed map was commissioned for this project, on which tactical-level gamers will battle tooth and nail over The Ming Ca Garrison, The Tay Loc airfield, The Imperial Palace...all the landmarks are there. A selection of all-new scenarios and all of the combat counters required to play out this epic struggle are included.
Ownership of the ATS Rulebook and standard system markers are required

name: Interregnum
description:
A card game of courtly politics and intrigue
His Royal Majesty is dying. Stricken with sudden illness our king failed to anoint a successor. Now a ruthless game begins between his sons, daughters and bastards.

Outmaneuver your rivals.
Gain support of key figures at the court.
Become the next king.

In Interregnum, 3-5 players strive to build a coterie of influential nobles, courtiers and soldiers who will support their claim to the throne. Important members of the court can help persuade others to join your cause, but even lowly servants often hear rumours that you may use as leverage.
Other contenders will use whatever influence they have to stop you, so rotten compromises and short-term alliances will be necessary on the way.

On each of his turns the active player chooses one character card he wishes to recruit and one or more cards that strengthen the bid. Other players may then decide to forfeit cards from their hands in order to block the recruitment.

On a successful recruitment the character (card) stays in play and provides ongoing benefits as well as Power (VP) to the owner.

Once a player gathers enough Power he or she may proclaim victory.

Only if you play your cards right and outsmart the competition - the crown will be yours.

name: 2349: Space Prospectors
description:
2349: Space Prospectors takes place in the year 2349. A cluster of Asteroids have been discovered near a distant colony. These asteroids are rich in a rare mineral called Unobtainium and a 24th century version of a “gold rush” has begun.

To begin, players flick asteroids, including a home base asteroid onto the playing field.

Players take on the role of Prospectors. Controlling up 4 ships, players expend fuel cards to fly ships from their home camp asteroid to unexplored and unclaimed asteroids. Ships land on the asteroids and, using the fuel cards, drill into these lumps of rock to extract the Unobtainium.
In the spirit of the Wild West, each player wants to lay claim to asteroids with the largest Unobtainium amounts. Beware, opponents can wrestle control of your asteroids using show-downs and claim-jumps.

Worm hole cards are drawn at the end of each turn that can cause mechanical failures, alien encounters, navigation errors, fuel caches, gamma radiation and disruption of the asteroid field as new asteroids are flicked into the playing area.

The Game ends when a Cruiser carrying the Colonial Governor arrives to establish Law and Order. Whomever controls the asteroids with the highest Unobtainium values wins. Beware the Alien Invasion where controlling 2 Alien Asteroids wins the game!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Point to Point Movement

name: Salvage
description: Salvage is a space-themed strategy game where you collect sets of stray 'Ship Parts' from the board. Armed with Movement, Rotation, Attack, and Defense cards, players maneuver between debris to outwit and disarm their opponents. The first player to put their ship back together and escape wins!
categories: Fighting, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Queue, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Control Alt Deceit: A Game of Lies, Betrayal and Questionable Business Strategies
description:
Ready to Test Your CEO Instincts?

The year is 1983… Your friends made a terrible decision. They entered your market.

To win, you’ll have to take your tiny business public. You’ll need a product, clients, marketing and enough capital to survive the onslaught.

Will you be Beta or VHS?

How it Works

Control Alt Deceit is best played with 3 to 5 players. It’s also best played with a drink or two, but that’s more up to you. ;-)


To begin, each player draws a unique Unfair Advantage card giving his business a super power of sort.
Players get 2 actions per turn. They can decide to build their business and attack their competitors.
As the business grows in market value, players must acquire Product, First Client and Marketing cards.
To win the game, a player must file for an IPO (and go public).
After announcing an IPO, things get really interesting... as the player needs to stay on top, fend off the competitors and avoid being undercut by another player going public.
The winner gets the bragging rights and gets to start the next game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That, Trading

name: Bounty Brawl
description:
Become COSMIC bounty hunters. In a SCI-FI, Board & Card game Hybrid; created by Aaron Bonkowski.

The craziest, toughest bounty hunters the galaxy has ever seen will collide in this game. They will risk it all to collect some of the most villainous criminals in the pursuit of cold hard space cash! And a relaxing retirement.

The objective of the game is to be the first hunter to collect 3 bounties. Collect a bounty by being the first to eliminate one with a variety of attack and survival cards. Choosing when to strike and when to defend is key because you may just win by being the sole survivor.

name: Ophidian 2360: People's Champion
description:
Mini-expansion for the successful Ophidian 2360 Futuristic Gladiator Combat Game! Original mechanics, great art, with nods to the 2016 US presidential election.

This small expansion adds additional Minions, Quick-Hits, Pumps, and more, including an entirely new keyword-based subtheme!
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Simulation, Variable Phase Order

name: Battle of France Junior
description:
The game represents one air battle from the time of the Battle of France, May 1940. Planes M.S.406, D.520, B.152, VG-33, P36 and Hurricane fight against Messerschmitt Bf-109.

The main characteristic is that the game board is covered with a net of equilateral triangles. The vertices of these triangles are points at which players hold the position and move figurines.

The objective is to shoot down all enemy planes. One figurine can shoot on enemy figurine by moving behind it. The game continues until one player runs out of the plane.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II

name: Globality
description:
Globalization has been present in our society for thousands of years but its impacts appear in everyday life much more intensively due to the achievements of the “modern age”.
