Globality is a civilization game, in which you are in charge of your country gaining victory points by improving it. To make things more challenging the countdown of the last 60 minutes on the anarchy clock – whose global impacts affect each player alike – has already begun.

Environmental pollution, corruption, exploitation, mafia connections, global conflicts and your “ecological footprint” equally increase anarchy. But who will benefit from the consequences of the anarchy?

You may as well be the most influential, but be careful! Do not go too far because your opponents may turn against you.

name: Elements & Idols
description:
Description from the publisher:

Elements and Idols is a deck building game where you must harness the power of Fire, Air, Earth and Water to succeed Chief Turlock as the next leader of a small island village.

Elements and Idols is all about timing and balance. Make too many sacrifices and you won't have enough resources to recruit allies or acquire idols. Don't make enough sacrifices and when it's time for the new moon, you won't be able to pay proper tribute to Hngi, the god of this island.

Unlike traditional deckbuilders, in Elements and Idols your deck isn't your score but rather a tool for scoring throughout the game.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Notorious
description:
Notorious is a strategic dice drafting, resource management, set collection game. You'll draft new crew members and complete heists to earn the most Notoriety points to win the game.

You started as a small-time hood. But you know to become king of this city, you’ll need a crew. Assemble the right team, complete heists, and gain notoriety. As you finish more jobs, the heat on you becomes stronger. If one of your squad gets pinched, you can always work the system with a bribe, or just let them go to the slammer. Outlast your rivals and see if you have what it takes to become the most NOTORIOUS.

Gameplay:
As a new boss, you will complete small jobs by rolling dice. You’ll use the earnings (jewels) from these small jobs to buy new members to join your crew. These Crew members will combine their abilities together to allow you to complete larger Heists. Every Heist you complete will earn you Notoriety points to win the game.

On your turn, you can do any 2 of the following:
1. Roll dice (completing small jobs)
2. Draft up to 2 crew cards
3. Complete up to 2 heists

Rolling Dice - If you roll dice, you roll your choice of 2 of the 3 colored dice (red, blue, and green), and roll 1 of the 2 black and white dice. You can keep and/or re-roll any of the dice once, so that’s a total of 2 total rolls.

Dice representation: Blue die = Sapphires. Green die = Emeralds. Red die = Rubies. The diamond shape represents a Diamond. The Flame shape represents Surveillance. The Star on the Black die represents the player earning a Jewel of the player’s choice.

Drafting Crew Cards – The cost of the Crew Card is detailed in the upper left portion of the card. You can pay the jewel cost (earned from rolling dice), and that crew member is now part of your crew. You will play that Crew Card on the table in front of you. A new Crew Card replaces the drafted Crew Card on the table. - Each crew member has attributes which will help players complete Heists. Some crew members have special abilities which will improve your abilities, or hinder the play of your competitors.

Completing Heists – If you have enough attributes from your collective Crew Cards, you may complete the Heists. The Heist requirements are detailed at the bottom of the Heist Card. You will add your Crew Card attributes together, and if those attributes total to at least the minimum required for each Heist requirement, you may complete the Heist. You will take the Heist card and keep it on the table in front of you. A new Heist Card is placed face up on the table to replace any Heist Card taken by a player. Each Heist Card has a Notoriety point value at the top right. The first player to earn at least 21 Notoriety points wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: EverZone: Colony Assault
description:
Description from the publisher:

Plan your battle. Marshal your armies. Eliminate the opponent.

EverZone is a strategic card game set in a distant future. Each player is in command of forces in order to defend his race and expand the control in the universe. Three races (Numan, Slurr and Uthron, most commonly distinguished between humans, aliens and robots) fight for the galaxy on different battlefields: uncharted lands, seas of planets and in the cold space.
The game's goal is destroying the opponent's "headquarters" by reducing to zero his command points (same as life points). To achieve this, players have 330 cards between units, supports and locations in order to build their own forces deck to use in battle against opponents, in the locations determined by each player. EverZone introduces a revolutionary game mechanism to minimize random elements, creating extremely tactical challenges.

EverZone: Colony Assault is not a mere expansion of a game already published some time ago, but it's a sort of EverZone 2.0.
In this new game you will have:

A new and more complete rulebook,
330 brand new cards with balanced and refined powers to give you a more exciting gaming experience.
A stand alone box, so that you won't necessarily need the basic game to play EverZone, but you can combine both of them to have wider strategies.


Besides, a third kind of card will be introduced: the structures.

Structures are paid by your own command points (or life points) and remain in the battlefield with permanent powers for your army until they are destroyed by opposing attacks.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Player Elimination, Simulation

name: Bushido: Ito Clan Starter Set
description: The Ito clan have long been the laughing stock of the ruling clans. Never quite able to understand it is their own flaws which hold their greater ambitions back. Being untrustworthy is synonymous with the Ito their support of the Shiho’s rise to power followed by their treacherous role in the Dragon Wars against the very same clan, highlights their fickle nature. Now though the Ito have gone through a transformation, their alliance with an age old and powerful Kami has imbued them with a new found strength. If it was the Kami that caused the snake like changes or whether it has simply exaggerated the Ito’s natural affinity is unknown. What is sure is that the Ito finally have the power to rise against the other clans and avenge the mockery and mistreatment they have suffered.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Comrades in Battle
description:
A table-top miniatures game of skirmish combat in the American Civil War. Rule Book and Card Deck. 28 mm scale metal Miniatures available.

A card regulated game using miniature figures with historically accurate uniforms and equipment. Only a small number of figures are required for play. The players will supply their own table-top scenery.

A small game can be over in two or three hours.
categories: American Civil War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: PM GALAXY: A Project Management Board Game
description:
PM Galaxy is a board game that has been developed as a tool to facilitate the learning of project management concepts in a fun and engaging way. It is intended for project management trainers and consultants, project managers, project team leaders and team members. Basically, for all those involved in projects who want to improve their project management knowledge while having a great time together with their team! The Game is available (for now) in English and Romanian languages.

It is a collaborative and competitive board game for 3 to 5 players, where each player, alias „project manager”, takes control of a distinctive project. Although each project manager fights to be the first one to complete his or her project, these projects are interdependent and share, as it always happens, limited resources. The task of each project manager is to guide their projects through its phases, gathering resources by answering quizzes and investing those resources to overcome challenges.

We built PM Galaxy to cover both the fun part (the secret ingredient to building a team) and the educational part as well. It can be anything you want – a board game to play with your team, a learning tool, a training instrument, you name it. PM Galaxy is meant to help players learn and remember key concepts of project management and best practices in the field, by testing their knowledge and rewarding them for their efforts in a fun and engaging way.

We also have been using the game in our project management training sessions with great success. The participants love it and it adds a nice twist to the classic project management training. The game can be used throughout the whole training with debrief sessions or at the end as a Recap tool.

The goal of the game, which was developed based on the Project Management Institute standards, is to gather all necessary project documents and resources for your project, while also helping the project you depend on, in order to win. Or you could just look after yourself and hope for the best or sabotage the other players, but we strongly advise against it. From our experience so far this approach didn’t prove fruitful, neither in the PM Galaxy nor in real life :)
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: La Dimensión de NITRAM
description:
Martin and his friends gathered to try out a strange board game someone left on their doorstep on the occasion of their birthday. Nobody knew the origin of that game but, Martin, a fan of any table game even if it seems boring, convinced everyone to play it. When they opened the board, all fo them were absorbed by an obscure portal that transported them to the Nitram's Dimension. This strange place seems to be related to Martin, however nothing is what it seems. The only thing they have in mind is that to return they must find a portal similar to the one that brought them. Here there are no friends, only rivals trying to escape this dangerous dimension.

During the game, the players roll the dices, advance in the map, find items & events, fight against monsters & Nitrams, and travel through other portals.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy, Humor, Party Game

name: Konflikt '47: Soviet Starter Set
description:
March 1947. As Europe emerges from the worst winter in living memory the Soviet war machine is replenished and ready for action. 1946 was not the greatest year for The Motherland, although the German invaders were repulsed in their efforts to invade. After reverses before the winter set in, the Soviet war machine is now ready to roll west and crush the German foes before them.

The tireless efforts of brave Soviet scientists have meant the technology of the enemy is now available against them. The Cossack walker is fast and carries a heavy cannon, able to defeat it's recce counterparts at distance, and the new Heavy Infantry suits can tear apart infantry or vehicles with equal ease.

More fearsome is the sonic pulse cannon that has been fitted to the trusty T-34 medium tank - no target is safe from its effects. The Germans may have prepared themselves over the harsh winter but they face a relentless juggernaut as the spring thaws begin.

The Soviet Starter Set Contains:

A5 softback Konflikt'47 rulebook
1 Cossack light walker
1 T-34/ZP medium tank
40 Soviet infantry
5 Soviet heavy infantry
Pin Markers
6 six-sided dice
7 Orders dice
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Black Metal
description:
Black Metal is a solitaire adventure game that is set in a dark wintry realm. The player oversees several game characters as they fulfill missions in this challenging environment. These characters represent a declining pagan population that is caught between the New Religion and the spiteful counter-religion known as the Growing Evil. This latter division includes ruffians, malicious necromancers, the infamous NecroFiend occultists, and demons from foul depths.

The game is divided into 3 stages to represent the different missions to be undertaken. Each mission/stage involves coping with the New Religion in some way. In the first stage you seek to undo damage created by the New Religion. In the second stage you must impede the New Religion. And finally the third stage requires that you directly confront the New Religion.

GAME-PLAY:
Player guided characters will travel on a map that is generated by land tiles. These tiles are drawn and placed as the characters move from turn to turn. At the same time, game controlled characters known as NecroFiends will be spawned; eventually traveling the tile map through an automated movement system. When player characters run into a NecroFiend, conflict is likely to occur.

In addition to NecroFiends, opposition can emerge through the Occurrence deck (from entering a tile) or through the Demon deck (upon exiting a tile). These encounters gnaw away at a character's vital resource --their followers. Followers are represented by purple cubes. When a game character (aka Leader) takes losses due to conflict, some or all of their followers are removed. A lack of followers makes a character extremely vulnerable and will often lead to elimination from the game if more followers cannot be acquired soon.

Combat in the world of Black Metal is resolved through two means, Brute Conflict and DarkArts Conflict. The former combat type is associated with physical conflict and uses a Combat Results Table involving up to three 4-sided dice. The latter combat type is associated with sorcery and uses a simpler system involving the combatants INSIGHT ratings and a single 4-sided die.

OBJECT:
The player aims to fulfill at least one mission during the game. The game offers the opportunity to perform up to three missions. Missions are drawn from a deck and will describe locations that must be visited, along with actions that must be performed at these locations. Actions often include a special die roll procedure to solidify the outcome. The third mission will always involve conflict (using the game's conflict resolution system).

WINNING THE GAME:
To win Black Metal a player must fulfill every mission that is embarked upon. There are 3 levels of success --one for each mission that you accomplish. The game is lost if all player characters perish during the performance of a mission, regardless of how many missions have been completed. The earned titles of success are as follows:

1 Mission Fulfilled = Hero Status
2 Missions Fulfilled = Liberator Status
3 Missions Fulfilled = Legend Status

Without losing, you may end a game after any mission (but before another has begun).

name: ATS Stalingrad Basic Game I
description:
From the company website:

WELCOME TO ATS STALINGRAD BASIC GAME I. A fast-playing and straightforward way to get into the ATS system, nominated for Board Wargame of the Year and still growing and going strong. Everything you need to play is included, just bring a 10-sided die. You get 176 color, die-cut counters depicting German and Russian soldiers, officers, NCOs, and weapons + 140 small marker counters + 54 large markers; 383 counters in all! You also get ‘the battlefield’, a 4-board map with LARGE hexes, depicting Stalingrad—what better place to hone your skills. What’s more, while it’s all here for the beginner, this product is also perfect for the experienced ATSer, as all the materials are BRAND NEW, never published, and ready for a higher level player to use to test his or her skills!

THIS IS A COMPLETE GAME! All you need is a 10 sided die and an interest in World War II history to play.

name: Star Wars: The Deckbuilder – Rebels
description:
Description from the designer:

This expansion adds characters, locations and equipment from the Rebels cartoon series. It also includes new emotions that blend the game towards more decisive combats & thematically moves into the 'gray' areas of the force.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Pariah Expansion
description:
The Pariah expansion adds a new nemesis to your campaign! This intelligent and malicious monster slaughters the survivors in two completely different ways. First on the ground, at the doorstep of the settlement. And then again, high on the inverted mountain in a daring upside-down battle! The Pariah's toe-strength is so great that it can effortlessly scale the sheerest of inverted surfaces with ease. Running through mazes of iron ring pitons that the Pariah has secured over many lantern years as desperate survivors dangle above death.
The Pariah will halt your campaign until defeated!

Contains:

1 x Pariah miniature (50mm)
1 x Serious-Mode Pariah miniature (50mm)
4 x upside-down narrative sculpts survivor miniatures
3 x Innovation cards
3 x Fighting cards
1 x Secret Fighting art card
1 x Inverted Mountain rings token sheet
120 x game cards
1 x Settlement location
3 x Settlement Events
20-page rulebook
20 x gear cards
...and more!
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Black Knight Expansion
description:
In addition to being integrated into the main game, this expansion includes an alternate short-format campaign (5 year campaign), playing as squires that service the black knight in secret!

Includes:
1 x Black Knight (50mm base)
4 x Squires narrative sculpts
3 x Black knight armor narrative sculpts
6 x Innovation cards
5 x Fighting Arts
2 x Secret Fighting Arts
5 x Disorders
60 x game cards
1 x Settlement location
3 x Settlement events
30-page rulebook
60 x gear cards
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Korsbæk
description:
Compete with friends and family members to become the most successful successor to Mads Skjern's business empire! A game of trivia questions based on the successful Television series "Matador". Special questions are available to children playing the game with little or no prerequisites for answering Matador specific questions.

This game builds on questions previously used in other games with the same theme, but has a new different gaming mechanics:

All players start out with a suitcase with which they travel round the board. Players earn money by answering questions of varying difficulty. Special fields on the game board, allow the players to advance from the suitcase to a small house, eventually reaching the 3 storage warehouse that Mads Skjerns ends with in the television series as well as allow the players to interact by moving the player tokens on the board, stealing money from players etc.

The winner is the first player with a 3 storage warehouse to pass the starting field on the board.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: HMS Leander 1780 / HMS Adamant 1780
description:
Description from the publisher:

HMS Leander, launched at Chatham on 1 July 1780, served on the west coast of Africa, West Indies, and the Halifax station. During the French Revolutionary Wars, HMS Leander participated in the Battle of the Nile and was captured by French, then captured again by Russians and Turks. On 25 April 1805 cannon fire from Leander killed an American seaman with the resulting “Leander Affair” that contributed to the worsening of relations between the USA and Great Britain. In 1813 Leander was converted to a hospital ship under the name Hygeia.

This ship pack can also be used to represent the British Portland Class “HMS Adamant 1780.”

Ship pack contains a new ship with base, ship card, ship log, and specific deck of maneuver cards.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Player Elimination, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Regimental Fire and Fury: Civil War Battle Scenarios Volume 2 – 1862-1863
description:
Give history a second chance and lead the breakout at Fort Donelson, stand with the Iron Brigade in its finest moment on McPherson's Ridge, and charge with General Barksdale into the Peach Orchard.

The second volume in our series is a full-color, 80-page softback book, offering 13 early and mid-war battle scenarios to go with your Regimental Fire and Fury rulebook. Each scenario comes with a detailed battlefield map, a complete order of battle with unit labels, and the special rules and content you need to set up and play each game. The book also has a section of optional rules.

SCENARIOS:
Fort Donelson Breakout, February 15, 1862
Battle of Valverde, February 21, 1862
Battle of McDowell, May 8, 1862
Battle of Mechanicsville, June 26, 1862
Fox's Gap: Morning, Battle of South Mountain, September 14, 1862
Fox's Gap: Afternoon
Battle of Salem Church, May 3, 1863
McPherson's Ridge: Morning, Battle of Gettysburg, July 1, 1863
McPherson's Ridge: Afternoon
Sickles' Salient, Battle of Gettysburg, July 2, 1863
Caldwell Clears the Wheatfield, Battle of Gettysburg, July 2, 1863
Viniard Field, Battle of Chickamauga, September 19, 1863
Tunnel Hill, Battle of Chattanooga, November 25, 1863

This book only contains scenario information. The Regimental Fire and Fury Rulebook is needed to play these scenarios.
categories: American Civil War, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Dust Tactics: Steel Guard Fire Support Squad – "Steel  Wall"
description:
Description from the publisher:

The soldiers of the Steel Guard are battle-hardened veterans who have been gravely wounded in combat. These guys now have the chance to fight again, thanks to the latest Sino-Soviet Union technology for human enhancement. Their broken bodies are placed into a steel sarcophagus, which becomes their sanctuary. It keeps them alive and, most of all, keeps them fighting for the Motherland.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Mike & Joe's Card Game
description:
Description from the publisher:

Mike & Joe’s Card Game is a fast-paced challenge for 2-6 players that combines THREE GAMES into one madcap session. The object of the game is to be the first player to gather seven cards of the same color, red, green or blue. Cards are accumulated through victories in any of the three games, Patter, Peril or Pointz.

Before each turn, players submit their Player Cards, face-down. Then the current player flips over the top card of the Draw Deck, the House Card, revealing the game for that turn.

If the game is Patter, the current player has but a few seconds, counted down by their opponents, to create a word from the letters on the revealed cards. They win the cards from whatever word they make.

If the game is Peril, the current player pits the Battle Icon on their Player Card against the icon on their opponent's card. If more than one opponent challenges, the player conducts Semifinals until only one challenger remains. The winner receives the Peril Prize, either two or three cards.

If they game is Pointz, the current player uses their finger to move along the board game squares on the bottom of the Player Cards. If they land on a pointing challenge, they have but a few seconds, again counted down by opponents, to point at the indicated item.

The first player to gather seven cards of the same color in their bank wins the game and is held in awe by the other players.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Roll / Spin and Move

name: My Queen's Quest
description:
Description from the publisher:

My Queen’s Quest is a tactical luck driven card game with 108 game cards. The pack contains 16 beautifully illustrated characters and 64 different countries. Our characters are designed by the wonderful artist Daisy Spiers. It’s supercharged, empire building Uno!

Perfect for two to four players, ages 5+, Quick to set up and 20-30 minutes of fun for all the family.

WICKED HOW TO!

To start play, you collect a Queen and once shuffled, place the rest of the deck in the centre of the players. Then take it in turns to pick a card up from the centre deck. Collect the most points to win the game. However, if you pick up a hero card you can defend against attacks or a villain card you can steal points from another player

name: Rumbo
description:
IntroductionRumbo is a finite territory game for two players: Vertical and Horizontal. It's played on the intersections (points) of an initially empty square board. Both players must have access to a sufficient number of stones in two colors and a sufficient number of vertical and horizontal markers.



DefinitionsIn these rules, "adjacent" always means "orthogonally adjacent".

A group is a maximal set of orthogonally connected, like-colored stones.

A liberty of a group is an empty point adjacent to it.

A hole is an empty point such that all points adjacent to it are occupied by stones of the same color.

To claim a group is to place a marker of yours on top of one of its stones.

The four orthogonal adjacencies of a point are named after the cardinal points. Vertical owns the north and south adjacencies, the pairs north-south, north-east and south-west and the triplets north-south-east and north-south-west; Horizontal owns the east and west adjacencies, the pairs east-west, north-west and south-east and the triplets east-west-north and east-west-south.



PlayVertical plays first, then turns alternate. On their turn, a player must place one stone of any color on an empty point without creating any holes. Then, each unclaimed group without liberties is claimed by the player who owns the set of adjacencies of stones in that group to the stone just placed.

The game ends when the board is full. A player's score is the total number of stones on the board in groups that they have claimed, plus a komi in the case of Horizontal. The player with the highest score wins.



KomiThe komi is the number of points which is added to Horizontal's score at the end of the game as a compensation for playing second. Before the game starts, the first player chooses the value of komi, and then the second player chooses sides. To avoid ties, the parity of komi should be different from the parity of the board size.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Chaining, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: 7s 11s: A Fast Paced Dice Game of Chance & Risk Taking
description:
Description from the publisher:

7s 11s is a dice scoring game where players take turns rolling three dice to make combinations that add to 7 or 11. A player's roll determines who contributes chips to the pot. Players take chances to improve their roll as they try to accumulate 100 or more points while avoiding the unlucky "triple", the same number on all three dice. Win the game and the chips are yours!

name: Bushido: Ujimushi
description:
Like all novices of the Kage Kaze Zoku, Ujimushi is mercilessly and relentlessly drilled in the arts of the Kage. Although adept in all Zoku martial weapons he has chosen the short bow as his preferred weapon. On missions he strives to master the skills of the veteran ninja with whom he serves, mimicking and practising their movements to aid in his own training.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Kitsune & Fox form
description:
The Kitsune has broken from the ranks of her people by allying herself with the Temple's cause. Her mobility on the battlefield greatly improves the Temple's ability to meet their objectives.

Blister contains one Kitsune miniature, one Fox form miniature, two 30mm bases and two full colour profile cards.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Basket of Deplorables: The Board Game
description:
This is a light-hearted, humor-filled, liberal-leaning game about the state of politics from 2016 to 2020. The good guys (player pieces) are Bernie Sanders, Elizabeth Warren, Barack Obama, and Hillary Clinton. They're vying to take on Trump in 2020 and filling their Basket of Deplorables along the way. The Deplorables in this game are not meant to be an insult to Trump supporters, rather they are ghoulish caricatures of people in the Trump inner circle, i.e. Steve Bannon, Rudy Giuliani, Vladimir Putin, etc.

The players navigate the campaign trail and participate in debates, compete in primaries/caucuses, navigate scandals, seek endorsements, confer with pollsters, decide whether to run as an independent, etc. Deplorables can be drained from The Swamp and placed in each player's Basket.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Bushido: Hotaru
description:
Hotaru thanks the Kami’s for guiding her to the Temple of Ro-Kan and Master Ekusa. She has learned to contain her powers but still fears unleashing her full potential. Hotaru’s desire to control her innate abilities provides little comfort for opponents left ablaze by her fiery attacks. The Temple have found a welcome addition to their order in Hotaru.

Blister contains one miniature, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust Tactics: Maintenance Contractors – "Justine & Co"
description: For years now women have played a very important role in the war effort of every bloc, as men have been sent to the front. Some of them have even been sent close, in repair workshops or ammo dumps. They are now a common sight in fields where none would be seen just a few years ago. Justine and her team are top mechanics for hire, all from a different country of the Neutral Nations Organization.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Dust 1947: USMC War Dogs Recon Squad
description: The United States Marine Corps (USMC) has arrived! The Allies are in North Africa and the Middle East for good, and no-one is going to kick these Marines out! The fiercest fighting force on the planet is not easily scared or defeated, there's not much these guys haven't seen already in this war. The USMC uses dedicated canine squads for reconnaissance missions, but these dogs don't back out of a fight if need be! The squad is presented here in Babylon camouflage pattern, as used in the Middle-East circa 1947.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Bushido: Yuuki
description:
Description from the publisher:

Yuuki’s quickly found the name of the wind, where others hear only whistle and whisper. Yuuki hears the chatter of excited and boundless Kami. She is an able warrior and much like her element; rarely still, in play she is light and airy like a summer breeze but when called upon in battle she is a direct and relentless howling gale. Her vitality is endless and her speed astounding, her body a blur of motion as she unleashes blow after blow, an unstoppable storm of Rokan’s fury personified.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Emoji Battle with KO Expansion
description:
Make those cute little emojis fight for you.
The angel, happy, gritted teeth, sad, mad, devil and more; all your favorite emojis come out to play in this unique game where you set fellow players up to hurt themselves. It is a race to get rid of all your cards first as everyone is trying to make you fail. Unique game play lends itself to an all out battle, where any emoji might be your last.

The Knockout (KO) Expansion
Beyond the cute faces you are used to seeing, there are other emoji symbols that can help you in battle. Throw the time bomb on the table, or place a target on your greatest enemy, then dawn a shield to protect yourself. This expansion adds a collection of extra cards to make your emoji battles even better. Will you be the one to deliver the knockout punch and get rid of your cards first? Only time will tell.

Game Play
Players take turns playing emojis from their hand. Every card played has consequences based on the last card played before it. First person out of cards wins the round. After five rounds game is over. Scoring based on emojis left in your hand after every round.

name: Dust Tactics: General Erwin Rommel – "Desert Fox"
description:
Now supreme leader of the grand Axis army, General Rommel earned his nickname in the sands of North-Africa. He's back there and this time for good: there won't be any retreat this time. Commanding operations in Africa and the Middle-East at the same time, the Desert Fox proves once again that he's one of the best generals on the planet.

This miniatures com with his own unit card, to use with Dust Tactics and Dust Tactics Battlefield rules and provide new tactic opportunities.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: FlipFour
description:
FlipFour is an innovative approach to creating a new four-in-a-row game with great game play, but using just 4 pieces per player (i.e. the absolute minimum number of pieces).

MATERIALS

4 white FlipFlop pieces, 4 black FlipFlop pieces and a 5×5 board.

FlipFlop pieces have a '+' on one side and a 'x' on the other.

RULES

Initial Setup

The board starts empty. Decide which player plays white; the other plays black. Take all 4 pieces of your color.

Goal

The first player to get all 4 of her pieces in an orthogonal or diagonal line wins (It does not matter whether her 4 pieces are +, ×, or some of each).

How to Play

White plays first. Players take turns either placing or moving one of their own pieces on the board, following the rules below:

1) When you place a new piece, it must be placed on an empty space, but you can choose whether to place it +side-up or ×-side-up.
2) When you move a piece, + moves orthogonally, and × moves diagonally, as the lines suggest. Move your piece any distance to an empty space.
3) Pieces can jump over other pieces as long as the destination space is empty.
4) After you move your piece, you must flip it over (+ becomes ×; × becomes +).
5) You are welcome to move your pieces before all of you pieces are on the board.
6) Passing is not allowed.

name: Dust 1947: Fallschirm RSO/Flak 3
description: The Raupenschlepper Ost mit FlaK 3 is a dedicated anti-aircraft vehicle in service with the Luftwaffe ground forces. Thanks to its weight, it can be parachuted along with the airborne troops, offering them a much needed fire support during the first phase of an operation. It is presented here in Babylon camouflage pattern, as used in the Middle-East circa 1947.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Dust Tactics: SD KFZ 250/3 – "Kommandowagen"
description:
As war continues some “older” vehicles have managed to stay on top. Or have not been destroyed yet. It's the case for the still very efficient “Kommandowagen”, officially known as Sd.Kfz 250/3. Its missions have remained the same for a few years now: transport safely the officers of the Panzer Grenadier division and provide covering fire. This vehicle does these two jobs superbly.

The Sd.Kfz. 250/3 “Kommandowagen” is everything you can expect from our Studio release. As usual with our Premium line it is carefully assembled and painted, and everything you see is there: the weathering, the effects, etc.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Dark Web
description:
In the 1990s, a small band of freedom fighting hackers team up to take down an evil corporation. They meet anonymously over computer networks to conceal their identities, but there's a problem -- one of them might be a corporate spy!

Dark Web is a game of hidden player roles and pushing your luck for 3-6 players, comprised of 128 cards. Search the servers for precious data files to incriminate the Moore-Ally-Good Corporation, but be careful who you trust as you may not all be on the same side.

The goal of the game is to download enough data files after 4 rounds to expose the corporation for what it is. On your turn you may play any action scripts in your hand, then decide if you want to bank your points or stay in and draw a card. But be wary of drawing a lock, as too many locks will cause your connection to be shut down and all the data you've found to be lost.

For IT players, do whatever it takes to stop the hackers. But be careful of revealing yourself too early, as once you do the hackers can work around you!
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Die Lieder, die Nerven: Ein Unicante-Spiel
description:
Die Lieder, die Nerven is a German board game based on the students' choir Unicante.

Players take on the roles of choir conductors, drafting actions over a course of 24 rounds (placing "helping hands" on the available actions slots). The actions include drawing arrangement cards and placing rehearsal markers on them to collect victory points, but also improving their abilities to get more helping hands, become better at rehearsing etc.

Being the conductor of a large choir can be quite stressful, so keep an eye on your "nerve" ressource.

German introductory text from the booklet

Leite einen Chor durch ein turbulentes Probenjahr. Sammle Arrangements und probe die Stücke. Verbessere die Fähigkeiten deines Chors und deines Teams.
Und vor allem: Nicht die Nerven verlieren!
Dann kannst du am Ende des Chorjahres mit einem Konzert glänzen, das die meisten Siegpunkte wert ist.

Das Spiel wird in einer festgelegten Anzahl von Runden gespielt. Durch das Einstudieren von Arrangements sammeln die Mitspielenden Siegpunkte, was oft Nerven kostet. Ziel des Spiels ist es, am Ende bei den großen Sommernachtskonzerten mehr Siegpunkte als die Mitspieler zu haben.
In jeder Runde setzen alle nacheinander ihre “Helfenden Hände” auf die Aktionsfelder des Spielplans, um anschließend die entsprechenden Aktionen auszuführen: Neue Arrangements und Proben-Marker zu bekommen, sich mit Fähigkeitsmarkern in den Bereichen Orga, Stimmgruppenleitung und Chorleitung zu verbessern, ihre Teams mit weiteren Helfenden Händen zu vergrößern... und immer ihre Nervenpolster zu pflegen.

name: Multiverse: Cosmic Conquest
description:
Multiverse: Cosmic Conquest is a game for 2 or more players which combines traditional collectible card game mechanics with a game board (galaxy) on which the game is played.
The contents of the galaxy are different every time and are unknown to the players at the beginning of the game. Players slowly explore the galaxy during gameplay.
In Multiverse: Cosmic Conquest players
Over the course of the game, each player will take turns playing cards such as units, structures, actions, and reactions, engage in battles, explore spaces in the galaxy and discover and colonize planets. Each player starts the game on their home planet. When you conquer your opponent’s home planet or control 10 spaces in the galaxy, you win the game!
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Movement

name: One Drunk Night...
description:
One Drunk Night... is a dark humor story-building game where players craft a drunken adventure together. The result is unpredictable and frequently crude with potential catastrophic moral repercussions on your psyche.

In this game, the Storyteller begins by choosing one of two "Beginning..." cards to start the adventure. The other players choose one "...Middle..." or "...End" cards from their hands to continue the story and play them face down. The submitted cards are shuffled and read aloud by the Storyteller. The Storyteller then chooses the card he/she wants to use to continue the story.

The player who submitted the chosen card receives one point if a "...Middle..." card was selected and two points for an "...End" card. Play continues with the same Storyteller until an "...End" card is selected, adding to the last selected card each time to grow the adventure. After an "...End" card is chosen the adventure is read aloud and play rotates to the left. Stories can go as long as the players decide allowing for much more replayability and variety than play X match Y mechanic found in other party card games.

Players decide the ending conditions and the player with the most points is the winner if score is being kept.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling

name: Ophidian 2360: Promo Pack 2
description:
This lot contains 5 Gladiator cards:

007 Zdantal
008 The Corruptor L1/L2
09 The Corruptor L3/L4
010 QuickRazor
011 Desert Aegis
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Simulation, Variable Phase Order

name: Smoothie Kaboom!
description:
Description from the publisher:

Smoothie Kaboom is a kickstarter promotional collaboration between Minion Games and Thunderworks Games, combining the components of Blend Off! and Cosmic Kaboom into a third, hybrid game that plays like a combination of the two.

In Smoothie Kaboom, players will race their ships around the galaxy to collect fruit from different planets to create smoothies. Players take turns flicking their ships. If they collide with a planet that is currently producing, they can collect the fruit. When they have the right fruit to complete a smoothie order, they return to their base to cash in for points. The game ends when all smoothie orders have been filled. The winner is the one with the most gold stars.

name: Go Fish Fitness
description:
Description from the publisher:

Go Fish Fitness is a game based around the classic game Go Fish, it is a card game for kids to encourage them to get up, jump around, and add a component of physical exercise to their game in a fun and competitive way. Each card denomination includes a quick physical exercise, and players compete to make a match and force their opponents to do the activity.

In addition to exercises, each card includes an animal or a creature so that younger children, and those with limited mobility can participate by mimicking the shown creature when a match is made.

Go Fish Fitness is based around the same set of cards as a standard deck, and can be incorporated into many other standard card games as well. Keeping fit is about incorporating exercise into everyday life, in ways both big and small, and Go Fish Fitness is a way to introduce a little bit more exercise into a normally passive activity for your kids!

name: Zero Day War
description:
Description from the publisher:

The year is 2461, mankind has expanded beyond Earth and colonized Venus, Mars and Titan.

For over 200 years, all communication and commerce between our four worlds has been conducted through the SysNet, a completely secure information and communication network. That is until yesterday…

Our sun erupted into activity, volatile solar storms raged across our star’s surface while massive solar flares bombard our system, causing havoc with our technologies and knocking down the security protocols of the SysNet.

With the SysNet’s defenses down,hackers and government agencies alike descend upon the vulnerable data files like Locusts, stealing everything they can before the security protocols engage and once again locks the system down.

The system is yours for the taking… Zero Day War has begun.

Zero Day War is a 2-4 player card game. Players take the roles of hackers from different planets who are taking advantage of a security malfunction in the SysNet.

Use Exploit cards to program future actions and Hack files. A unique count down mechanic is used to activate all the programs at once at the end of the round. Players steal files, complete contracts and cause havoc for other players in the game. The hacker with the most files & contracts filled wins!

name: Speculation
description:
On the box "An exciting skill-testing game from start to finish."

Stock trading game, with player influenced moving stock markets. Roll the dice and move around the outer part of the board, picking up lobby cards, paying tax, inheriting money, winning the lottery, or being fined. Get chances to buy stock and enter the stocks markets to influence each stock, stocks can double or even triple in value, they can also halve or be wiped out on the stock board, first player to a million dollars wins.

name: Assassin Nation
description: Assassin Nation is a competitive card game about the cutthroat world of contract-killers. Each round, players draw Contract cards along with Weapon and Modifier cards. Each Contract has an objective, which can raise or lower the value of a successful assassination depending on the Weapon used in the hit. Players race to see who can earn the most money by effectively eliminating targets and sabotaging the efforts of their fellow assassins.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Storytelling, Take That

name: Nuclear War: Alliance
description:
Forced Alliance: Play this on another player during your turn. For two turns, neither of you can attack the other in any way. Note: Cannot be used if there are only two players left.

Created specially for the Alliance Game Distributors Open House of September 2016, this card was made available to all Nuclear War fans in January of 2017 (50th Anniversary Edition Kickstarter Update #47, 16 January 2017)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Negotiation, Political, Wargame

name: The Course of Honor
description:
In Ancient Rome attract clients, secure funds and employ specialists to promote your team of candidates up through the historical course of honor.

Includes two dice in each of five colors representing the support of the people, armies and Senate, plus money and time.

The starting player rolls one of each color plus one of their choice. Of these they draft one for themselves and pass the rest to the next player. Each drafted die corresponds to a particular location on the player's personal grid. Each of these locations grants a different advantage such as more clients, specialists who give rule-breaking abilities, improved income, a loan, or the ability to advance up the course of honor. Each of these advantages occurs during a different phase.

The phases themselves are not set, but actually determined in their own grid row, i.e. via the exact same process as the above. This means that players only learn as they go along the types of phases that will resolve on the current turn, and whether they will occur at all.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Variable Phase Order

name: Villains and Vigilantes Card Game: Extreme Expansion
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Extreme Expansion brings everything together to form the ultimate expansion to the Villains and Vigilantes Card Game.

This product brings together all the content from Destroyers and Daredevils, Crusaders and Criminals, and Mentalists, Masterminds and Marvels and gathers it one explosive package. The Destroyers, the Indestructibles, the Crusaders and many more.

18 all-new superheroes, 17 vile supervillains, physical, mental, mutant, technology, influence, energy, elemental, mystical, and signature powers, new allies and adversaries from around the world and beyond, new missions and implausible plot twists - the Extreme Expansion is jam-packed with of it.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Off the Dead: Ninja & Pagu
description:
Two more character for Off the Dead in Print and Play.

You can use the old turn card of chap.1 to made them because they are replace by the one of the chap.2

Ninja : you can destroy a zombie not reveal yet from your side or from one of your friends (left or right)

"ça va trancher chérie" la cité de la peur (french movie)
"tu ne le sais pas encore mais tu es déjà mort" Conan le survivant
"tout ce qui bouge c'est du viet, tout ce qui bouge pas c'est du viet. Mais du viet discipliné à l'avance." Full Metal Jacket

Pagu : you can move the zombies in your third zone (face to face) to the third zone of one of your friends (right or left)

"ah mais c'est ca qui pue !" Kaamelot
"mouais, les rats ont p'tet gouts de creme caramel mais comme j'ai jamais l'intention d'en manger j'pourrais jamais le savoir" Pulp Fiction
"Non mais attend, un de ces jours, y'a un agriculteur, il va pas se poser, qui va lui mettre une fourche dans la tête" Kaamelot

name: Pariser Weltausstellungs Spiel
description: "Jeu de l'Exposition Universelle a Paris". Typical vintage roll and move board game, where players should cross the route (through a world's fair held in Paris, France, from 14 April to 12 November 1900) with 30 stops. The player, who reach the end of the route first, wins the game.

name: Liberator of Dylon
description:
story
Long before long, far away place ...
There was a country that dedicated the Goddess Dylon of half a half cochlea, "Dyron Kingdom".
However, the Kingdom of Daelon has disappeared suddenly from the world.
Some say that the Kingdom was sealed ...

A long time flows ...

Magicians gathered in an old shrine in a remote neighborhood.
Because he heard a legend.
"A person who has released the old sealed kingdom can become a ruler of the country."
Here the magician 's old Seal King Dynon' s liberation battle was about to begin.

Play field changing with number of people
"Master Area" to release the master and
"Free area" to release item cards etc.
The play field changes according to the number of players.

Because the strategies available for play field change
I want to try the tactics I thought many times!

A total of 62 original illustration cards direct the view of the world of "Dylon's Liberator".
Even just watching, the story of the ancient Kingdom of Daelon comes floating ... maybe.

10 magic powered by seven masters
Various magic that changes the flow of the game is prepared for "Deron's liberator".
The magic of obstruction that makes the other party take troublesome cards,
The magic of reversal that exchanges hands with opponent and changes superiority /
Magical return to return the magic to the other party in reverse,
Please find your own winning pattern to become a winner!

30 items and special effects cards

There are many cards other than Master Card in "Dearon's Liberator".

All 30 items are different item cards
Five types of 5 color items have various shapes, each with its name.

Other Special Effect Cards
The kingdom's hidden cards and magical scroll cards,
There are various cards that will help the player besides the magic of the master.

name: Berd strategy game
description:
Berd is a new abstract strategy game for two players. The goal of the game is to collect more tokens than your opponent. Players collect token(s) when crossing the board starting from their base line and finishing - passing opponent’s baseline. On their path to finish players can capture opponent’s token(s)
Some definitions:
1. Tower – is a stack of two or more tokens;
2. Berd is a tower with two or more same color tokens on the top;
3.Unprotected tower or unprotected token (UT) – a single token or a tower that is not Berd. Unprotected tower moves like a single token.
4. Recovering a captured token – player can recover the captured token by landing on UT and by restacking the tower create a Berd.

At the beginning of the game players arrange their tokens on their baseline (the first row from player’s side) in any combination. Players move their UT (unprotected token or Unprotected tower) one square at a time forward or side. You can’t move your UT diagonally or backward. While you can move your UT laterally however you can’t do more than three consecutive side moves. Players can capture opponent’s token by landing on a square occupied by a single token or unprotected tower. You can’t capture or land on a square occupied by your opponent’s Berd. A player can recover his/her captured token from opponent’s unprotected tower by landing on that tower. In this case the player will restack tokens and place his/her tokens on the top creating a Berd. In order to play a token from the Berd you have to split the Berd and play a single token or unprotected tower. If there are captured opponent’s tokens in the Berd they must be attached at least under one of your token; -so basically you move UT from your Berd. The game is over when only one player has active token(s) left on the board. Now players can stack their collected tokens and see whose tower is taller or who collected more tokens.

Variations of the game:
1. Berd strategy game can be played on different size boards (3x3; 4x4; 5x5; 6x6) and/or with various number of tokens. Two sided board supplied in this game with 3x3 and 4x4 sides. Recommended to play with 5 tokens per each player on 3x3 and max 6 tokens on 4x4 board.
2. Game with color protection – Players can use colored squares on the board for protection from being captured by the opponent’s token. For example: Red color player’s UT (single token or unprotected tower) will be protected on the Red square. Other rules are identical to the basic Berd game.
3. Game with points – in this game each token assigned different weight/points (10; 20; 30; 40; 50 ..), shown on the token. This option of the game provides more possibilities for moves. The winner will be a player who collects higher total score. In order to play this version of the game you need to attach stickers with numbers. There are lines on the sides of the token for even attachment.
4. Game with hidden points – games #1; 2 and 3 can be played with tokens that have hidden numbers (numbers are not displayed outside, they are attached inside). This game is similar to game #3 with the difference that only a player who possesses a token can see the weight of that token. This feature introduces more intrigue and uncertainty about the end result of the game.

name: Bushido: Gok
description: Gok’s fate was sealed before he was even conceived. His harsh upbringing combined with his inability to learn, left him as a ideal recruit for the Cult of Yurei, that and the fact that he is quite formidable. His mutating mass, and he has a lot of it, allows Gok to adapt to best any opponent. The disease ridden, body filled cart he insists on hauling also serves as a grotesque distraction in battle for his opponents.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: History Maker Golf: All-Time Great Golfers Card Set
description: Individual cards for over 100 legendary pro golfers from the 1930s through 1990s. Each golfer rated on their overall career performance.

name: History Maker Golf: Course Collection One
description: Includes four courses: BlackJack GC, Las Vegas, NV; Wicker Pin GC, Ardmore, PA; Coastal Golf Resort (Oceanside), St. Simon Island, GA; Lookout Ridge GC, Pebble Beach, CA. Each course includes individual cards for each hole, based on real-life pro tour golf course in indicated locale.

name: History Maker Golf: Course Collection Two
description: Includes four courses: Big Easy GC, Avondale, LA; Rubber City GC, Akron, OH; Pacific Golf Links, Pebble Beach, CA; Great Woods GC, Norton, MA. Each course includes individual cards for each hole, based on real-life pro tour golf course in indicated locale.

name: DC Universe Miniature Game: Aquaman
description: This expansion introduces Aquaman to the DC Universe Miniature Game. This white metal kit comes ready to assemble and paint.

name: Warforged: First Contact
description:
Description from the publisher:

Warforged: First Contact is a skirmish-level exploration game where the Iron Legionaries of the Terran Authority investigate a dimension-spanning shrine-portal of the alien Mantra. The Iron Legion will need to use tight coordination and clever tactics to overcome the limitless hordes of the Mantra and battle their way to the heart of the shrine-portal.


2+ Players using Iron Legion versus the Mantra (additional players take command of separate Iron Legion squads; the Mantra player acts as "dungeon master").
20-60 minutes play time depending on the scenario.
Unique and accessible command card activation system.
A wide selection of friends and enemies to use from lowly expendables to mighty heroes.
Traps, alien conditions and reinforcements shift the odds through a game. Victory is rarely assured and games remain exciting to the last throw of the dice.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Masterwork
description:
Masterwork
A beautiful game of creating prestigious artworks

In Masterwork, players are artists struggling to win prestige by creating famous artworks and participating in gallery exhibitions. Collect pigments to craft brilliant paints and use those paints to paint the greatest artworks of the High Renaissance. Get critiqued, build your portfolio, and exhibit your work to become the most prestigious artist of the period!


It's your turn
On your turn, if you haven’t started an artwork, you may select one from the gallery and move it to your easel, indicating that artwork is in progress. Now, only you can complete it. Next, use sets of pigments from your hand to produce paint, discarding the requisite cards indicated in the recipe area on the paint card. Move your new paint from the palette to your hand or place it on your easel, dedicating it to that artwork.

Each artwork requires a specific set of paints. When you have gathered them, in hand or on the easel, it’s time to submit your artwork for a critique. Roll the critique die; if the value of equal or higher to the prestige value of the artwork, you have successfully completed it! Move the artwork, along with all paints used to complete it, to the table, clearing your easel for your next artwork. If your roll came up short, take a feedback token indicating you’ve received useful advice from the critique. This token makes future critique attempts easier. Each subsequent artwork makes future critiques easier, representing the artist’s growing popularity.

All 24 artwork cards award prestige points, with addition prestige earned by participating in exhibitions. Exhibits award prestige points when players complete sets of artwork cards; such as: ‘Leonardo Exhibit’ (two artworks from Leonardo da Vinci) and ‘Portrait Exhibit’ (artworks featuring portrait images). Masterwork includes 16 exhibit cards, with a random set of three used each game, offering a great deal of replayability.


Mixing colors
Pairs of primary color (Red, Yellow, Blue) cards may mix to be played as a secondary card of the same type. Secondary colors (Orange, Green, Violet) and different card types (Pigment and Paint cards) do not mix. Mixing colors gives you creative options when producing Pigment and Paint cards. Remember: you must always mix the same type (Paint with Paint, etc.)


Ending and scoring
When a player completes a gold-edged Masterwork Artwork card, finish the current round so each player has an equal number of turns (the player to the right of the starting player gets the final play). Each player adds up the Prestige Points from their completed Artwork cards. The three Exhibit cards are evaluated one after another for each player, comparing their completed Artwork cards with the requirements of cards. For each completed Exhibit card, add the indicated Prestige Point value to the Player’s total. The player with the most Prestige Points wins!
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Atlanta is Ours
description:
From the publisher's website:

"Atlanta is Ours" is our Western Theater scenario supplement. This massive PDF covers every major battle fought in the west, from 1862-1865. Each historical scenario has been carefully researched, including color maps and Orders of Battle for the armies.

Scenario List

Fort Donelson, February 1862
Pea Ridge, March 1862
Shiloh, April 1862
Corinth, October 1862
Perryville, October 1862
Stones River, December 1862
Champion Hill, May 1863
Chickamauga, September 1863
Chattanooga, November 1863
Pleasant Hill, April 1864
Resaca, May 1864
Kennesaw Mountain, June 1864
Peachtree Creek, July 1864
Atlanta, July 1864
Jonesborough, August 1864
Franklin, November 1864
Nashville, December 1864
Bentonville, March 1865
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Realms of Destiny
description:
Realms Of Destiny is a fantasy adventure board game for 1 to 8 players. Realms Of Destiny can be played head-to-head, cooperatively, solo, or teams.

Players choose their Character, Allegiance, and starting Guild, then explore the board using equipment, treasure, and spells to wander the map, complete quests, capture bounties, meet both allies and foes on the road, build a traveling party, and earn Destiny to claim Blessings and fight whichever Tyrant is harrowing the land for that game session. Even in coop mode, players each have their own adventures, while trading to aid one another, then come together for the final boss battle.
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fantasy, Print & Play, Travel
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Take That, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Fleet Ambush
description:
In Fleet Ambush, two players will take control of a fleet each, Humans Vs. Aliens. At the start of the game, both players construct a fleet of ships using square pieces. Your ships can be armed with many weapons, including ion cannons, fighter bays, turrets and more!

Once both players have constructed their fleet, the two fleets will battle it out the cold dark depths of space! Each player takes turns activating their ships, moving and then firing! You can also use your fighters to create a fighter screen, blocking your ships from your enemies weapon systems!

To win, you will need to disable all of your opponents ships, or have more standing at the end of 10 rounds. Let the best Admiral win!

Full instructions to PnP and play are here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/18h-WMTEOyfyf5At1PZwqjYJR...

name: Algarade The Card Game
description:
Algarade is a 2 to 6 player fast-paced, strategic, card game where you need to eliminate all your Opponents by destroying their political Landmarks and crown yourself the new leader!

About:

Algarade is played turn by turn in a counterclockwise manner. You start your turn by drawing 2 playing cards and playing as many cards as you can or want without playing the same card twice. Once you are satisfied or cannot play anymore, you pass the turn to the next player.
Remember, even though you need to destroy your opponent's Landmarks to win, playing all your cards every turn makes you an easy target!

To help you eliminate your Opponents you will have access to 19 unique playing cards that will either help you attack your enemies, defend your own territories or destabilize other players.

These cards are separated into 3 categories:
Red cards that may only played during your turn,
Yellow cards that may played anytime,
and Blue cards that can only be played under certain circumstances.

The rules evolve with the amount of players that play. When playing with 2 to 3 people, all other players are your enemies. You can build temporary alliances but be ready for the inevitable backstabbing. When playing with 4 to 6 players you have Allies that you may not attack, but will still need to compete with to win the game!

Additional information:

Algarade is a one-man project from the mind of Olivier Etienne Miller. Originally a game to be played with his family and close friends, it became quite popular in his circle of friends which eventually lead him to start a Kickstarter to spread the game to a wider audience!
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Take That

name: Anvil Angst
description:
Anvil Angst is a game of Disgrace, Despair and Death set in the Live Role Playing world of Empire by Profound Decisions.

Each player is an Egregore (guiding spirit) of one of ten nations within the Empire. Within each nation there is one group of three characters who just do not fit in. Worse than that - they are the antithesis of what their nation should be: they are an Embarrassment to the Empire.

Each Egregore must humiliate and destroy their embarrassing group before the other Egregores can deal with their own embarrassments.

During the game, players will play cards that cause events to happen to characters in their own nation’s group or characters from other nations. These events will affect their mood — some will delight characters, whereas others will disgrace them. When a character is dismayed, it becomes possible for an event to kill them. When all members of one group are killed, then the game ends. The winning player is the one whose embarrassing group accumulated the most despair among their living and dead characters.

name: Bushido: Kusatta Kairai
description:
These abominations of undead are the latest creation of the warped and twisted minds of the Cult Shugenja. Lumbering across the battlefield with single minded purpose, to bring death and suffering to the lives of the living. Those brave enough to stand against the cruel mockeries of their former friends and love ones are thanked with a foul toxic substance spraying from their wounds, eating away flesh and muscle. Should their foes manage to bring one of these puppets down reports talk of them swelling like rotten fruit and exploding all over an opponent as one last insult.

Blister contains one miniature, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Swingbridge
description:
Swingbridge is a card game for three players, based on Contract Bridge.

It is a standard deck, trick taking game, with variable partnerships. An auction phase is followed by card playing. Four hands are dealt: one per player plus an additional one which is placed face-up on the table (the "dummy"); initially, one player is allowed to exchange his hand with the dummy. During the auction phase the players attempt to communicate information about their hands by bidding; like in Bridge, bids specify how many tricks must be taken and what is the preferred trump suit (or lack thereof); in addition, bids also have a "color" that indicates what is the preferred partnership for that deal. After the auction, the team that has won the bid (the "declarers") tries to win as many tricks as possible; the other player (the "defender") plays both his own hand and the dummy's, and tries to take enough tricks to have the declarers fail their contract. The scoring system is almost identical to Bridge, but players have individual scores.

Swingbridge is presented as a book, written for an audience of Bridge players, which contains the basic rules of the game, some optional variants, and an in-depth analysis of the mechanics and peculiarities of the game.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Memory, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking

name: Krosmaster: Arena – Duel Pack 3
description:
Includes two exclusive figures (Anathar and Justice Knight Jr) and their character cards as well as:

1 game map
2 token sheets
2 engraved dice

Krosmaster: Arena – Duel Pack 3 is a standalone two-player game that can also be used to expand Krosmaster: Arena.

name: Ember: Purple Worm Expansion
description:
Initially a stretch goal for the Ember: From the Ashes Kickstarter, it did not get unlocked. It was then offered later to backers.

From the email offer:

"This 10 card expansion allows you to capture the Purple Worm, a fearsome creature that can reap havoc across the Ember playing field. Gain control of the Worm to capture creatures and swallow them whole, then use your body segments to protect the head from destruction.

One thing is certain: when you bring the Purple Worm into play, battle us inevitable. For advanced Ember play only!"

NOTE: There was an error in the Purple Worm offer saying it consisted of 1 Head, 1 Tail, and 8 body segments. It was always intended to work with two heads and tails. Backers were given the choice of receiving the Purple Worm expansion in one of two ways:

Option A: 1 x Head, 1 x Tail, 8 x Body Segments
Option B: 2 x Heads, 2 x Tails, 6 x Body Segments

So both versions will be out there.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Sons of a Mighty King
description:
4th place in Epitrapezio 2017.

The King is worried as a bunch of filthy, ruthless rebels have taken many of his castles. Fortunately, his two cunning sons come to rescue. Using the army, the workers and the money that the King happily provides they'll try to take back the lost territories and bring peace to the kingdom. They'll act independently, as they both want to impress their mighty father-king and who knows...he may be pleased enough, that he'll decide to step back and let their best son rule!

The game lasts ten turns. On each turn, three rebellious territories are revealed and players decide where to fight. Then they both do an action like hiring a worker, train an army, collect taxes or seek the king's help. Lastly, they can cede a previously gained territory to the king, they just have to secure it by granting army and workers too.

The son that will bring the best territories back to the king, while keeping his army and finances in good shape, will win the king's endless favor!

name: Protect Your Brand
description:
Description from the publisher:

Protect Your Brand (the card game) pits 2-5 brand managers against one another to stay viable in the social media dominated millennial rat race we call life. Utilize your best assets and hand off liabilities to your rivals to stay on top in this competitive card game companion to Mush's musical release, "Protect Your Brand."

Each player tracks their Viability (health) with an included card, starting the game with 3. The double-sided cards function as Assets, granting positive points and abilities, or Liabilities, subtracting points from opponents or triggering detrimental abilities. A round ends when all dealt cards are exhausted, and each player except the one with the most points loses Viability. If a player reaches 0 Viability, they are eliminated from the game. This often leads to players being eliminated in staggered waves, since multiple players are losing Viability at varied rates.

The game ends when all but one player has exhausted their brand's Viability.
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Set Collection

name: Philanthropoly
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Game of Industrialization, Economics and Capitalism.
A free print & play game from DVGC.

Philanthropoly is a card based game where players negotiate and trade with other players to collect action cards to build factories, railroad and/or ports to increase the value of the various companies. Stocks in the various companies can be bought and sold depending on the players speculations and cash flow needs. Cash is earned by the play of production cards, with the type of production dependent on what natural resource, region or city card is played in conjunction. The ultimate goal of the game is to earn enough money to buy (donate) to various philanthropic causes. The most philanthropic player at the end of the game wins.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Industry / Manufacturing, Print & Play, Trains
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Stock Holding, Team-Based Game, Trading

name: Sage Signs
description:
Description from the designer:

Sage Signs is a competitive faux-medieval card game for 2 to 4 players in which the players must make poker-like combinations of mystical Sign cards in a dominoes-like arrangement. Making combinations allows players to place summoning Seals to block opponents, cast crafty spells, and in the end summon a powerful (but benevolent) Spirit.

In a typical turn, you may use your two actions to either draw or place a numbered Sign card next to another card of the same value, one higher/lower value, or the same suit. Additionally, by discarding a Sign card onto an open spell slot, you may cast the spell of that card's suit, and by placing Seals atop a Sign card marked with a "V," you may invoke the effects of one of the eight game-changing Virtue cards. When specific poker-like combinations of cards are made, a number of Seals corresponding to the strength of that combination may be put down. When someone has laid down all 7 of their Secondary Seals, they must create a combination of cards that yields more Seals than the the central Spirit card demands. The number of Seals indicated on the Spirit card (1 to 4) indicates the difficulty of the end game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Dust 1947: The Regia Marina "Battaglione San Marco Assault Squad"
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Regia Marina (Italian Royal Navy) is home to the first special forces in History and to some of the most seasoned veterans fighting for the Axis today. The Battaglione San Marco (San Marco Battalion) is one of these units and as such as been in the War since 1939. They can mostly be found around the Mediterranean and the Black Sea, where they act as a Marines unit. Some elements have even recently been deployed in the Caspian Sea near Zverograd, in an effort to take the city for good. This Assault Squad is equipped to deal with any ground threat it might encounter such as enemy infantry or vehicles thanks to its Flamethrower. Known to be robust and quick on the battlefield, the San Marco Assault Squad is justly feared among the enemies of the Axis.

This item comes with its own Dust 1947 Unit Card.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Zaibatsu: Shadowraiders
description:
The game is set in a cyberpunk future. Players represent super corporation rivals, the Zaibatsu, using everything at their disposal to execute missions, accumulate power, and bury the opposition.

Zaibatsu is a cyberpunk-themed game. Each player in the game can move pawns, attack the pawns controlled by other players, and carry out missions to win the game.

The game consists of cards, which allow a variety of actions to choose, dice that add randomness and uncertainty to the game, and a modular board which adds replay value to the game. Also, each player has the opportunity to control simultaneously, multiple pawns, each one of them with special abilities and restrictions.

Zaibatsu Shadowraiders is an expansion to Zaibatsu Speedrunners.

All of the basic rules for original Zaibatsu apply to Zaibatsu Shadowraiders.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Rising Blades
description:
Something is stirring in the darkness. For fifty years the sorcerer Vesh Darkhand has been biding his time, recruiting, plotting, and changing--and now; he is ready to unleash hell on the unsuspecting world above.

Ready your blades, and rise from the Cluwash Depth as champions of Vesh! The highest prize awaits you: To stand as the Darkhand's Commander of War...

Rising Blades is an asymmetric tile-laying board game for 2 – 4 players in which your character is tasked with exploring an untouched world and laying waste to everything around you.

The Warriors raid villages, attacking anyone who dares to stand in their way.
The Necromancers raise the dead, summoning an army of undead creatures.
The Thieves steal great and ancient treasures to weaken their foe.
The Destroyer defiles the land, destroying vital resources.

With unique character abilities and character objectives; you must find a way to not only win, but also to disrupt the plans of your competitors!

Rising Blades is set in The City of Kings universe, 5 years before The City of Kings Board Game but is a standalone game with completely unique mechanics.

name: Math Builder
description:
Once upon a time
A beautiful new city is being made near the hills. At the launch meeting, we have you, the budding mathematicians, engineers, artists and visionaries to build roads to connect it. Use your math skills to master mountains, build tunnels and make long bridges over new lands. You can also improve existing roads. The longer the road, the more points you earn. So what are you waiting for! Get...set...build.
In this exciting arithmetic strategy game, you will use number tiles to make math equations. Starting from a basic arithmetic equation like 2+3=5, you can make very complex, long equations. Kids develop a completely new way to look at numbers. Perfect game to combine skill and imagination. Hours of non-stop fun is guaranteed.

Math skills
• Addition
• Subtraction
• Multiplication
• Division
• BODMAS
• Equation Balancing

Other skills
• Strategic thinking
• Spatial recall
• Group dynamics
• Cognitive and Developmental skills

Practice jump
7 times over class time and worksheets
At Logic Roots, we are passionate about Math and work with the vision of Reinventing how kids practice Math through gamification of its concepts. Our Board Games, Card Games and Apps are widely used by top schools and homeschooling parents to help their boys and girls fall in love with Math. These games are best used for Learning, Education and gifting purposes for children.

Target group
Grade 3 and above || 8 years and above

Contents of the box
• 124 plastic road tiles
• 1 playing terrain board
• 1 cement bag (tiles bag)
• 1 Instruction book
• 1 Game themed wall poster
• 4 write and wipe slates

name: Robottery 101
description:
Description from the publisher:

It's the year 4000.... The sounds of whirring drills, buzzing saws and massive metal footsteps fill the student workshop. That can mean only one thing: it's time for the Giant Robot Science Fair!

In this high-energy set-collection card game, collect robot pieces from across the galaxy, collaborate with your peers, and scheme against your rivals to create the coolest robot you can for the University of Robottery's annual science fair!

Each turn, players travel to planets to collect robot parts represented by Limb and Head cards. Each player connects parts together to form their own complete, anatomically correct robot. Your class convenes for a Study Session every two turns, during which you can trade any parts you have collected with the other three players and attempt to sabotage other robots by stealing parts.
