Professors have various point values and want to see certain combinations of limb cards to favor your robot. The professors judge your robots after eight turns, and whichever student builds the most impressive robot wins the game!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Take That

name: Best Pitch
description:
Description from the designer:

Pitch your ideas to tycoons and sabotage the competition!

Pitch your best idea with the most outstanding innovation to a panel of investors, but watch out as others are looking to sabotage your idea in favor of their own. Become the top dog as you craft together winning combinations!

Pitch your ideas to the Tycoon in hopes your amazing idea is picked!

Combine crazy ideas with creative innovations like an Arcade where everyone has a magic wand.

Sabotage your competition to make sure the Tycoon picks your ideas, like it smells like baby vomit.

Be careful though, your competition is out to sabotage you as well.

Have a blast with a multiple players and thousands of combinations.

Each player starts with two of each cards - 2 idea cards, innovation cards, and sabotage cards.

You put together your best Idea with an innovation to pitch to the business tycoon. When the cards are placed face down in front of the tycoon you then place a sabotage card down on any other player’s idea/innovation combo. The tycoon picks the best despite the sabotage.

Play for a few rounds. The player with the most picks from the tycoon wins.

The tycoon rotates every turn clockwise around the players circle.

Give it your all as you give your Best Pitch!

name: Super Sumo!
description:
Description from the designer:

Super Sumo is simple party game for 2 to 4 players.

This dexterity game can be played on a table or directly on the floor.

There are 2 teams : the Blue Sumos and the Red Sumos.

Each team controls 4 sumos (4 circular coaters).

In this game, each team is trying to control The golden cookie.

The golden cookie (a tiny token) is put on the center of the playing area at the beginning of the game.

Players throw their sumos in order to be as close as possible to the golden cookie.

When all the sumos have been launched, the round is over. The team which controls the golden cookie (the closest sumo) wins 1 point.

The first team with 3 points wins the game.

name: Swordpoint: Medieval Armies
description:
Army list book containing 48 armies with additional variants, covering the period from 1066 AD to 1526 AD. Army lists include:

Medieval Wales
Medieval Scandinavia
Khwaresmian
Medieval Burmese
Crusading Military Orders
Christian Crusaders
Medieval Russian
Early Holy Roman Empire
Feudal Polish
Medieval Bulgaria
Baltic Pagans
Kingdom of Cilicia
Duchy of Achaia
Muslim Indian
Mongol Conquest and Khanates
Ordenstaat
Medieval Serbia
Medieval Spanish
Medieval Scottish
Mamluks
Medieval Byzantine
Medieval Albania
Ottoman Turks
Swiss
Medieval English
The Catalan Company
Later Medieval Hungarian
Low Countries
Later Italian City States
Aztec Triple Alliance
Medieval French
Medieval Moldavia and Walachia
Timurid
Later Polish
White Company
Ming Chinese
Later Holy Roman Empire
Medieval Persia
Hussite
Incan Empire
Late medieval French
War of the Roses
Ordonnance Burgundian
French Expedition
Spanish in Italy
Renaissance Scots
Imperial
Moghul Conquest
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Torch Carriers
description:
A party of heroic adventurers arrive at the entrance of the dungeon armor shining, weapons bristling, and trusty Torch Carriers in tow. The great doors open reluctantly then slam shut with a boom once the group is inside. A lock clicks into place locking the group in the darkness. The Torch Carriers light up their torches and shoulder their packs. The heroes quickly scan the entry and seeing nothing threatening sheath their weapons and stride toward the single arched doorway on the opposite side of the room. At the midpoint of the room the floor begins to glow as inscribed runes and markings fade into view. With a soundless flash the heroes are vaporized leaving behind a small cloud of cinders drifting through the air like dying fireflies.

Once the Torch Carriers get past the stunned silence of their hero's’ demise, they decide to complete the task set before the heroes, find the dungeon exit and return home!

You play the part of the Torch Carriers. Unlike most dungeon crawlers, your character is not an epic hero trained in unique skills, covered in protective armor and armed to the teeth with custom weapons. The Torch Carriers have a pack of basic supplies and a torch. In order to survive the dungeon, complete the task, and escape you will have to use what you can find as you go.

Torch Carriers is a “diceless” dungeon-crawling party-based adventure game for 1-6 players. The Chapter-based story system ensures that no two games will ever be alike.

Built on Wrectangle Games “Card Chaos” Gameplay Engine, Torch Carriers allows you to play world-class RPG adventures dictated by the cards you draw rather than the dice you roll.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures

name: Neon Dawn
description:
Neon Dawn is a character building, open-world, post-apocalyptic adventure board game for 1-5 players. It is set in the Waste, a post nuclear land steeped in radiation and full of danger, adventure and treasures to be found. The Great War happened long enough ago that no one alive remembers what life used to be like. Those that cling to life work hard to simply survive, overcoming challenges within the Waste every single day. This is where you intend to make a name for yourself. Your goal is to explore and survive the Waste, while becoming the most famous adventurer in the process!

Neon Dawn is an adventure game at its core, including 400 mini stories that can be experienced by adventurers of the Waste. Players initially build out their character through a draft, then continue to develop their character through Items, Consumables and Traits obtained during game play, as well as the Companion you choose to adventure with. Players can explore the world, salvage materials, build reputation with settlements, trade, craft Items, build buildings (for Fame and reputation) and complete Missions.

Neon Dawn was designed to be easy to learn, yet still provide deep game play and a thematic story experience. Due to the variance in the cards, map tiles and dice rolls, each play through of Neon Dawn will provide a unique story experience specifically for the players at the table. No two stories will be alike! (statistically, it's nearly impossible)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Soul Shard: The Awakening
description:
Description from the publisher:

Next-Generation Role-Playing Board Game Adventure. Soul Shard is the simplest role-playing board game adventure. You can pick up to 5+ characters including mage,rogue,warrior etc.. and start your journey. You can slay enemies for gaining experience and equipment. Chat with town folk to get useful information and quests etc.. This is your game if you like Role-Playing games, simplicity. While you can play mini scenarios for shorter sessions (like mini dungeons/quest lines), also main scenario can take you away to another universe for years.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Action Queue, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: The Spooks Journey Game II: The Killer Sequel
description:
Description from the publisher:

More Spooks are awaiting to meet you... Summer Camp is open and that means Campfire Tales will be told to Spook the little ones! Each of the 8 camp counselors tell a tale about a Spook; the Evil Wizard, real-life T-Rex, the infested Gator Swamp, Maniac in the woods, Haunted Toys, the Wicked Witch, creepy Clowns and horrifying Aliens. Will YOU be able to survive each of the Campfire Tales?

Roll the die and make your way around the game board encountering a Spook. Complete the task for each Spook to win the game! Collect items along the way to help you on your Journey. Overcome obstacles along the way that hinder your path to become the winner!
categories: Children's Game, Fighting, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Wargame The American Revolutionary War
description:
A series of books that provide wargame rules and colour photocopiable figures for miniatures battles.

Each book tackles a specific time period of history. This book covers the American Revolutionary War (American War of Independence) in the late Eighteenth Century. Simple rules are provided written by Andy Callan, noted historical designer. The rules can be used with other miniatures.

The miniatures are drawn and coloured by Peter Dennis, the well
known face behind Osprey books, many illustrations and Martin Wallace's games. The buyer photocopies or scans the images provided, folds and cuts them out to make armies.
categories: American Revolutionary War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Dust 1947: Steel Guards Anti-Infantry squad
description:
Description from the publisher:

Steel Guards are some of the most formidable fighters on the planet. Their half-robotic bodies makes them very hard to kill, allowing them to gain incredible combat experience. The Anti-Infantry squad of the Steel Guard is one of the most feared combat unit on the planet. Nobody ever faced them that wasn't changed by the experience. The thermobaric grenade they fire melts flesh, bone and steel alike. Nothing known to man can survive the explosion.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: T2029: The Official Terminator 2 Board Game
description:
T2029 is an intense cooperative game where players must coordinate the efforts of Resistance to defeat Skynet in the future to send back a protector for John Connor in the past. The game will play in approximately 90 minutes and will explore the future world glimpsed in Terminator 2: Judgement Day, revealing the final days in the war against the Machines.

Players take the roles of commanders in John Connor’s Resistance during the last days of the war against Skynet in 2029. Tasked with holding back the machines long enough for John Connor’s assault team to reach Skynet’s Central Command, players must manage the conflict on multiple fronts. Combat, sabotage and gaining access to Skynet’s Defence Grid all play a part in achieving success. But in order to save the future, you must also save the past by reprogramming a T-800 Terminator to protect John against the advanced T-1000 in 1995.

—description from the publisher
categories: Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Multiverse: Batman (Rebirth)
description: Knight Models continues the Multiverse line with this expansion. The Multiverse line is a series of expansions that expands both the Batman Miniature Game and the DC Universe Miniature game. This expansion includes a Batman figure and character sheets.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game

name: Drive for Saint-Lô
description:
Drive for Saint-Lô is a tactical Mission pack (ASL Campaign Game) from Lone Canuck Publishing, with an additional 5 scenarios played on a historically based (24½"x 32" with 1" hexes) map of the Le Mare-Le Carillon Nose feature, located two-miles north of Saint-Lô, France.

This campaign game revolves around the efforts of the US 35th Santa Fe Division's attempts to capture the ancient city of Saint-Lô. Standing in their way are the battle-weary Germans of Kampfgruppe Kentner, 352.Infanterie-Division.

This campaign game is compatible with MMP's ASL System and modifiable to be used with other miniature wargaming systems.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Survival Begins: The Zombie Train
description:
On "The Zombie Train", human being have being infected by evil zombie virus vigorously...Based on the numerical comparison rules and abilities of different characters, you can either evacuate the survivors to a safe carriage, lead the zombies to invade the innocents,stop the evil virus spreading continuously. Now, it's time for you to save the innocent passengers on "The Zombie Train"!!

Goal of the game:
Difficulty of the requirements depends on the bonus points of each card. Based on the number of players, the player who scores the designated points first wins the game.
What do players do in their turns?

step1
Based on the description on the back of the bonus card, among the three cards that the player is having, choose one card that represents how many human being the player wants to evacuate or zombies that he/she wants to lead to attack, then place it and pick one card from themask deck.(ex there are many/not too much/a few zombie/human in the car or bluffing the number of human/zombie

step2
Train conductor will execute function first.Everyone take turns being train conductor
for every round.

step3
Open the cards. If the total amount of human is more than zombies, then whoever has the biggest number wins; while the total amount of zombie is more than human, then who ever has the smallest number wins. The winner gets to choose a human card to evacuate to himself/herself’s carriage, or collect zombie and kill them. For those who wish to steal points from others, they can send zombies to other player’s carriages.
categories: Bluffing, Children's Game, Memory, Number, Zombies

name: Emojito: Dice Tower Promo Pack
description: A set of 4 new cards given out from the 2017 Dice Tower Indiegogo campaign.

name: The Illumination of Lucid City
description:
A cooperative board game for 1-4 super science revolutionaries.
As youthful super scientist revolutionaries you wield a limited supply of near magical technology cards
and dice.

Your goal is to overthrow the fascist government and rescue the city before your resources are depleted and progress is destroyed.

Lucid City was a paradise, the home of innovative and artistic superscience. Then came the Undoing and life was nearly extinguished by greedy bureaucratic zealots. They suppressed progress, released engineered plagues and destroyed most valuable tech to consolidate power. All hope was lost.

Skillful and efficient play, converting limited innovation cards and renewable dice technology, is required to save the day.
But with each step towards enlightenment, the enemy will try to counter your progress towards illumination. Tense, exciting play forces the players to integrate their actions, and use their resources with great wisdom.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Bushido: Tra-Peng
description:
Description from the publisher:

Tra-peng has distinguished himself from the horde of his brothers. Stronger, faster, more skilled, such attributes in a Bakemono are rare due to the jealousy invoked and the inevitable dagger found in one’s back. However the support Tra-peng receives from his bat companion combined with his own physical dominance has allowed him to attain an almost revered state amongst his peers.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Yusha
description:
Description from the publisher:

A terrible and furious oni, Yusha the vindictive is a master of controlling, focusing and leashing the destructive ferocity of those unlucky enough to find themselves under his lash. Whether it’s the vicious lion like Kaihei, blood maddened slaves or a gaggle of Bakemono eager to prove themselves to this hulking master. Yusha’s command of the Kaihei comes from his position amongst them as the undisputed pride alpha, his own feral nature allowing him to easily assume dominance over a pride and drive them to almost breaking point, through rage and frequent strings of the lash.

Blister contains one model, one 50mm base and one full colour profile card.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Nightwing Swarm
description:
Description from the publisher:

A thousand pair of red eyes glowing in the darkness, a thousand fangs thirsting for blood. The Wave and the Council of Shadow’s Shugenja have many tricks ready to play in the game of war. Now they have unleashed nightwings from their cage of rock and blackness. Like leather winged locusts they tear through the countryside, gorging on those unfortunate enough to be caught in their path, leaving only the withered husks, sucked dry as a reminder of their unquenchable thirst.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Bakemono Beast Rider
description:
Description from the publisher:

As the war fought above and below ground intensifies all sides are pushed to find more weapons and soldiers to turn the tide in their favour. The Council of Shadows is no different and selects the bravest and foolhardiest of the bakemono warriors to capture and master the beasts that live in the shadows. Only the few survive, but those that do are able to ride these murderous monsters into battle with devastating effect.

Please be advised that this model requires Giant Cave Bat (BSW015) or The Nian (BSW008) to be played in game but can be used in conjunction with either.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Itsunagi Ito
description: Ito Itsunagi is the eldest of the heirs to the Ito clan. His training has been second to none and his skill at arms is quite astounding. A brutal and coldblooded killer, his only downfall is his arrogance, mocking opponents with his lack of armour.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Sakura
description: A priestess of Orochi, she has dedicated her life to the snake kami and has been favoured by beginning the transformation. With the merest of looks Sakura can corrupt a man, turning the blood running through his veins into poison.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Satsuki
description:
The strength of sisterhood found in the Shisai of Orochi is not like the standard bonds found in faith. The Shisai of Orochi are spiritually and mentally stronger in the presence of their sisters. Few in the Jwar Isles can challenge the will of two let alone three of these fervent believers in Orochi’s power. Satsuki like the other Shisai lets Orochi’s will flow through her, becoming a channel with which Orochi can strike down its enemies. Those who stand against the Ito shisai fall crumpled to ground, wracked in agony as Orochi’s poison destroys their bodies from the inside, Satsuki’s presence accelerating the process to terrifying speeds, leaving only the faithful to walk in Orochi’s lands.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Mizuki Ito
description:
Another daughter of the Ito clan succumbed to the temptation of Orochi’s Blessing. Once a beautiful child of the Ito, with many a samurai lord interested in claiming her hand for a son. That was all before she started the visions that led her to her one and only partner, for now she is wed to Orochi. The Blessing awakening a deep power within her, granting her the power to grant minor gifts to fellow believers to conduct Orochi’s bidding. Her gaze able to bend the minds of even the most resolute to her own ends or freeze them in place until they might serve a purpose for this deadly and beautiful Shugenja of the Ito.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Shimogama Vipers
description:
The island of Izu is one of the less habitable places in the whole of the Jwar Isles, bestowed upon the Ito as a slight by the Eagle clan to make it clear to all, including their subordinate clan, who rules. A broken landscape with little arable land for farming, brimming with danger and hazard from the hostile terrain or its inhabitants, beasts unique to the island fill its dense jungles. Beautiful as they are exotic, with colourings to make the royal gardens seem dull in comparison. Amongst the many reptiles lurking in the shadows of the canopy the Shimogama vipers are some of the largest and deadliest. Five foot of muscle, harnessed by great feathery wings enables the snake’s great power and movement, striking without warning and disappearing just as fast. These ancient predators of the jungle are drawn to the service of their mother in times of war.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Space Ballistic Missile Wars
description:
"Two rival space outpost's try to knock over the opponent's space fleet, but there is a new angle! Missiles must rebound off of back or sides of game board to hit targets. Play area measures 15 3/4 x 13 1/4 x 2 1/2 inches high. Plastic. Imported. For 2 Players. ... For ages 5 years to Adult"

—description from the Sears Christmas Catalog 1983, page 585

Each player takes turns firing spring loaded cannon at the other player's ships. A BB would arc across the tilted play area and land on the opponent's side, hopefully hitting their ship. If hit, the ship would flip over revealing an explosion sticker.

While the official rules encouraged alternating one shot at a time, shots could be fired rapidly, with only your BB supply the limiting factor. As your opponent also fired it would replenish.

Similar to Epoch's 1974 Torpedo game, but with a self recycling ball mechanism that removes the fuss and set up of that game.

—user summary

name: Bushido: Matoko
description:
Matoko fights under the house of the bleeding moon for the Shadow Wind Clan. On the battlefield she is everywhere and nowhere at once. Enemies struggle to keep up with her in melee combat and those that try to retaliate amidst her onslaught often find she has already gone. As deadly as she is beautiful, her face is the last thing many will see.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Tarobo
description:
The Blue Gale scouts are comprised of the quickest and most nimble of the Suzume. Tarobo as the fastest amongst them, ducking and dashing from combat, foes swinging at empty air as the bushi severs limbs with the Blue Gale signature short blade. Always accompanied by a number of wild hunting birds that create a network of eyes for identifying any threat and swarming to distract them.
— description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Bikou – Kaze Kage Zoku
description:
Her true affiliation is now revealed, an agent of the Kage Kaze Zoku right in the heart of the Prefecture, her true mission unclear, but it only goes to show the ninja can infiltrate anywhere. A ghost and skilled assassin, almost impossible to pin down in melee she is as elusive as the morning fog, as deadly as the Takifugi, her enemies can never know when or where she will strike. The danger only increased further as part of a Shadow Wind death squad.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.

This model is only sold during conventions.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: The Somme Campaign 1916
description:
A WWI Board Game - #6 in the Somme Series

A two player board game of generalship at army level during World War I and is a race against time which begins on the second day of the British offensive.

The British must break through and capture Bapaume before the onset of winter. Can the German defences hold and stymie the British assault with the perfect counter attack? Can you do better than Haig and von Falkenhayn & Ludendorff?

VIII Corps v1.0
£13.25 each.
Game board (A3, folded).
Tracker board (A5).
Set of counters (A5, not pre-cut).
Rules (A4, two pages plus covers).
All items except rules in full colour.
Printed on 350 gsm quality white card.
Comes in a grip seal bag.
Shipped in a card backed envelope.

name: Soldiers of the Sun
description:
Soldiers of the Sun is a solo, tactical treatment of infantry conflict in the Pacific theater during WWII. The innovative system functions without a map and incorporates a unique activation system that pits units of the team/squad scale against each other. Initiative can change rapidly throughout game turns via chit draw and each turn has the potential to end abruptly with the inclusion of sudden death chits. Unit activation is paid for via point system. Includes 6 scenarios but the real fun starts when you utilize the built in system to construct your own scenarios.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling

name: Renown: The Game
description:
Renown - The Game brings back a traditional Austrian card game. The original game is still played in Austria but it is getting more and more forgotten. Decades ago there were many tournaments and it was played in almost every tavern. It is called “Schnapsen”, probably because the winner was rewarded with a shot of schnapps. We have modernized it with a lot of modifications, action and player interactions. We have added a set of action cards which can alter the whole gameplay.

Renown - The Game features four different races: the bloodthirsty Ogres, the forsaken Humfrogs, the greedy Goblins and the schnapps-loving Shiners

Be the first one to earn 48 points by beating your enemies in different round types to win the game. Send your characters into fights and gather 66 Renown which you need to get your beloved points.

To reward the best strategic player there are seven different round types, which give you more points, the more difficult your strategy is to follow. Some of the rounds require you to earn 66 Renown fast, others will challenge you to win all the fights.

Each race has five different characters, who are ranked like this: The Chief, the Warden, the Sorceress, the Soldier and the Dork.

You start each round by selecting a dominating race, which makes every member of this race stronger than any card of the other races. When a player plays a character, the other players usually have to follow with the same race, if they have one. The higher ranked characters beat the lower ranked ones. This means: The chief beats everyone from the warden to the dork, the warden beats everyone from the sorceress to the dork and so on. If a player does not have a card of the first played race, he has to play one of the dominating race. If the player does not have a card of the dominating race either, he needs to send another race into the fight. However, this one cannot beat the first played card.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Trick-taking

name: Wild West Exodus: Gunfight at Red Oak
description:
A chance encounter in the town of Red Oak between the notorious Outlaw Jessie James and the grim Lawman Wyatt Earp erupts into open conflict. This easy introductory set includes ten multi-part plastic miniatures, a rulebook, tokens, templates, dice and the Action and Adventure card decks. An ideal starting point to get you playing Wild West Exodus.

—description from the publisher
categories: American West, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: The Grey Pilgrim
description:
She's the daughter of Raijin, the god of thunder.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Xi
description:
Xi’s driving motivation is to ensure her sister’s safety. Whilst she shares her sisters desire to bring the brothers to justice and see them pay for their crimes she does not prioritise it over the wellbeing of Yangjing or Yizhi. Her heritage always made her feel like an outsider in the courts of the Empire and she has found great self worth being the sword arm of her sisters, frustrating their would be attackers with perfectly orchestrated defence.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Yizhi
description:
Yizhi of the three sisters is a nightmare for opponents that like to plan their lines of attack, her speed and unpredictability means such plans fail by her first onslaught. Yizhi chooses when and where she will engage the enemy. Any that attempt to isolate and pick off one of her sisters are likely to quickly find themselves outnumbered. During their long hunt they have learned the importance of supporting each other.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Yanjing
description:
Yanjing is a formidable warrior in her own right. From a young age she had an affinity to the bow and her skills are impressive. Her calm zen archery produces impressive results, the arrows whispering across the battlefield as quietly as the falling blossom. Her ability to heal her sisters is of vital importance to their mission and without it they would have had to have given up on their quarry a long time ago.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Meine kleine Märchen Memo Box
description: Meine kleine Märchen Memo Box includes three fairy tales: Hansel and Gretel, Snow White, and Little Red Riding Hood. Each fairy tale is split up into twelve scenes, which is twelve memo cards. The players choose one of the three sets and place the memo cards facedown in the middle of the table. Each player tries to turn over the memo card with the number 1 on it. If they succeed, they try to turn over the next highest memo card. If they don’t succeed, their turn is over. The aim is to turn over all twelve memo cards in the right order, which is the order of the fairy tale. Whoever does this first wins.

name: Malifaux: Dawn Serpent
description:
A native of Earth, Dawn Serpents were brought through the breach by the Ten Thunders to further their plans. Unfortunately one or two may have escaped...
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Malifaux: Lone Swordsman
description:
I remember a story my father told me when I was a boy, before the annihilation of my clan.

There was once a man who had dishonored his family, and he swore to the Gods that he would go into the forest and slay the most ferocious beast he could find to bring them honor again. So the man did as he said, braving claw and fang to fell the largest, most feral thing he had ever laid eyes on. But, after he had completed his task, the man got lost in the forest.

Fearing the Gods were still angry, he slew beast after breast, each larger and more ferocious than the last, but nothing seemed to please the Gods.

Finally, the man forgot that he was a man at all and became a beast himself, lost in the forest.

Ten Thunders Box Set, containing one 32mm 'heroic' scale miniature made of high quality plastic. Will require some preparation and assembly.

Set Contains:

Models

Lone Swordsman

Stat Cards

Lone Swordsman
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Golem Arcana: Gudanna – Sun Viper
description:
Elite unit for the Arcanum Gudanna Sand Viper

Dodge: 15
Armor: 6
Hit Points: 70
Movement Abilities:
Walk (1AP): 4 mp

Attack Abilities:
Burning Lash (1AP): 85 acc, 25 dmg, melee. If a Golem is in a Region that activates its passive, the Target is moved to an adjacent Region. This does not affect Colossi.
Solar Flare (2AP): 75 acc, 25 dmg, 1 rng. If this Golem is in a Region that activates its passive, this attack deals an extra 10 Damage and costs 1 less AP to use.

Passive Abilities:
Bask in Light: If this Golem is in a Control Region, or a Region that has had a Mana Well, it always gains 15 Dodge.
categories: Electronic, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Imphal 1944
description:
This is a mini game of the Battle of Imphal, 1944.


Map to be downloaded, die cut counters included with Command Magazine Japan #114.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Knossus
description:
Brave the Labyrinth and face the Minotaur! In this cat and mouse game, it's kill or be killed, and everyone for themselves. Dare you enter?

Based on the legend of Theseus and the Minotaur, Knossus is set in the ancient time, where 7 youths have been sent by the City of Athens, to be sacrificed to the minotaur in the labyrinth of King Minos.

It is designed to be a gateway game suitable for a family to play or as light relief between more heavyweight games. Gameplay style varies with the group - from fast and furious, action packed charging around the labyrinth, to tactical chess-like experience where strategic players face off in a game played several moves ahead.

The game plays by drawing 4 cards - you must choose two to control your hero, and two to control the Minotaur. They may be played in any order, and augmented by receiving the blessing of the gods from various shrines found in the labyrinth. There are also items to help you in your quest but you may only carry one at a time.

Balancing luck with strategy, Knossus is designed to engage the group for the whole 30 minutes - even eliminated players are still able to control the minotaur for that last sweet act of revenge. And there's nothing so satisfying as sending the monster charging into your rivals, slaying them, only to end his run on the point of your sword, winning you the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Happy Birthday
description:
Each player selects a color and places the corresponding candles, rosettes, and marbles on top the plastic cake in front of them. One player turns over a card from the deck, which will show one of the numbers that matches the numbers on the rosettes. Simultaneously all players will try to blow the marble off their numbered candle. The marbles that are successfully blown off will fall into the middle of the cake and down a chute. The player whose marble falls down the chute first wins the round. All other players must put their marbles back onto their candles.

The first player to blow all 4 of their candles out wins.

name: Hrabia
description:
Hrabia ("The Count") is for the most part a cooperative card game. Players take on prominent characters, patriots from Wielkopolska and military leaders of the Wielkopolska Uprising. They try to support events leading up to the uprising and also to contribute to its success.

Players are connected by a common cause - propagation and strengthening of Polishness and national identity among the people living in the area and to help Poles in emigration and in the country to develop entrepreneurship and mechanization on the Polish lands. Final goal is Poland regaining independence by merging Polish territories. Players try to best serve the homeland but also compete to support as much as possible any patriotic initiative and in the end get the most recognition by the countrymen and ?subscribe gold on the history cards? - each of them wants to become the greatest national hero.

The game is divided into nine rounds separated by significant historical events in three periods and the game ends by the outbreak of the Wielkopolska Uprising.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: The Middle Class Game: The Game of the Times
description:
The Middle Class Game: The Game of the Times is a roll and move game that revolves around dealing with career events, Life events, government policies, personalities and American trivia. As the game progresses, choices are available to choose different paths in your career and "sell out" to different factions.
Players start the game in one of four middle Class careers. As play continues, each player has the chance to SELL OUT to Big Business, Welfare , Organized Crime or Government. The players compete against each other as well as the ever present Middleman. The winner is the player who reaches "Security City" with the most amount of money.
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Romulan Faction Pack
description: The Romulan Faction Pack is a pre-built fleet of four ships for the Romulan faction: a Valdore class, a D'deridex class, a scout vessel and a science vessel. Included are ships, tokens, dials, bases and 26 cards. Everything needed to fly the ships straight out of the box.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: TOUR OF DUTY: VIETNAM – A Roleplaying Board Game of Combat during the Vietnam War (1965-1973)
description:
TOUR OF DUTY: VIETNAM is a Board Game of Combat during the Vietnam War (1965-1973) for one to four players. Players assume the role of American Soldiers or Marines during the Vietnam War by creating their own Player Soldier Characters. Player Soldiers are part of a Rifle Squad or Team serving in an Infantry or Special Forces Unit. Your Squad or Team will be assigned a variety of Missions that you must complete during your Tour of Duty. Missions include Reconnaissance, Intelligence Gathering, Ambushes, Raids, Search & Destroy, Hearts and Minds, Rescues and many others.
GAME OBJECTIVE: The objective of TOUR OF DUTY: VIETNAM is to successfully complete a number of missions to locate and destroy enemy forces in order to gain Victory Points (VP) for the US Forces. The player can choose to play a short game (6 Missions), a moderate game (9 Missions) or a full Tour (12 Missions). Once all Missions have been resolved (successfully or not) the Player totals his VP and compares this with the Victory Determination Table to determine the level of success.

OPTIONAL RULES: There are rules for playing as Australian SAS Soldiers and Rules, Counters and Cards for playing a French-Indochina War Campaign.

TOUR OF DUTY: VIETNAM Can be found at the following URL:
http://www.berserkergames.net

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing

name: Army of Orkness: A 2-Bit Tower Defense Card Game (2nd Edition)
description:
Army of Orkness: A 2-Bit Tower Defense Card Game (2nd Edition) is a lighthearted fantasy themed cooperative tower defense card games for 2-4 players.

In Army of Orkness: A 2-Bit Tower Defense Card Game (2nd Edition), players must work together to defend the castle against the relentless onslaught of the invading Orc horde. To do that, the active player must roll dice and determine what kind of actions to take during the turn: 1) buy towers and strategically place them along the path, 2) attack the Orcs from an existing tower, or 3)discard a die and reroll all of the remaining dice. In addition to the Orcs, players must also deal with constantly cycled Event Cards that can help them or hinder them during the turn.

The game ends when either: 1) Wave 5 of the Orc assault is completed. If the Castle has at least 1 Life remaining, the players win, or 2) the Castle takes damage greater than or equal to its Life and is destroyed, in which case the Orcs win.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Demons and Demigods
description:
The throne has remained vacant for far too long, demons assault the city, and the people have become desperate. You have travelled far to arrive in the city of Bloodstone. The desperate situation in the city has forced the Council to reach out to the powerful Demigods in hopes of finding a new ruler. You have five days to gain the favour of the council and the people. They are eager to be impressed.
Your paths to victory are numerous: complete quests to gain favor and influence; slay the demons that spawn each night and harvest them for the riches that lay within; amass great wealth and purchase symbols of status to impress the masses.
You are not the only hero to see this as their opportunity. Others have journeyed to the city and will fight to impede your progress at every turn. Can you win the favour of the Council and become the next Ruler?

Demons and Demigods is a deep strategy game with immense replayability. In fact, no two games will ever be the same.

Players can all play with the same faction abilities by playing as "Civilians", or each player can choose to play as a Demigod - a unique faction with special abilities and Rages. Play as a Warlock, Earth Elemental, Giant, or one of the other unique Demigods.

Throughout 5 days, players will track their time using a unique and intuitive time track. This track consists of 24 spaces. Each player begins with 12 time before the Midnight Oil ends their day, but through upgrades it is possible to improve Ambition and start the day with more time. Each movement through the city and actions at a building costs time, so plan your route and day wisely. Whoever has the most time remaining in the day will always play next - so player order is dynamic. Once you enter the Midnight Oil your day will end.

Players move their characters throughout the game board using a one-of-a-kind worker placement mechanic. Your character blocks building action spaces. When you move, the building action space becomes available. Each game includes 9 randomly placed buildings. Depending on your strategy and immediate needs you may want to visit the Butcher to gain Bloodstones, or the Blacksmith to buy gear. You may wish to travel to the Market to make some important trades, or maybe you need to visit the Grand Palace to improve your influence. During all of this, your character is also tasked with slaying the demons that lurk at buildings and playing quests. Slaying demons and playing quests allow a character to gain influence at a building. This is tracked through a dynamic area control mechanic which makes use of a character's energy. Quests are also assigned to 1 of the 5 council members. Each member has specific themes attached to the quest, and at the end of the game, you are rewarded for having a variety of council members showing. This means you must diversify your strategies in order to impress the entire council.

Each day players will try to improve their engine to maximize the income at Day's End. They do this by unlocking dormant cubes and visiting the Philosopher's Study for upgrades. Spend the Bloodstones you have collected from slaying demons to upgrade your character. Some upgrade examples are: Income (silver, gold, energy regeneration, etc.), and Ambition (more time).

Your character starts with 18 energy cubes. These cubes are incredibly dynamic and will be used for combat with demons, upgrading abilities, area control influence, and more. How you manage your energy will greatly affect your chances of success.

At the end of the game players will score points based on their demon slays, influence, council support, and resources.

Can you be the next Ruler of Bloodstone?
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Mini Gangs
description:
Mini Gangs is a post-apocalyptic miniatures skirmish rule set that combines ease of play with great strategic options resulting in a quick game with loads of depth. Its ideal for short club games, for playing a campaign and for getting beginners into tabletop battle games.

Mini Gangs can be played in three different ways, each appealing to a different level of gamer:

Gateway- A simple and easy game for beginners. Mini Gangs Gateway is designed to teach beginners how to play table top strategy games. It great for children of 6 years or older as the simple rules mean its easy to understand. It is also good for adults who have never played model based games before. It teaches all the core concepts that are used in more complex games.

Casual- A game for easy play and deep strategy. Mini Gangs Casual adds a deck of cards. These cards represent equipment, weapons and skills for your gang. This adds a layer of depth to the basic rules which makes it ideal for quick games. Whilst being simple, Casual makes for rewarding play. Mini Gangs Casual is great for club or gaming groups as it is a fast paced multi player game.

Hardcore- A sophisticated in-depth gaming experience. Mini Gangs Hardcore features a full points system, campaign rules and scenarios.
categories: Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, Zombies
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Seat Wars: Kickstarter Mini-Expansion
description: This mini expansion includes cards that were designed by those who backed Seat Wars on Kickstarter. These cards are designed to be added seamlessly into the original game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor

name: Test of Honour: The Samurai Miniatures Games – Ninja Blister #1
description:
Experts of assassination, this 3 man kill team is the ideal counter to those pesky samurai warriors which stand in your way. The samurai won't even know they're coming...

This blister pack contains 3 Ninja and the Ninja group recruitment card.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Depths of Courage: The Raids on Algeciras
description:
Starting in December of 1942, and again in May and July of 1943, the Italians used an interned freighter, the Olterra, as a base from which their “frogmen” limpeters commandoes conducted daring night-time raids against Allied shipping in the harbor near Gibraltar. The raiders’ base of operations was never discovered until Italy surrendered on September 8, 1943. During the time they were active; the Italian commandos sank or severely damaged many Allied ships, making them one of the most daring clandestine raiding forces of WWII.

The active player takes on the role of the commanders of the three or four, two-man crew S.L.C (siluro lenta corsa) Maiale (Pig) class mini-submarines. You must endeavor to overcome the Allied defenses and night-time visibility to inflict as much damage as possible before being killed, captured or escaping.

Each copy of Depths of Courage, Volume 8: The Raids on Algeciras is composed of the following:


One 11 by 17 inch point-to-point map.
22 double-sided, un-mounted counters
2 pages of rules


A player will also need a standard deck of playing cards and a six-sided die to play the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Tight Red Pants: The Card Game
description:
Crystopolis is ravaged by crime! Arch villains rule the streets, making life downright miserable and dangerous for our good citizens. Their only hope is a small band of local residents, dedicated to upholding the law, protecting the public and banishing the evil, marauding monsters from this once great city.

No-one knows the true identities of these local heroes (except for Mrs McGinty, who knits their superhero outfits) and you, a member of the Tight Red Pants Alliance.

It's time to pull them up, and take them down! The villains that is. Tight Red Pants is a simple to play, fun super hero battling card game that will keep your little heroes and grown up ones entertained for hours. Comes with everything you need to play including the world's first flat dice! A game for 2-4 people aged 8 plus

How to play Tight Red Pants the game

You control a bunch of home grown heroes and have to save the General Public (GPs) from evil villains before Teatime. The game ends when either: The Teatime card turns up 3 times or if all four locations are out with one villain and one GP or one hero wins 5 battles

When setting up you remove the dice card and put all the green bus stop (GP cards) to one side, public side down. Choose a location card and place face up on the table. Shuffle the rest and deal three hand cards face down to each player, then place the remaining cards face down as the draw pile. Shuffle and use again when depleted. The discard pile will go next to this.

Play. On your go pick up one card and play as many hand cards as you wish. Do not hold more than five. ‘Red Pant’ cards are always played or discarded if no effect. Play goes clockwise

MAKING A SCENE. As you lay cards fights break out all over the city (table) but first you need a location card then a villain and finally one GP from the bus stop. Place this on the location. This scene is then complete

HOW TO FIGHT VILLAINS. Players then (on their go) use any hero in their hand to fight that baddie. Defeat the villain to collect and save the GP cards to eventually win the game. Save your GPs to one side. If you play all your cards pick up another three and have one more go. Move on after one fight.

PUNCH-UP Process Once a location, a villain and some GPs are in place any hero can battle the villain. Use the Dice Card to fight, adjust the stats for any item or henchmen cards added.

Note these stats down before fighting on the score pad.

Now try to roll your Attack or below to hit. If you do, then roll again for damage to reduce the villain’s HPs to zero. Villains then roll in the same way. Ask another player to roll for them. Continue until either is defeated. If you win you get to keep the GPs, if you lose the villain stays on play and another GP is added to scene. You go is over.

The game continues in the same way each player challenging the villains at the locations. Collect and use your item cards to help your heroes and eventually the tea time will turn up 3 times.

Then it's game over. The player with the most GPs wins or nobody wins if the villains overrun the city

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Zombie in My Pocket: Masque maya
description:
Expansion for Zombie in my pocket.

'Mayan Mask' promo card is shuffled in with the other Event cards

This card has the effect of announcing the end of the world on 21/12/2012, according to a Mayan prophecy.

The rules to the cards:

When the current group leader chooses the 'explorer' action, he places a new 'Location' card and moves the group to it or moves it to a 'Location' card already visited.

Then he has to solve an event. He draws a card from the top of the Event stack. If this is the Maya Mask card and the current time is:
- 21h, nothing happens, he discards the card.
- 22h, nothing happens, he discards the card.
- 23h, the effect 'Mask Maya' applies. Each fighter loses his life points and the game has won
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Brewin' USA: Taproom Takeover
description:
The brewing industry in the USA is flourishing and taprooms are leading the way attracting customers to the site of creation for the ambitious new ales hitting the market.

Players compete to brew craft beer and fill their taproom with the best lineup of liquid gold. Taproom Takeover brings dice drafting to the world of Brewin' USA and adding new Breweries and beer cards that can play with the original Brewin' USA.

Draft an ingredient die or brew a beer if you have obtained the necessary ingredients. Stock your taproom quickly with the classic beer styles, or be the mad chemist and line the taps with experimental brews. When somebody has brewed 5 beers, the game ends and the highest score wins.

Players will also need to focus on expanding their taproom with more offerings to brew their 3rd, 4th, and 5th beer. A player may spend two dice showing the Tap facing to acquire a new beer tap. Each beer tap may have an action that the player may use on their turn as well as 1-2 beer styles and VP associated with each style.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Annihilation Zombies
description:
Groks Games brings you a thrilling turn based card game where you and your friends fight off zombie hordes until there is only one survivor left standing. Use Ranged and Melee weapons to deal damage to the attacking zombies, but watch out, one of the other players may attempt to turn on you in an instant. Game includes over 180 cards, 2 D6 Dice, 20 Bite tokens, and the "Rules to live by" instruction booklet.

OBJECTIVE: Be the last living Survivor. Help or betray your friends to survive and win!

SETUP: There are 3 decks. The Zombie Deck, Loot Deck, and Event Deck. Shuffle each deck and place them face down. Each Survivor (player) is dealt 5 cards from the Loot Deck for their starting hand. Now you’re ready to fight some zombies!

HOW TO DIE: Each time you attack a zombie and do not kill it, the zombie bites you and you receive 1 Bite Token. If you have 5 or more Bite Tokens and you have no way of healing yourself, you die and are out of the game.

THE LINE: The Line is where zombies go when they’re revealed. The Line is how you fight multiple zombies you encounter. Zombies are set one after the other in a line in the order they are revealed. When you enter your combat phase, the first zombie in the line becomes the Active Zombie. (See Combat Phase for more information.)

HOW YOUR TURN WORKS: If it is your turn, you are the Active Survivor. To start your turn you’ll encounter a zombie.

ENCOUNTER PHASE: Reveal the top card of the Zombie Deck and put it on The Line.
PREPARATION PHASE: You have a chance to play or trade Loot Cards from your hand before engaging the Active Zombie in combat. You may also ask for help and make a Contract with any Survivor(s). (See Contracts for more information.) When you’re done preparing, move to the Combat Phase.

COMBAT PHASE:
The first zombie in The Line becomes the Active Zombie.
The Active Zombie or Event’s ability takes effect (if any).
If it is a zombie card, you may try to run. (See Running section for more information.)
If you fail to run or don’t want to, declare which weapon you're attacking with and attack the Active Zombie. (See Weapons and Combat for more information.)
Repeat this process until all of the zombies on The Line are dead and then loot their corpses.

LOOT PHASE:
Draw Loot cards for all of the zombies you have killed. (The number of loot a zombie gives is next to the treasure chest at the bottom right corner of the Zombie card.)
Events such as Smoke Bomb and Bad Luck prevent you from receiving loot on that turn.
Running from zombies and making contracts will change how much loot you receive.
Survivors may play, trade, give away, or discard any cards they can before the end of a turn.

When the Loot Deck runs out of cards to draw, do not re-shuffle the Loot Deck. Once the loot is gone, zombies are worth zero loot and you must survive with what you have!

END OF TURN: All Survivors must discard down to 5 cards or 10 if they have an active Backpack.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Trading

name: Your Family Rocks!
description:
Your Family Rocks puts your family memories at the center of the board game. The game uses your own family photos as the 60 “family cards” in the game, being the first your-photos-into-cards board game, where your photos play the central role in the game mechanics, influencing the gameplay, strategy, and outcome.

Whatever is in your pictures is now fair game – you are now the creator of your own game!

The game unfolds over different dynamics about family memories (photos). The better the players perform on these dynamics - Challenges - the more Family Time they will earn. As in real life, it takes time to raise a family, so players will use their Family Time to grow their family members, values, rules and objects - each worth different prosperity points.

At the end of game, the most prosperous family wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Ardor: Bending Time
description:
We believe in LOVE
But love, without communication, is incomplete.
Expressing what you like from your sex life is sometimes more difficult than saying "I love you!"
To enable communication so you can enjoy LOVE, we made Ardor.
By a couple. For couples.

Ardor - Bending Time is a card game for couples (and very close friends). For 2-4 players, +18.
Designed to inspire you, 135 cards contain 60 activities and 35 sex positions selected to encourage exploration and discovery.

It has two parts:
"Part 1":
Use strategy to compete for points in a trick and draw card game.

Follow the suits and the points to win cards.
Perform small activities during this part to increase your chances of winning the game.
The player with most points wins the ARDOR prize card and leads the next part.

"Part 2" : Build decks with the cards won.
Draw from the deck and decide if you will Enhance or Level-up the activity before performing it.

Activities can be Enhanced, by introducing toys, or other accessories, to them.
They can also be Leveled-Up, adding a twist to the whole activity.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Trick-taking

name: Fast Freight
description:
I do not know much about this game, here is the little I know.

I belong to the San Luis Obispo Railroad Museum. The board for this game is displayed on the wall in the museum. The board displays the names and logos of 48 different railroads of the united states circa 1948. The board shows the routes of these different railroads and the major cities they services. I assume this was a pickup and delivery game, but I am not sure.

The game board is 15 X 24 inches.

A little more information from the Museum on this:

"The box was falling apart and so was discarded, as was the instruction sheet. I recall there were also small, lightweight cardboard markers, probably some original and some added by a previous owner."

"The object was to earn points by delivering carloads of freight to destinations named on the board, and to earn more points than opponents by controlling routes so they could not make deliveries."

"Of the 48 railroads named, only two still operate under those names: Union Pacific, and Kansas City Southern." December 2016

name: Blackwood: The Halloween Pumpkin
description:
Promo found in Plato Magazine 100.

The card is shuffled in with the other cards during set up.

Halloween Pumpkins have strange virtue: when the time comes to prepare potions, the pumpkin replaces any ingredient.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval

name: To The Death!
description:
This is a dueling game for 2 or more players using a standard 52 card deck of cards. The object is to be the last player with any life points left. Players start with 13 life points each, which can be represented with tokens or coins.

Game-play/Card designations:
[Numbered Cards (2-10)]

Spades are attack cards, and deplete life points equal to the value of the spade card.
Clubs are defense cards and block attack points equal to the value of the club card.
Hearts are healing cards and can restore life points equal to the value of the heart card (up to a total of 13 life points).
Diamonds are used to buy back cards from the discard pile.


[Face Cards (king, queen, jack, ace)]

Kings are used to steal numbered diamond cards from an opponent's hand.
Queens are used to steal numbered heart cards from an opponent's hand.
Jacks are used to steal numbered spade cards from an opponent's hand.
Aces are used to get a new hand of cards.


—description from the designer

name: Spice Empires
description:
1st place at Epitrapezio 2018.

All great empires want to conquer the famous Spice Islands, but who will prevail? At the King’s order, you sail to these lands, eager to discover new sources of the most valuable goods. Build new settlements to strengthen your dominance, ports to take control of the maritime trade and forts to protect the colony and fend off your heinous rivals. Remember that plenty of esteemed people wait in your motherland for your ships, expecting to find them full spices!

Players explore the islands, discover spices and place buildings, either cities, forts or ports. Cities help them control the islands, ports let them trade the spices and profit while the forts let them attack their enemies' buildings. The board is modular and the spices are placed in a random fashion so that each time players explore a different map.

—description from the designer

name: Enso Koi
description:
Navigate your school of Koi Fish across the Koi Pond to dominate the pond!

Enso Koi is a game of decisiveness, deep strategy, and introspection.

2-6 Players with a 1 player-skirmish mode. 20-40+ minute game duration.

Players go head to head or in teams to out maneuver the other Koi fish.

Uses stones to blockade sections of the pond, and bring koi fish back to play by catching Lotus flowers.
Enso Koi is easy to learn but takes generations to master! (( Just ask the fish ))

This strategy game is best played with a nice fresh cup of tea.

name: Rune Society
description:
Rune Society is a unique and fast-paced strategic card game set in a world of forbidden magic. In Rune Society you will take an 18 card deck and face off against friend or foe in a variety of tournament style competitive formats.

Rune Society is designed to have the strategy and versatility of a collectible trading card game without the need to chase down rare and expensive cards.

One copy of Rune Society is enough for up to 4 players to each build unique decks and compete against one another in a variety of tournament-style formats.

Players can take those same 4 decks and face an elite Nemesis from the "Rune Society" Universe with the purchase of a Nemesis Deck expansion pack.

Fans of strategic card game tournament play can also combine multiple decks for even more ways to play!
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: GearGrid
description:
You blatantly lied on your CV and got hired by the world's best Gear Moving Factory. It is your first day at the job and the boss is smelling something fishy about the new recruits. He places you in the Ultra Modern Testing Grounds to test your skills. The one who ends up the best will start working... for others, tough luck.

Pick up gear tiles as quickly as possible and try to make right connections and fill up the board... 1-4 players, virtually no setup time and 1-3 minutes per round.

During a game, each player picks up gear tiles from the common pool and adds them to their own board. Each tile must be connected (diagonally or orthogonally) to the engine tile via coloured squares. If a player successfully connects 3 goal tiles with the engine tile so that goal tiles turn in the right direction, he scores 3 points for each. Each empty space on the board is worth -1 point at the end of the game.

Players must be careful, invalid connections might make whole sections of the board invalid and empty before the scoring. No two tiles may be connected via different colours, and a tile connected with two tiles that turn in two different directions is also invalid.

A round lasts between 1 and 3 minutes (players choice, depends on skill). The player with the best score is the winner.

Players may also choose to use or not use both sides of the gear tiles that easily show which gear turns in which direction. Using both sides makes the game much easier and it is recommended for the first games.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: The Battle of Kursk: The Card Game
description:
Η διάσημη αρματομαχια του Β 'Παγκοσμίου Πολέμου, μεταξύ του Κόκκινου Στρατού και του Γερμανικού Στρατού, ζει μέσα από τις εξαιρετικές κάρτες του παιχνιδιού. Τα ακριβή στοιχεία όλων των μονάδων, οι μοναδικές τακτικές, η στρατηγική υψηλού επιπέδου και η δυνατότητα δημιουργίας μιας μοναδικής σύγκρουσης σε κάθε ξεκίνημα ενός νέου γύρου παιχνιδιών, αυξάνονται το μέγιστο, τόσο στην αναπαραγωγή όσο και στην απόλαυση του παιχνιδιού, και για τους 2 και 4 παίκτες ...

The famous tank battle of World War II, between the Red Army & the German Army, lives through the exceptional cards of the game. The accurate elements of all the units, the unique tactics, the high level strategy & the ability to create a unique conflict in every start of a new game round, are growing the most, in both playability & enjoyment of the game, for both 2 and 4 players.

How to play:
The game can be played either with 1 vs 1 or 2 vs 2 as pairs.
Each player or pair, takes the role of either the German Army or the Soviet Army.

The game has a damage point system to figure the winner. The first player who reaches 20 points (40 points for 4 players) on board meter, will be the winner of the battle. Damage points are equal to life points (red cross with specific number in each card).

Every card has 7 different sectors (boxes):

Upper: from left to right :
First box - Velocity of weapon
Second box - Weapon's Penetration level
Third box - Own armor level
Fourth box - Own life points

Lower:
First box - movement
Middle Double number target - 2 x 12sided dice (black for German/White for Soviet), both numbers in dice is the damage area for the weapon. A 10 on the dice is a Critical hit & any unit who receives this damage must be removed from the battle ground.
Finally, the blue pointer with the specific number is the encounter points needed for this unit to use it in the deployment phase of the battle.

Each turn:
1. Encounter points (both armies start with 5 each)
2. Draw phase - each player draws 2 cards
3. Move phase - each player can move their units
4. Deployment phase - each player can deploy any unit if he has the necessary encounter points
5. Engagement phase - each player can attack the enemy player based on the abilities of their units
6. Discard phase
7. End of turn

Before the first turn all players must draw 5 cards each and receives 5 encounter tokens. There is a 7 card hand limit. Some cards can give the player the ability to draw a general commander
card from their own general deck.

There can be no more than 2 generals active during the battle, but a player can change a general card by discarding the old one and playing a new one.

Each general gives 1 additional encounter points in the beginning of each turn. Also, each player receives 1 encounter point every turn and 1 additional point for every unit deployed in the battlefield.

Players can combine cards if it is allowed in the card's description but only until the end of the turn (except the end of battle for some cards)

Air units are visible during the battle and while performing an attack. If enemy anti-aircraft wapons are available, they must be countered

Units with low penetration levels cannot attach enemy units with higher armor level.

Special cards can give the player's units unique abilities during each battle.

First player who reach 20/40 points will be the winner of the battle & the game ends.
categories: Card Game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Simulation, Team-Based Game

name: Centershaft: Fallen Elements
description:
Four renowned opportunists are hired to obtain the world’s rarest gemstones that were once derived from all over the world and are kept in an exclusive place, protected for thousands of years by a native tribe.

It will be no easy task to retrieve the stones. The four opportunists must venture, not fully aware of the dangers, into a subterranean labyrinth. Seeking what they believe are rare gems, they soon discover the stones contain elemental powers. Threatened, they find themselves maneuvering quickly through warp portals, battling natives, and avoiding traps in an ever-changing maze. Escaping could prove problematic with a monstrous guardian willing to kill to protect its undisturbed dwelling. But returning to Centershaft and getting out alive is of most importance!

Centershaft Fallen Elements is a strategy tile-based thematic board game. In the game, players will explore the labyrinth to recover Element tokens. The goal of the game is to be the first to collect one of each Element token and then be the first to return to the Centershaft Hub tile.

On a player's turn they will draw from the event deck, resolve the card by following the instructions on the card (battling monsters, for example) or if it allows, they may keep to use at a later turn. They will also resolve any current cards they possess or abilities they have before they move their character miniature.
mechanics: Map Deformation, Modular Board, Movement Points, Race, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Admiral: Captain's Cards
description:
New playing element is introduced in the game. It will enrich naval battles and increase unexpectedness.

A Captain card is attached to the player's selected ship giving them special abilities pending on which captain card was played.

Contents: 4 Captain's Cards

Note: Originally created for Treasures of the Old Pirate (a lighter version of the game Admiral geared to ages 6+), the Captain's Cards can be used for Admiral, but an extra set would be needed beyond 3 players.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Pirates, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Council of Blackthorn: Casting Doubt
description:
As council members lose their heads, new members step up to take their place. Gain the trust of new allies and buildings of the realm of Blackthorn. Win the King's Favor to avoid a beheading, but beware... there are new ways of Casting Doubt on your fellow Council Members.

This expansion for Council of Blackthorn will add 4 new Council Members, new faction cards - some with lower trigger requirements, and new events.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Primar
description:
Primar is a set of three games inspired by the Bauhaus art school. Simple yet deep design is what all three games have in common. The artistic use of the three basic shapes and colors merges with the elegant design of each game.

The three micro games contained in the box are (text from the rulebook):

Primar Blue, by Martin Windischer
In this game you start with a victory card, which represents a state in the end of the game.
During the match you will build the board using shape cards and may change your victory card.
At the end, if you have the victory card representative of the board, you win the game.

Primar Red, by Odd Hackwelder
Players reveal and manipulate cards in order to form complete shapes. At the end of the game, the player with most complete shapes is the winner.

Primar Yellow, by Pablo Céspedes and Víctor Hugo Cisternas
The game plays in rounds, one player opens it revealing a card of their choice, and the opponent responding following some limitations. The objective of the game is to open a round in such a way that the opponent cannot respond. By doing so players are granted points, the first player to achieve 15 points wins the game.

All games have their origins in the annual 18 card microgame contest of the BGG site.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Deduction, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Pattern Building, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Tile Placement

name: Holistic: quint sequencing card game
description:
Holistic is an abstract sequencing game that combines set-collecting and trick-taking in a compact 81-card deck. Each card has a number from 1 to 9, and one of nine shapes. Win by taking the most quints, or placing the final matching card in a sequence.

The original name of this game is long lost and is mostly referred to as a holistic quint sequencing card game and is there for given the name Holistic for short. One text passage refers to the leviathan chain, but if this is the name of the game or some other principal is still unclear. A suggestion is that this game is better named Quint.

Holistic was according to Erik Magus Lång first played on scientific principles by a party of gentlemen who frequented the Holland House, Arkum Street, Hundon (Borough of St Edmundsbury) around 1728. but the game never became fashionable. To be a member of this group you had to write and published research, trivia games or myths of the souls journey, which is the cause records of it still exists today. The game was much later rediscovered and painstakingly recreated by a historian and game design researcher.

The game is party mention in the book “A Short Treatise on the Game of Yellow King” published in 1742, in “The Principles of holism and its Practice Illustrated on an Original System, by Means of Hands, Numbers and Symbols” published in 1862 and in the incomplete manuscripts and personal diary of the above mention Magus Lång. Holism is the belief that the parts of something are intimately interconnected and explicable only by reference to the whole, emphasizing the importance of the whole and the interdependence of its parts.

—description from the publisher

name: PORN: The Game! – The Extreme Drunkard Expansion
description:
Pulling inspiration from classic drinking games, and made for those who demanded “more drinking cards!”, this addition to PORN: THE GAME! is a must-have for spicing up your Parties and Gameplay.

With this add-on, Porn: The Game goes from Skinamax to Extreme Hardcore through 18 unique cards with mini-games and uproarious challenges.

You've got:
Scissoring ...(bumping tacos)
Cam-Girls ...(face to face)
VHS ...(Missionary Impossible)
and many more.

This Expansion tips the scale of the original game, taking it from casual fun to a twisted orgy of booze and gut-wrenching laughter, with unique, and original, digital art, humorous taglines, and new Gameplay.

If PORN: THE GAME is Foreplay,
this is the Orgasm.

ENLARGE YOUR DECK TODAY.

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Into the Echoside:  Oracle of the Three Rings
description:
As the epic battle continues, the demonic horde of the Nethervoid has begun to pour forth into the mortal realm, causing the divine light of Shangri-La to dim under the corrupting presence of this ancient evil unleashed upon our world. As all hope fades and life turns to dust, you embark on a final quest to the very underbelly of the Dark Carnival to seek out the one who’s forbidden power could be either the key to turning the tide…or your own utter demise!

Designed by Jumpsteady and Louis Simpson, with art created by the legendary Tom Wood, this highly anticipated expansion for Into the Echoside, the deckbuilding game, includes 120 devastating new cards! Along with new Dark Carnival, Psychopathic, Underground, Item, Fiend, Epic, and Flavor cards, there will also be the inclusion of the all-new Tarot and Gambit cards! As if that weren’t enough, this expansion will also come with a rule book, 2 custom 12-sided dice, and 4 numbered wheels to help you keep track of your Karma.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror

name: Restaurant Detective
description:
Restaurant Detectives is a party game that allows each player to act as the detective. During the game, each detective investigates in the restaurant and gathers evidence. Their goal is to find out who is the Food Thief, the one who sneaked our Guest's food, and meanwhile acts in the guise of a detective but actually protecting himself from being caught.

The game is divided into three phases: Investigation Phase, Hints Phase and Catch Phase. In Investigation Phase, players find useful information from the Food pool. After that, the Guest will try to give hints to all players in the Hints Phase. Finally, each player has one single chance to catch the Food Thief in the Catch Phase.

The Guest should help the Detectives by giving correct hints of the Target Food /Key Clue through Hints Cards. He is NOT allowed to give any tips with other ways such as speaking/gesture/facial expressions.

Detectives can discuss with each others and cooperate to win. However, not everyone is telling the truth with someone who is the Food Thief!
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Cocktails
description:
Cocktails is a fast-paced, push-your-lack, 2-player card game, taking place on a summer evening, having players sit comfortably by the pool, tasting delicious cocktails, as they take on a bizarre drinking challenge.

It's quite simple, just 54 cards with numbers between 1 and 12. Players draw cards from the pile and keep guessing if the next one will have a higher or lower number. Stopping just at the right time is crucial in order to get the right cocktails, thus get the most points. Each cocktail has its own value which combined with cards that act or score differently allows players to explore some interesting strategies.

—description from the designer

name: Fortune and Glory: Lair of the Spider Queen
description: Lair of the Spider Queen Expansion adds a new Villainous faction to the game - with Hong Kong Gangsters and supernatural mysticism - the 'Cult of the Spider Queen'! Along with all of the new cards, counters, and rules for battling this new Vile Organization, the set also includes plastic figures for the three new Villains, Spider Cult Minions, and 'The Black Widow' sailing ship to terrorize the high seas!
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: But Not In Vain: The Battle for Calais, May 1940
description:
