Contrary to the loggers, Borneo orangutans love durian fruit, but their access to the trees has now been cut off. Orangutans nearly solely travel through tree tops, swinging elegantly at impressive speeds. They hardly ever travel over the ground, so how do they now get to their favorite meal in the rainforest? You can help them, by growing back the rainforest.

Role the dice to determine your action for each turn. Actions include placing a new rainforest tile, introducing an orangutan chit, moving a rainforest tile, or moving an orangutan chit (1 or 2 moves).

Players aim to create a path for their orangutans to swing to the durian trees in the center of the board. They have to avoid blood pythons and can make use of other orangutan tiles or chits (including those of opponent players), which will help them move faster towards the durian trees. The first player to feed all of his/her orangutans, by occupying the durian trees, wins!

-description from designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Map Deformation, Pick-up and Deliver, Pieces as Map, Race, Tile Placement

name: Heroes Vs. Foes
description:
At the beginning of each level, players use hex tiles and a 6-sided die to randomly generate that levels dungeon map and starting boss position. On each turn, players will move (if they wish) and then choose an action: trade items, revive another hero, rest up, or search the area. When searching the area, the hero could find treasure, the level key, a foe to battle, or even a trap.

While battling foes and each level boss is encouraged in order to obtain higher levels through experience gains, once the key is located, the players can proceed through the door to the next level. A new board is generated, a new boss is drawn, and things get a little bit more difficult.

By the time players reach level five, the foes and level boss are extremely strong (this difficulty increase is directly related to the number of players in the game). The game ends when the boss on level 5 is defeated or when the boss on level 5 has knocked all heroes unconscious. Heroes Vs. Foes is a fully-cooperative game, so all players will win or lose together.

The standard edition offers 10 heroes to choose from (each with their own unique abilities, stats, and boons), 8 bosses, 27 foes, 57 items, 9 familiars, and 9 traps, making the possibilities of game play figuratively limitless. The game provides a mix of tabletop role-playing game and old-school dungeon crawler board game mechanics to generate a full campaign with long-term decisions while allowing all players to take part in the action. It has a moderate learning curve made easier with the more background in TTRPG and traditional dungeon-crawler stats and mechanics. Once moving, the game easily plays itself and provides difficulty and teamwork for even the most avid players.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Finale Ending, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Role Playing, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Apex: Escape from the Apes
description:
Apex: Escape from the Apes is a cooperative adventure game for the whole family. The players must work together to escape from a fierce band of angry apes to win the game.

The board depicts a bird's-eye view of the pyramid, rising out of a jungle. The adventurers' rescue helicopter will land on the top of the pyramid (center of the board). If everyone can reach the top of the jungle pyramid before the apes get there, they will be rescued.

Each player has three randomly-dealt cards which provide certain abilities or hindrances, and a little treasure as well. On each turn, a player rolls a die which moves all the apes. (There are simple rules guiding the Apes' movement, which increase the tension as the game goes on.) Then they roll a die for their own movement, with which they can move in any direction, around or up and down the pyramid levels. If a moving adventurer is in a space adjacent to another adventurer, they can help that companion to move up (or down) the levels. Also, leaving treasure on the path distracts the advancing Apes (but only temporarily).

Can your intrepid explorers get to the apex of the pyramid to be rescued? (Bonus points if they get rescued with some treasure left!)

-description from designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The First Battle Lost: 1809 in Germany –  The Bavarian Spring and Aspern-Essling Campaigns
description:
The First Battle Lost includes everything you need to begin recreating the first two phases of the War of the 5th Coalition: organization, maps, historical briefings, and uniforms.

Archduke Charles, cautioned his brother, Emperor Francis, that Austria was unprepared for the war it was about to begin: …the first battle lost is a death sentence for the monarchy…

With his army concentrated in the Iberian Peninsula, Napoleon redirected all available forces to counter the Austrian declaration of war and its invasion of Bavaria.

The First Battle Lost offers ten scenarios covering The Bavarian Spring and the Aspern-Essling Campaign.

Teugen-Hausen
Dünzling (Thann)
Abensberg
Laichling (Eggmühl Day 1)
Landshut
Eckmühl (Eggmühl Day 2)
Neumarkt-Sankt Veit
Ratisbon (Regensburg)
Ebelsberg
Linz-Urfahr
Aspern-Essling


In addition to hundreds of uniform images, covering every unit involved in the scenarios of the campaign!

The First Battle Lost, 1809 in Germany Campaign Guide is compatible with ESR Original Edition, ESR Second Edition, and nearly any other Napoleonic tabletop wargame.

Orders of battle provide detail down to the battalion level and maps are offered in scale miles.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Bait & Switch
description:
Bait & Switch is a two-part social deduction game for 3-9 players. Each round players will have to decide which crew to join to pull off a heist. After the heist, they’ll either keep their alliances and split the loot, or try to double cross the crew and keep it all for themselves. Played over 5 rounds, the winner is the player closest to 25 points without going over.

Collude, Collect & Double Cross?
You’ve got a heist to pull! You’ll need some extraordinary individuals with a very specific set of skills to join your crew. But once the crew has finished the job, who gets the loot? Figure out who your real friends are to score big. And watch out, if you don’t spot the foe you could be left with nothing!

This is the third game in the XYZ Game Labs "Quarks" series.

name: Lord of the Things
description:
Declare yourself the Lord of… basically whatever you want in this fast-paced party game – just make sure the Overlord approves! Whether you are the Lord of Hairstyles; Lord of Barnyard Animal Noises; Lord of Body Parts; or the Lord of Things that Come in Pairs, be prepared to intimidate, distract, and out-think your opponents to call out something in their category before they call out something in yours.

One player is randomly selected as the Overlord for the first round – this role then rotates each round. All players declare themselves the Lord of some category (such as Lord of Party Games; Internet Slang Acronyms; or Countries in South America; Currencies; etc.), and the Overlord can either approve or deny Lordships, ensuring a reasonable familiarity with the topic among all players.

Each player has a stack of wooden Thing Tokens and a dice in front of them. One person rolls their dice at a time, and when two dice match, those Lords are in a duel. To win a duel, you have to take something from the other Lord’s category before they take something from yours by being the first to say, “I shall have your ________________;” and naming something from your opponent’s category. The Overlord is responsible for settling any disputes and breaking ties. The winning Lord takes the Thing Token at the top of their opponent’s stack, adding it to their point line. The winning Lord then rolls their dice, and play continues.

The end-game battle for bonus points is triggered when any player reaches 15 points, and players grab for the bonus stars in the center of the table. Points are tallied and a new round begins. Play as many rounds as your elevated blood pressure can handle. The player with the most points at the end wins.

-description from designer
categories: Humor, Memory, Party Game, Real-time, Trivia
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Pattern Recognition, Speed Matching

name: Memory Kings
description:
Memory Kings is a mix of the games Chess and Pairs (a.k.a. Match Up or memory). It is a short abstract memory game with a tactical twist for 1 to 4 players. Players are kings commanding their pawns to explore and recruit forces to their side. They must find divided troops to recruit them by strategically moving the pawns across the field, and soliciting rooks, bishops, knights, or the Queen herself to escort them. The player that recruits the most pairs wins!

You can learn it in less than 5 minutes and the mechanics are light enough so kids and the most casual players will be hooked instantly. However, there's strategical depth that will satisfy the most competitive players. Even more exciting, as one of the main skills required to master Memory Kings is... well... Memory, don't be surprised if you find yourself in a balanced match against your younger children!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Grid Movement, Matching, Memory, Modular Board, Pattern Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Puck Bumpers
description:
A new, modular twist on a classic "take that" sliding mechanic! Players will work to score their pucks by manipulating meeples and blocks to form barriers blocking and stop their sliding pucks. Your pieces can move your opponents', making this an extremely competitive game for all ages.

With a dual-sided board, Puck Bumpers offers two ways to play. You can use a vintage style board and old school rules without bumping or flip it over to a hockey-inspired theme with moving board tiles, rule cards, and never-ending fun. Want something in between? Blend a mixture of rules and cards to make your own version using the pieces provided. The possibilities are endless!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Moving Multiple Units, Take That

name: Phoenix Command: Damage Tables – Small Arms
description:
While primarily thought of as a combat system for Leading Edge's Rhand Morningstar Missions RPG, the original Phoenix Command rules were also intended to be used for man-to-man skirmish wargaming, either on the tabletop or a hex map.


The Combat Damage Tables for Small arms has been designed for use with the Phoenix Command Combat System.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Five Column Yahtzee
description:
Five Column Yahtzee takes the idea of classic Yahtzee and Triple Yahtzee a step further. You have five columns. Columns 1-3 can be filled with throws of the matching number for example first throw pair of sixes could be marked in the first column as a pair, 12 points. Or for the second throw you could decide to keep the pair and throw the remaining three dice getting a pair of fives, now you could mark it as two pair, 22 to the second column. Or you could hold on to the two pairs and throw the last dice third time, getting another five that you could mark as a full house, 27 to third column.

4th column is forced column from top to bottom, where you need to start from triple ones followed by triple twos etc. 5th column works similarly, but from bottom to top, starting from the yahtzee followed by sum etc. You can't skip any, but you can mark a dash (0 points) if you so choose or are forced to. For the 4th and 5th columns you can use 3 throws.

—user summary

name: Street Art
description:
The four elements of hip hop are deejaying, rapping, break dancing, and graffiti painting, and these elements inspired Grafito, a rondel-based game about street art in the modern cities. Each player takes on a role of a graffiti artist, and you need to pick paints, and combine and use them to create great panels with your signature. Are you ready to control the walls of the street?

To set up, place eight paint cubes in each of the four rondels of the main game board; each rondel looks like an old-school LP record divided into eight colored sections. Use only primary paint cubes (blue, red, yellow and white) for now, then place the wall board next to the main board. Take an individual player board to organize your components, then shuffle the mural cards and reveal four face up.

On a turn, collect paint cubes or use a mural card to occupy a place on the wall board. By scratching the LPs — that is, turning the rondels — you can collect paint. You can rotate a rondel one space for free or spend workers to move more spaces or a second rondel; by matching colors across LPs, you can collect paint. By discarding a worker, you can use Basquiat's Lessons to duplicate paint cubes in your bag, change their colors, or obtain secondary colors.

Once you have the necessary components, you can complete a mural card by discarding the paint cubes required, possibly creating secondary colors along the way by discarding primary cubes. You receive points for these cards at the end of the game, and these cards depict different elements of hip hop, with you scoring bonuses from bonds of matching elements on the wall board.

When the wall board is finished, the game ends, and whoever has the most points becomes King of the Wall!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Pick-up and Deliver, Rondel, Worker Placement

name: Moonstone: The Cursed Troupe box
description: This troupe box allows you to add three new heroes from Leshavult faction to the game: the Beast, the Revenant and young noble lady Anya Bartol in two variants (with and without Stryga).
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Monopoly: Atletico Madrid
description:
A Monopoly about the Club Atlético de Madrid established in 1903.

Play classic Monopoly, but this time being a professional sports manager. Invest in stands and stadiums, rent and spend the money in the official store.

Roll the dice and move around the board thanks to the pawns and travel through the best of the history of Atletico Madrid - stadiums, best players, and the great victories in team history.


¡Conviértete en un exitoso manager de uno de los clubs de fútbol más importantes de Europa!
¡Con el divertido Monopoly del Atlético de Madrid! Prepárate para un emocionante viaje por los mejores lugares y momentos del club de la capital, invierte en gradas y estadios para derrotar a tus rivales y convertirte en el dueño de todo.
¡Negocia tu camino al éxito con el juego de las propiedades más famoso y genial!
¡En esta ocasión junto al club de tus amores, el Atletico de Madrid!

Descubre el resto de emocionantes versiones del clásico Monopoly, encuentra versiones clásicas, modernas, de tus series favoritas y mucho más.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Flame Westward: The Third World War in Europe 1980s
description:
The hypothetical WWIII game broke out in the 1980s, main scope is around the center of Europe. The rules are designed with Soviet military theory as the core. Designer has a wealth of research and insights into the Cold War.

Three scenarios:
1 Запад-81
2 Able Archer 83
3 Thermonuclear war

Simulation scale:
Unit:
WP: composed of group armies, few airborne divisions，and artillery divisions;
NATO: mostly divisions and brigades.
Time: 1Turn = 2days
Space: 1Hex=50km

name: Flames of War: British Starter Force – British Desert Rats Squadron
description:
The armoured squadron is the strike force of the British Army.
With their exceptionally fast Cromwell tanks, the Desert Rats have the ability to rapidly strike the enemy rear area and relentlessly pursue the slower enemy forces.
This speed allows the armoured squadron to continually work around to the weaker flanks of enemy formations, always striking from the side rather than slogging their way up the middle.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Hidden Society Of The Gnomes: Invasion Cards
description:
Gnome invasion has begun. The world is divided into two factions.

Will you help gnomes to restore their ancient glory and take over the world?
Will you help humans to dissipate such savagery, and repel this invasion?
Battle strategies need to be plotted as the future of the Earth is in your hands!

Hidden society of the gnomes: Invasion Cards, is an exhilarating semi-strategic card game for 2-4 players. (if 4 players, then 2 vs 2 teams)
Use your cleverness, traps and decoy maneuvers to overpower your opponent. Plot schemes, use some wit and count on some luck, cause only then you might come out as a winner!
This game is family friendly and suits all ages who can read!
Invasion Cards for collectors and competitive friends/family!

One game lasts 20-40 minutes!

All the cards are related to the book “Hidden society of the gnomes: Great Invasion”.
Some cards contain secret powers that can only be used when You have found the “effect” with the help of the book.
There are a few cards with hidden messages and secrets!
Two factions preforming actions:

Humans:

A mighty force to be reckoned with. Armed with an exceptional arsenal, they surely are a worthy enemy. This starter deck holds 60 cards of pure terror to stand against gnomes and their invasion. Use them wisely!

Gnomes:

The elite of the most elite. This fearsome army, with many futuristic superweapons, is ready. Gnome forces have prepared decades for this invasion. This starter deck holds 60 cards of regal power. Use them wisely!

Description:

Invasion Cards are here!
Take control and play as gnomes or humans. Defeat your opponent in a duel and get awarded with a privilege to live on this planet.
Two factions in a total of 120 cards will captivate players across the world. Be the one that prevails!

“Invasion has begun! Try your hand in fending off the invading forces or be the one who will destroy the humanity”
mechanics: Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Pulp Alley Fortune Card: Thanks!
description:
This is a single promotional Fortune Card for Pulp Alley intended to be used with the normal stack of Fortune Cards
Card Name: Thanks!
Card ID: PAX promo 2018

—user summary
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Soul Tokens
description:
We tried to make a combination of Cards Against Humanity and the game of Life, and what we came up with is something way better. Start Soul Tokens blind draw of Race, Gender, and 2 Wild cards. Move through 84 game tiles, each one represents 1 year of your life. Your story grows as life randomly inflicts itself on you. Trade, coerce. cooperate, and compete with other players. Whoever has the most SOUL TOKENS when you die wins.

Soul tokens the Ruthless game of real life combines side-splitting humor with dreamlike exploration of the human condition. Easy to play, rich in content, extraordinary in style: Soul Tokens gives players an opportunity to come together and laugh with subjects like race, gender, sex, aging, inequality, mental illnesses, and death.

In Soul Tokens you and your friends begin at birth with a set of random but defining characteristics and go through hilarious life scenarios in an attempt to keep your soul. It's a game of real life where you're striving to get soul tokens in a world of harsh but funny truths. Soul Tokens is a simple roll and move game, where each roll of the dice moves you forward in life birth to death. 84 spaces represent the average life expectancy, moving players through 4 stages of life: child, young adult, adult, and old.

Start the game with a Race, Gender, and 2 Wild cards. Trade, coerce, connect with other players as new cards enrich your stories all the while competing for soul tokens. At this level, Soul Tokens plays like a fast and funny party game, but at some point, it crosses over into the surreal.

A lighthearted and profound departure from the tabletop board games lets you make fun of all that sh*t in your life that’s been bumming you out. It puts you in the shoes of another person. This is a game that doesn’t even have a genre.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling, Trading

name: Labyrint
description:
This game is played on a board depicting a maze through which a single pawn is moved. Each player in turn rolls the die and moves the pawn accordingly.

The other component in the game is a diamond. When a player causes the pawn to land on a green space they take the diamond. When a player causes the pawn to land on a red space the diamond is placed back on the board.

The player possessing the diamond at the moment when the die roll would enable the pawn to escape the maze wins.

name: Shibumi: Further Games
description:
This is a suite of ten games to be played with the Shibumi system. The collection is not made by the original creator, Cameron Browne, or the publisher nestorgames.

Within can be found variants of many classical abstracts like Halma (Monky), shogi (Dual Duel), or Mancala (Sow Seed), but there are also wholly oringinal games like Frenemies, Kapow and Fireball.

Most games are for two players, but some lighter games, like a stacking game and a version of Liar's dice, can be played with more players.

name: Tip-Toe Volcano
description:
Tip Toe Volcano is a game about betting, bluffing...and not stepping in any lava. Each round, you’ll secretly hide your traps before putting the map together. After that, it’s an all-out bidding war to see who can tip-toe the furthest around the volcano — without getting burned.

Instructions.

Gameplay takes place over a series of rounds. At the start of each round, players must set their lava traps.


Out of sight of the other players, take your cluster of Blinks in setup mode and single click any number of them to activate (or de-activate) a lava trap. Lava traps look like 2 red faces rotating around the Blink, while non-trap pieces are 2 green faces rotating. Make sure to remember where you place your traps!

Once satisfied with your trap placement, double click any Blink in your cluster to hide your lava traps under a beautiful green grassy hill.

With the traps hidden, all the players connect their Blinks back together into one mega cluster. The oldest player starts by betting how many Blinks they can click without hitting any Lava Traps (e.g. “I think I can click two Blinks without hitting any lava”).

The player on their left must now either raise or challenge. If they raise, they must bet a higher number (e.g. 3 Blinks or more). But if they challenge, the previous player must carry out their bet to see if they can do it. They must start by single clicking one of their own Blinks. After that, they can click any Blinks they like.

If the player that has been challenged fails to click all the Blinks wagered without touching lava, the Volcano will erupt, spraying ash everywhere and covering the hill with lava. A new round now begins, but the player who lost the challenge will have one Blink removed from their cluster (e.g. if last round they had 4 Blinks, this round they will have 3). However, if the player successfully completed the challenge and didn’t set off the Volcano, in the next round the player that challenged them will lose a Blink.

name: Ghost Hunters
description:
You and your friends have decided to go explore the haunted house at the end of the street. Armed with nothing but some modified flashlights, can you keep the ghosts at bay?

SETUP:
Blinks will begin in the level select phase, where each Blink will show the level currently selected by the number of faces illuminated (level 1-6).
Arrange your blinks in any configuration to be the mansion floor and single click any Blink to toggle through the level options.
Once you’ve selected a level, each player should remove a Blink from the mansion floor and double click it to turn it into a gadget. Then to begin play, double click any Blink connected to the mansion floor.
At any point you may triple click a mansion blink to return to the level selection. Make sure to always have your gadget pieces attached to the rest of the board when switching between the play phase and the level selection phase as gadgets will have different weapons assigned depending on the level you are currently playing.

GAMEPLAY:
During gameplay, you must blast ghostly apparitions with your flashlight gadget and stop them from overtaking the mansion.
To zap an apparition, touch your gadget to any exposed side of the mansion. A beam of energy will automatically shoot out of your gadget in a straight line into the mansion, destroying any spirits in its path.
Your gadget has 3 different weapon functions. To switch between weapons, single click your weapon Blink.
There are four types of apparitions that may appear depending on the level you selected, and each one can only be killed by a specific weapon on your gadget. The apparations and their weaknesses are:

GHOSTS
Ghosts appear WHITE and are killed by the Flashlight (WHITE)

GHOULS
Ghouls; appear RED and are killed by the Laser (RED)

POLTERGEISTS
Poltergeists; appear BLUE and are killed by the GeistLight (BLUE)

GOBLINS
Goblins; appear GREEN and are killed by being hit with the Flashlight and the Laser at the same time (WHITE and RED)
Each apparition takes a small amount of time to materialize into the mortal plane. Make sure to zap the ghosts before they fully materialize, or the mansion will be lost.
WIN CONDITION
If an apparition fully materializes in this plane before you zap it, the mansion will become irreparably infested with demons and you will have lost. However, if you are able to ward off spirits for a whole minute then the house will be cleansed and glow with a holy yellow light.
You may then double-click any Blink to return to level select, and pick a new level to battle the ghosts again.

name: Arcmage: Enchanted Realm
description:
The second core set of our libre fantasy style strategic card game Arcmage.

As you battle your opponents summoning creatures and casting spells, you’ll have to defend your cities, manage your resources and power supply and conjure up a strategical plan to beat your opponents. Will you be the one that brings order to the warring factions in Irdiya? Will you challenge all and utter the words ‘Amin duna, ilya lanta’?

This turn based game allows a player to gather resources, build cities, cast and move creatures, recruit an army, play magic spells or interrupt an opponents' play. Each turn the player may launch an attack on an a target city. On opponents' turns players may have to bravely defend their cities against the marauding enemy's army. Lose all of your cities and you're out of the game.

Following the tradition of many great CCG's, the game supports both casual as in depth strategic game play. Furthermore it offers an unique resource system and adds a spacial dimension that lets the player decide how and where to deploy their creatures.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Arcmage: New Horizons
description:
The thrid core set of our libre fantasy style strategic card game Arcmage.

As you battle your opponents summoning creatures and casting spells, you’ll have to defend your cities, manage your resources and power supply and conjure up a strategical plan to beat your opponents. Will you be the one that brings order to the warring factions in Irdiya? Will you challenge all and utter the words ‘Amin duna, ilya lanta’?

This turn based game allows a player to gather resources, build cities, cast and move creatures, recruit an army, play magic spells or interrupt an opponents' play. Each turn the player may launch an attack on an a target city. On opponents' turns players may have to bravely defend their cities against the marauding enemy's army. Lose all of your cities and you're out of the game.

Following the tradition of many great CCG's, the game supports both casual as in depth strategic game play. Furthermore it offers an unique resource system and adds a spacial dimension that lets the player decide how and where to deploy their creatures.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Legions of Steel: Operation Anvil
description:
A fast paced, squad level miniatures wargame rich in tactical decision making. Take control of either the highly trained human forces, United Nations of Earth Commandos or the fearless machine forces comprised of G12 Nightmare robots and the dreaded Mark VII Assault Fiend. Various scenarios are included in the boxed set which you win by completing the mission objectives.

Legions of Steel is played over a series of rounds each comprised of an Initiative Segment, 2 player turns and an end segment. At the beginning of each Round the players roll a d6, higher roller winning initiative. The player with the initiative decides who will have the first turn this round, themselves or their opponent. The person whose turn it is, is considered the active player.

The active player activates each of their figures moving and attacking. Once a figure has been activated and its actions are finished, a marker is place next to that figure to indicate its state. If the figure attacked, a fired counter is placed next to it. If it did not fire, it is considered Covering which means that it is holding its attack for future use, including during the opponent's turn. Attacking at an opponent is accomplished through rolling a 6 sided die (sometimes more depending on the weapon and your tactical decision). There are various options for attacks including auto-firing, spreading your attack to multiple targets, hand to hand engagement and more that add to the tactical decision process. In addition, some figures have special abilities like Leadership or Extra Lives. With leadership a Sergeant figure can influence die results, allow troopers to move farther or command them to attack out of turn. The Mark VII Assault fiend has an extra life as it takes 2 hits to eliminate it from the game.

The tactical decisions in this game are many with plenty of player interaction. You will be jockeying your forces for tactical advantage, trying to get the upper hand from round to round.

—description from the publisher

name: DSbuilders
description:
Our Emperor asked for new ways to spread terror through the sectors. He engaged the best scientists in the galaxy to design the definitive weapon to defeat the Rebellion: a massive Orbital Station...the Dark Star.

In DSbuilders, six Koenigs have six cycles to build the station while the galaxy is on fire and a riddle of unpredictable events influences the strategy to follow. If this scenario sounds familiar and you are an agilist, this is your game. The game is based on the assumption that all players have basic knowledge of Agile and Scrum, and a facilitator, like an experienced Agile Coach (or similar), is available.

In fact, DSbuilders is a team-based, co-operative, serious game on scaling agile teams across organization. The game is played by six teams, each of them with 1 to 8 players, and they have to build all systems of the Dark Star, the new weapon designed to conquer the galaxy.

The game takes place over six turns, and each turn the teams have to define their work (components to build) considering all constraints (capacity, integrations and dependencies). At the end of each turn, the Emperor (facilitator) defines the short term goal on the basis of the events happening in the galaxy.

If you fail to achieve any intermediate goal, game over!
If you fail to achieve the final goal, game over!
If you achieve the final goal, you conquer the galaxy!
categories: Card Game, City Building, Industry / Manufacturing, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Alliances, Cooperative Game, Events, Negotiation, Open Drafting, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Team-Based Game, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Spiria Material Card Game StA
description:
Spiria Material Card Game StA is a 2 player card game from Japan, based off a previous trading card game called Spiria Material. This game allows players to begin playing in the Spiria Material world with only 5 hand cards each. The game includes just 18 cards for each player, so players can experience playing with a variety of combinations, without having to buy a whole deck of cards.
user summary
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management
publishers: Spimate Production Committee (スピマテ制作委員会 )

name: Scourge of the High Seas
description:
Take to the seas Pirate Captains! The merchants are over burdened with goods and money and need your assistance to relieve them of their troubles. But be leery! The King's navy is on the lookout for the Jolly Roger. Get your loot, sell it, and be the one with the most wealth at the end of the season by any means necessary!

Scourge of the High Seas is played over 5 rounds where players will move their ship to attack merchants, islands and the navy in order to gain supplies to sell at market in trade for money. Once sold, bury the money and treasure to keep it safe for the end of the game. Whoever has the most points at the end of the game wins.

FEATURES

3-6 players
90-120 Minute Playtime
200+ Pieces and Tokens
Deck of treasure cards


GAMEPLAY
Three to six players can set sail on the ocean to try and gain the most money. Players will search out merchant ships or royal held islands and plunder them for supplies, treasure and money. With the supplies, the players can deliver them to nearby markets for selling to further increase their money. However, a captain's fortune is not safe until they can successfully bury it on the hidden island. Do not hold onto too much loot or another player may decide you are an easier way to grow their fortune.

Each player will have crew tokens to assign positions on their ship board in secret. When all players have made their assignments, everyone reveals their choices and whoever has the most speed will move first. Crew assignments may depend on many factors including wind direction, nearby targets to attack, other players and the navy ships out on patrol.

Each round the merchants and navy move around on trade routes, while the King's islands produce more supplies to be sold at market. Each market has its own demands for the four different types of supplies and it changes as player's sell their ill-gotten goods. In addition, every round has shifting winds making every decision in every round impactful.

Will you go for the island that has a bunch of one resource in hopes the market demand is high? Or will you risk confrontation with the navy to steal from the merchant ships? Perhaps that other pirate ship is too encumbered by its own fortunes and is ripe for the taking. The choice is yours and each game has a different starting layout giving unending variety.

-description from designer
mechanics: Hidden Victory Points, Market, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Mission Emission
description:
Mission Emission is a fun and fast, competitive, trick-taking and hand management card game for kids and adults, produced by Nightingame. This game challenges you on a mission to save India's states from global warming!

Each card of Mission Emission represents a state or union territory of India. These cards have 6 environment related stats (called Missions) like Forest cover, Air Quality, Population Density, etc.


The active player chooses a Mission/category and plays a card.
After each player has played a card from their hand in turn order, the player whose card has the highest stat of the chosen Mission wins a Point Card of that Mission.
Point Cards have victory points mentioned on them, and the player with the most points wins at the end of the game.


The fun lies in the Point Cards—the Point Cards opened later in the game are worth more points, so you may choose to save your best cards for later rounds. But be careful, the Point Cards may run out faster than you think! To add to the fun, some Point Cards are worth negative points, making this a competitive game which will leave you planning, plotting, sacrificing cards, and biting your nails right till the end!

The game rulebook also comes with 2 more alternative sets of rules, and many more on the official website www.nightingame.com, so you can play a new variation every time!

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Educational, Environmental, Number
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That, Trick-taking

name: Wild Tile Variant Kit for the Game of ACQUIRE
description:
The ACQUIRE Wild Tile Variant Kit is made to fit most editions of ACQUIRE games. This kit allows each player to start with a blank tile that can be played on any open square during their turn at any time during the game.

The ACQUIRE Wild Tile Kit includes six (6) blank tiles and an instruction booklet. Tiles are from actual ACQUIRE games that have been painted to hide the designations. The instruction booklet is printed on yellow card stock for maximum durability and readability.

The Wild Tile Variant allows each player to start the game with that one "key" tile that they may need at one point in the game. It increases the ability to create mergers and helps to alleviate frustration when a player has nothing but "bad" tiles and is unable to maintain a foothold in the game. Some games, with the luck of the draw, a player may never need their Wild Tile.

Included with this Wild Tile Kit are Lloyd's Rules of ACQUIRE, which were designed to help eliminate the one-sided games that can occur during the regular game play in ACQUIRE.

(The Wild Tile Variant is an idea conceived by Allan Wright)

—description from the designer
categories: Economic, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Investment, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Filogenia!
description:
This game consists of collecting animals that belong to the same family and accumulate the most points according to the way they are played.

The deck consists in 38 cards (36 native animals and 2 rules cards).

Each card includes the name of the species, the family it belongs, the number of members of that family and the points it's worth.

How to collect points? There are 3 ways:
1. Reuniting an incomplete family, you obtain the sum of the points of the cards played.
2. Reuniting a complete family on the board, on different turns, you obtain the sum of the points of the cards + points indicated on the bonus card.
3. Reuniting a complete family in one turn, you obtain double points (from played cards + bonus)

At the start of the game each player has 5 cards, on each turn there are two phases:
1. Draw a card from the deck or discard pile and play a family (complete or incomplete).
2a. Say it's the end of the turn turn.
2b. Or the player can discard a card from the hand, then asking to opponent if he has a card that can be used to complete a family: if he does, he must give it to the player; if he doesn't, the player loses the discarded card.

At the start of the next turn, each player starts draw to complete a hand of 5 cards and start again until the deck is depleted.

name: Kings of War: Halpi's Rift / Clash of Kings 2021 Updates
description:
Kings of War: Halpi's Rift is a supplement that provides a new range of heroes, magic and battlefield conditions for your games of Kings of War. The rules can be used as one-off games or campaign play.

The supplement also includes the 2021 Clash of Kings balance updates and unit amendments for both pick up games, club nights and tournament play.

Finally there is a battle report included called "The Battle of Ravenswood."

name: 18OL
description:
18OL is an 18xx game about trains, tracks and finances in the former Grand Duchy of Oldenburg, a German country in the 19th century. The main game play is done through the corporations and companies which are creating and operating the railroad network. Players buy and sell shares, act as CEO of these entities and do everything to enrich themselves and make other players' life miserable.

18OL is designed to be a short game (even for newbies not more than four hours). It can be played with 2 to 5 players and plays best with 3 or 4.

No privates, eight corporations ("majors"), up to five local companies ("minors"), no separate stock rounds or operation rounds. 18OL is a game with full capitalization.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Versunkene Schätze
description: A funny magnetic game for up to 4 children. Every child has a magnetic ship which can retrieve treasures from the bootom of the sea. But only when returning to the harbour, they know what they found.

name: Bill & Ted's Excellent Historical Trivia Travel Game
description: To get historical figures into your phone booth, players must answer trivia questions in six topics: Geography, US History, World History, Women in History, Music History, and Heinous History. The board folds out from the box and features magnetic playing pieces. The first player to collect all six historical characters and return to San Dimas High School for your oral report wins.

name: Vauban's Wars: Wargame Rules for Siege Warfare
description:
Vauban's Wars allows you to become one of the great captains of siege warfare: Vauban, Coehorn, Marlborough, or Prince Eugene of Savoy to name a few. The rules are designed to produce a fun and playable siege in an evening of gaming. The rules cover from 1672 to 1815 with these specific wars in mind:

Wars of the Louis XIV (1688-1697)

War of the Austrian Succession (1740-1748)

Seven Years War (1756-1763)

Turkish Wars vs Russians and Austrians (1710-1812)

Wars of the French Revolution (1792-1802)

Napoleonic Wars (1803-1815)

Vauban's Wars allows the flexibility of using the player's favorite tactical rules for large sorties and assaults.

A turn is roughly 3-4 days, and the rules cover powder supply, critical damage, unique events, disease, weather, food supply, security, trench raids (minor sorties), coups de main, popular support, sapping, mining, countermining, espionage, etc.

1 x Spiral bound rule book – 97 pages (full color)

1 x Turn & Weather Sheet (hard card stock and full color)

2 x Quick Reference Sheets (hard card stock and Black and White)

1 x Powder Expenditure Sheet (hard card stock and full color)

6 x Sequence Deck Card Sheets that you can cut out and sleeve. (hard card stock and full color)
categories: Age of Reason, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Demockrasy
description:
Demockrasy is a two to eight player game in which you play the role of a powerbroker behind the scenes of American politics, putting together Politicians with Supporters whose votes they wield. Players compete to gain Power over the course of the game by voting on legislation their supporters approve or oppose; at the end of the game, the player with the most Power is the winner.

Demockrasy is played over four rounds. Each round has a Drafting phase, when you choose Politicians and Supporters, and a Legislation phase, when you sponsor and vote on Legislation.

During the Drafting phase, players pass several hands of cards around the table, each hand containing Politicians and Supporters. Players pick one of the cards from their hand, play it face-up in front of them, and pass the hand to the next player (passing left or right, depending on which round it is). There are three types of cards: Politicians, which may carry one to five supporters; Supporters, which give their associated politician one, two, or three votes; and Wild cards, which give the player a one-time opportunity to affect a legislative outcome or attack an opposing politician. Once all players have played five cards, the Legislation phase begins.

During the Legislation phase, each player must sponsor one Bill from their hand of Legislation cards (each player receives four Legislation cards at the beginning of the game). The player with the top-ranked politician sponsors the first Bill. Once the Bill has been revealed, all players must cast a vote to OPPOSE or APPROVE the bill on behalf of all of their supporters and politicians. Each player votes the total number of votes provided by their supporters. A simple majority wins; in a tie, the Bill fails.

Supporters may (a) APPROVE a Bill, (b) OPPOSE a Bill, or (c) neither. If a Politician betrays a Supporter--for example, by voting to APPROVE a Bill that's opposed by his or her supporters--then that Supporter will abandon its Politician and break one of that Politician's hearts. Each politician has 1 to 5 hearts; when the last heart breaks, the Politician retires and the associated supporters are discarded. Players also receive a broken heart--which they can assign to a politician of their choice--when they are on the losing side of a vote.

There are three ways to gain power: (1) if you sponsor a bill that passes, you get 1 Power; (2) if you APPROVE a bill that passes, you get 1 Power; (3) you get 1 Power for each Legislation result that aligns to your Supporters' interests.

After each round, clean up the spent Legislation cards and deal new Demockrasy cards (Politicians, Supporters, and Wild cards) to build up your political staff again! After four rounds, count up the power gained by each player; the most powerful player is the winner!

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Humor, Negotiation, Party Game, Political
mechanics: Alliances, Betting and Bluffing, Closed Drafting, Voting

name: ROBOTECH: Crisis Point Game – Danger Zone Promo Expansion
description:
A booster pack that adds 6 new expansion cards to the Robotech: Crisis Point game. The cards included are:

Army of the Southern Cross
-new Unit card: VHT-2 Myrmidon
-new Hero card: Bowie Grant
- new Command card: Supporting Fire

The Masters
-new Unit card: Imperial Bioroid
-new Hero card: Clone Masters
-new Command card: Spring the Trap
categories: Bluffing, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Words From Beyond The Grave
description:
Get the dirt out of your ears and listen up!
Afterlife got you down? Feeling hungry? Tired of worms? Want to make the pain go away? Then you could really use some brain food! Utilize your letter cards against your friends in this spine-chilling word game where formulating words will net you some nice, juicy brains to stave off that ravenous hunger. But what's that I hear you say? You're hungry for more? Then why not sideswipe the competition with up to four ability cards to turn the tide in your favor. After all, this graveyard's only big enough for one!

—description from the designer
categories: Educational, Horror, Humor, Party Game, Word Game, Zombies
mechanics: Action/Event, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Open Drafting, Take That, Variable Player Powers, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Touhou Bomb Letter: Todoke Danmaku!
description:
Day after day, Gensokyo has been hit by mysterious incidents. What's more, these incidents seem to be composited from those that had occurred before.

The shrine maiden of Hakurei Shrine, Hakurei Reimu, and her friend, the magician Kirisame Marisa, began to investigate the cause of the incident as usual.

Apparently, there are other residents who have begun their investigations, and they would like to be able to boast about having solved it before them. But who will have the most success in solving this incident?

Touhou Bomb Letter - Todoke Danmaku! contains the base Love Letter, but also adds some new twists through the introduction of 3 new types of cards.

Firstly, the Princess card can be replaced by the instigator of the incident, aka the Boss cards, each with their unique conditions. There are also cards you can use to replace or add to the typical card set with their own effects.

Next, there are Player cards featuring the protagonists of the Touhou Project games. They each have different abilities which they must spend bomb tokens to use, and earn them by fulfilling different conditions in each round.

Finally, rather than scoring basic points, players can instead draw from the Score card deck, and count up their secret totals across all 6 stages that will be counted at the end of the game.

name: Gaming Spice
description:
Gaming Spice includes 8 different spices with which the players can play two different games. The game also includes a number of "taste" cards which include a spectrum, such as Unknown/Familiar. In the game's two modes, these cards will be used to describe flavors.

Notably, the game suggests that the players' provide prosciutto (recommended), otherwise sliced cheese, in order to contain the spices.

In one game, a government spy has snuck into the Cyber Gastronomy Club. The non-spy players will taste a certain combination of spices, and all of the players will describe what they are tasting, including the spy, by drafting taste cards from a face up pool and creating a menu name for the prosciutto/cheese they tasted. The players then discuss who the spy is, and an accusation process follows.

In the other game, the Cyber Gastronomy Club has developed a new way to communicate through spices. One player creates a spice mix and the players attempt, through taste, to determine the spices. The player creating the mix reveals three sets of 2 taste cards, with the top card of each pair obscuring the second card. The second card includes an arrow which points to one side of the top card. The player creates a mix of spices such that the other player(s) will be able to deduce the menu name of the prosciutto/cheese flavor (where the arrows are pointing.)
publishers: Hanshakaijin Circle (反社会人サークル)

name: Kings of War: Vanguard – Ice and Iron
description:
This is a campaign and warband supplement for Kings of War.

It includes a campaign for 2 to 4 players set in the frozen north. It has new rules for severe weather, rationing supplies, and exploration.

It also has seven new scenarios for your Vanguard games.

It has updated warband lists with errata and eight new factions.

Finally it has rules for multiplayer games.
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: uZito
description:
uZito is a balancing game, using pieces of different weights. The game advertises that it only has one basic rule: take a piece and put it on the top. Additionally, the publisher notes that the rulebook has almost no language in it, and the game can be easily understood through visuals alone.

The games' pieces appear to be floors, metal pillars, abstract muscular humans, large stones, and stacks of medium stones.

name: Nautches
description:
Nautches is a deck of 120 hexagonal cards, used to play a number of abstract games ranging from two-player territory-building games, to multiplayer trick-based games, to meditative solitaire games. Each side of a Nautches card is marked with notches indicating a value between 0 and 5. Each of the 120 cards has a unique sequence of notches. Each card also has one of six suits and one of two colors. Most games are based on placing such that the notches on any touching sides of cards have matching values.

—description from the designer

name: Druidas
description:
A long time ago, two half-serving wizards lived in the depths of an old forest. The two were in training, but one day they were called by their master.

"I will test you from now on. Let's recognize the person who completed" Magical Remedy "first as a full-fledged wizard."

In order to make "magical remedies", plants and minerals, parts of the body of animals and phantom beasts, and "fire (red)" "water (blue)" "earth (yellow)" "trees (green)" You must synthesize "rune stone" that has the magical power of "mineral (white)". You will be one of the wizards and collect medicine materials in the fantasy forest. Then extract the magical power from the "rune stone" and complete the medicine faster than your rivals.

In this game, players take all stones of the same color on either the magic circle card or the center of the table and place them on the icon in their hand. Points will be deducted for stones that cannot be placed or surplus stones. When the stones are buried on the 5 icons in your hand, the card is complete. Get the score written on the card.

If you do not meet the end-of-game conditions, replenish the magic circle card with rune stones and perform the next round. In this way, the player who gets 30 points first is recognized as a full-fledged wizard by the master.

—description from the designer

name: Legends Untold: Illumination of Deepsorrow Novice Set
description:
The Illumination of Deepsorrow is a standalone expansion for the Legends Untold system which can be enhanced with the addition of the Weeping Caves and Great Sewers Novice Sets. It can also be combined with these products to create a massive catalogue of cards for self-build adventures.
Deepsorrow introduces:
Four new playable Occupations and Cultures, along with a host of new Weapons, Kits, Outfits and Talents to let you build the character you want.

A new Focus system that allows you to use the mystic teachings of the Nabti Walkers to push your body and mind to the limits of endurance.

New Physiological Talents for the Wrathlander - use natural gifts to survive poison and even channel lightning!

A new Shock Condition that impacts both Heroes and Foes, beware that sparking floor tile!

A new Clues and Epilogues system that rewards exploration – will you brave that Vine Swing Barrier to reveal more about the multiple factions that have an interest in the ancient site?

New Boons and Backpack cards that let you expand your party’s arsenal of options, you must use them wisely to ensure your survival.

New Loot categories including Locked, Sealed, and Heavy, that require you to use all your wits to benefit from them.

A new Treasure deck system for those that always have to find every piece of loot.

A Cinematic Campaign of multiple Plot Arcs, that you must discover and interact as you explore Deepsorrow.

Exhausted, a messenger collapses on the steps of the temple. From his hand a single leaf drops to the floor and a shockwave echoes across the sanctuary. The Monks at Firesorrow have waited millennia for the sign - the Lost Forest has come to life - A Step into Darkness has begun.

Where the sky screams and black clouds roar
Where the sand climbs high and eagles soar
Secrets will travel by sail and oar
To Dip’Sa’Ra on distant shore

The violent wind whips sand across your face; overhead the constant lightning of the Wrathstorm earths into the enormous coral-like spires that tower above you. You are sworn to your quest: you must investigate the mysteries of Deepsorrow and find the ancient Illumolith so that you may shine a beacon of light and illuminate the approaching darkness.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Salvage Hidden Treasures: Bounties of the Abyss
description:
Continue in your pursuit to collect the world’s most elusive treasure - this time diving into the eerie depths with the Bounties of the Abyss expansion set.

Bounties of the Abyss Expansion set includes three additional boats plus sixteen additional tiles featuring new artwork, cruel twists of fate and treasures long forgotten to the depths of the ocean will merge seamlessly into your core game of Salvage Hidden Treasures!

—description from the designer

name: Borel Dice Edition
description:
Follow-up game to Borel. This game only contains cards with experiments with dice. The rules are different, and there is more emphasis on speed.

The general framework is like in Borel. The cards describe probability experiments with yes/no answers, for example: "You roll the d10 four times. Will the maximum roll exceed 8?"

You draw a card, and read aloud the question, the players vote yes or no, and you then conduct the experiment. Being good at probability will give you an advantage, but you can also win if the dice roll your way.

In the original game, you bet various amounts of money using chips, and you reveal your bets simultaneously. In this game, the first person to put forward their yes/no card, becomes the "Leader" and gets their preferred outcome, while all the others must bet on the opposite outcome. You get 3 points if you bet correctly. The experiment is then performed a second time, where the players are allowed to bet freely, except for the Leader, and you score 2 points if you bet correctly. First player to 25 points win.

By being the first to commit to a bet and becoming the Leader, you can force all the others to bet the opposite. However, the Leader is not allowed to change their bet in the second round, so betting too quickly can be dangerous, too.

name: Hibi Hibi Rescue
description:
As a Cadet of the Galactic Rescue Patrol you must bring back home, safe and healthy, this pile of Hibis that we have rescued from the claws of Zeta and his dangerous Alphabots.

Hibis are endearing creatures that like to play and organize themselves in mathematical herds of colors. Their planet, Trezion, is far away, just far enough to have time to organize them well for a safe landing.

Look out for those rare Hibis that we have not managed to identify! Be careful with their mood! Order them wisely with the help of your Technoglove and become their adventure friend. Show what you are capable of!

Players will use cards from their hand to place the Hibis and make addition and subtraction with them.

—description from the designer

name: Beets Bombs and the Blüffs: The Super Action Packed Expansion Pack
description:
Combine this expansion pack with the Beets Bombs and the Blüffs base game to play with up to 8 players! Adds an additional 42 card deck to the existing game! Including 13 new unique and exciting action cards!

—description from the publisher

name: Die Schatzinsel der Piratenopas
description:
Die Schatzinsel der Piratenopas (The Treasure Island of Pirate Grandpas) is a handmade wooden children's game from 5 years up. It is made in the “Urdonautal” in the heart of Bavaria.
It is also ideally suited as a family game, because it is just as fun for adults and offers new challenges for experienced players because there are rule extensions that can optionally be included in the game. In addition to a little luck, a good memory is required, because if you can remember which types of treasure are hidden in which place, you have a good chance of winning the game.

—description from the designer

name: Sick Minds
description:
A game of folds with a strong thematic: criminology.

The game is a highly strategic game which add new features to the game of folds:

powers that you can buy to change the game rules.
a kind of rock/paper/scissor mechanics to add fun to the game.
an original scoring mode counting the number of cards at the end of the turn.
you play two cards once at a time during your turn, adding more strategy and depth to the game

name: Prehistories: Shield
description:
Prehistories: Shield is a set of five hunter cards — one for each player — with a shield symbol on the card. Shuffle this card into your deck at the start of the game, and play it with other cards when placing a bid during a round. When you play it, this card ensures that you will not be injured during the hunt phase.

This mini-expansion, which will be distributed in board game stores, is a tribute to Benoit Turpin's uncle Jo, who passed away during the graphic development of the game.

The English version was available via Tantrum House Season 8 Kickstarter.
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Hand Management, Pattern Building, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Auction
publishers: 25th Century Games, Playagame Edizioni, The Flying Games

name: Triumphus
description:
The Emperor is holding trials for the new party planner needed for our nation's greatest celebration - The Triumphus! Dress to impress, or end up like the last poor soul. This is the most important party of your life!

In Triumphus, you will need to use your best supplies, including wine, decorations, food, entertainment, and offerings, to gain The Emperor's rewards, which you can sell to obtain even more supplies, or hoard to gain his respect.

On your turn, you will attempt to match the supplies from the cards in your hand with the requirements on a single reward card in the community market of five cards. If you can match all of the icons on a reward, discard the supplies and take the reward, which will be valued between 4-7 points; however, the only way to get more of the necessary supplies is to sell a reward by flipping it face down and drawing as many supply cards as the card's point value. This will reduce the points for the card from face-value to only 1, so make sure you only sell rewards when you need to. And make sure you don't have more than 10 supplies at the end of your turn or you'll need to discard!

Keep up this simple loop, deciding at every turn whether you'll need an extra supply or an extra point to win. The game continues until the last reward has been collected. Count your points to see who gets the job and the favor of the high court! Every reward card you haven't sold is face-value, plus 1 additional point for each one you have sold.

—description from the designer

name: Commands & Colors: Medieval – Expansion #1 Crusades Mid-Eastern Battles I
description:
The first expansion for Commands & Colors: Medieval.

The original plan was to have the Medieval expansions follow a somewhat historical timeline, but to keep in tune with player requests and feedback, GMT chose to jump ahead in time some 500 plus years to the Crusades. Actually reflecting on the decision, this jump makes a lot of sense, since there are marked similarities with many Byzantine battles as featured in the Medieval game and the battles fought during the Crusades gameplay wise, rule wise and transitional-thinking wise.

Yes, there are plenty of knights in shining armor in this expansion, but there are no damsels in distress or dragons to be slain. The Crusade Mid-Eastern Battles I expansion will instead focus on some of the major engagements of earlier Crusader history. In this first Crusade expansion, we showcase at least 16 Crusader scenarios and all the additional unit blocks you need to fight out these battles. New units include: Crossbow Infantry, Foot Knight Infantry, Turcopole Light Bow Cavalry, Heavy Knight Cavalry, and Heavy Military Order Knight Cavalry.

The Crusade expansion introduces many new game concepts as well: Impetuous Pursuit, Feigned Flight, Shower Shooting, and Charging Cavalry ability to pass through friendly stationary infantry units, all of which add historical depth and flavor. Still many game mechanics remain constant, like the deck of Medieval Command cards that drive movement while creating a “fog of war” and the battle dice that will resolve combat quickly and efficiently. There are also new and updated Inspired Actions for both the Crusader and Mid-Eastern armies.
The stylized battlefield scenario maps still emphasize the important terrain features and highlight the historical deployment of forces in scale with the game system. Like your Medieval core game, the scale of the Crusade expansion is flexible and can vary from battle to battle. Yet to gain victory (and I have stated this many times before), the tactics you need to execute conform remarkably well to the advantages and limitations inherent to the various Crusader and Mid-Eastern army units, their weapons, terrain, and the history.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – King Ezekiel Booster
description:
Ezekiel is an eccentric and arrogant man and is the self-proclaimed ‘king’ of a community called the Kingdom. Along with his pet tiger, Shiva, he leads his group into an allegiance with Rick against Negan and the Saviors.

Contains:

1 Resin Model
3 Resin Markers
Cards


King Ezekiel Character Cards for All Out War and Call to Arms, and the following equipment cards:

Sword
Sterling Mk6
Kingdom Armour
Horse
Breastplate
Makeshift Armour x2
Chain
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Zombies

name: Spell Saga: Realmwalker
description:
Spell Saga: Realmwalker is a Post-Apocalyptic Fantasy Western drama, told through a tactical game of card-based exploration. While the main Spell Saga game spans multiple decks, and is concerned with the story of The Last Minstrel, Realmwalker games are always finished through one deck of cards and feature heroes and stories taking place in other parts of the world of Spell Saga (after it ended, of course).

—description from the publisher

name: Radius
description:
Overview and goal:

Radius is a game for two players played on the cells of a hexagonal board. You will need 2 pawns in blue and 2 in orange and a supply of blue and orange stones.

The goal is to end up owning a greater number of connected stones when there are no moves left.

Setup:

The board starts out empty. One player plays with the blue pieces the other with the orange. Players in turn place a pawn on an empty cell until all 4 pawns are on the board.

Decide who goes first, turns then alternate.

Play:

A pawn must move (n) steps in a straight line such that it ends up at an empty cell with at least (n) cells immediately adjacent to it that are either empty or occupied by enemy stones (note that pawns are not stones). At least one of these must be empty. Then you must place a stone on (n) of these cells, with the restriction that at least one of the stones must be placed on an empty cell. If you place it on a cell with an enemy stone, that stone is removed first. The only thing that obstructs pawn movement is other pawns and the edge of the board.


Special thanks to Michael Amundsen for his excellent rules editing.
mechanics: Chaining, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Tile Placement

name: Warhammer 40,000: Chapter Approved Mission Pack – Tactical Deployment
description:
This mission pack is a matched play expansion for Warhammer 40,000.

Within it, you’ll find the rules required to play Tactical Deployment games of Warhammer 40,000. This mission pack has been specifically designed to allow you to use your own terrain collection on the battlefield and set it up to your advantage, complementing the units in your army. As a result, this mission pack will provide players with a unique test of their tactical skills on the battlefield and is ideal for use in casual games, as well as Warhammer 40,000 tournaments.

Inside this 104-page mission pack you will find:

- 18 new missions divided between Combat Patrol, Incursion, Strike Force and Onslaught sized games
- A Tactical Terrain roster and recommended Tactical Deployment tournament scoring sheet

The pack itself is presented in a full Canadian wiro ring-bound book for easy use and reference on the tabletop during games, and comes with an elastic closure.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: House Of Cats
description:
House of Cats is somehow the missing game in the wide roll & write offering: easy to learn, fun to play and allowing some cheeky moves enjoyed by gamers and sly friends. Some kind of a "perfect family game" or "filler" allowing various players, from kids to core, to share a nice moment together and to tease each others in the same time.

You said "Roll, HIDE & Write" ?

On each turn, the active player rolls 3 dice but only shows 2 to other players: all the player now have to fill their individual house of cats with these two results. Then, the active player reveals the hidden die! Whether this surprise is good or bad, all players have to place it in their house, respecting a strict condition. Yes, simple! But also very cheeky... and an intense source of interaction between players.

—description from the publisher

name: Diceborn Heroes: Hero Card Pack Expansion
description:
A limited print run pack expansion that wasn't included with the Kickstarter featuring 30 cards.

A new adventure begins with additional hero classes & quests for Diceborn Heroes. A new LVL 1 hero class, the Acrobattler, is now available with 3 other classes. Also new monster cards to shuffle into existing monster decks. Can you overcome the new challenges that await?

Contents:
8 Hero cards / 10 Monster cards
2 attack cards / 2 Relic Item cards
6 Quest cards / 2 Boss cards
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Puzzle, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Business As Usual
description:
Use your business savvy to outmanoeuvre your opponents and take control of the Island.
With a focus on player interaction, Business As Usual mixes the worlds of business and politics, in a faced paced negotiation and hand management game.


Create revenue through business growth and self-benefiting deals
Purchase influence to tilt the scales in your favour
Vote for policy change to ensure the economy runs to your liking
Outbid your opponents to put the rule bending lobbyists in your pocket


On this island, respect rules all!

Business as Usual is a 75 minute, 3-4 players game strategic Eurogame that incorporates aspects of trading, bidding, voting, and cutting deals to benefit your businesses. There are multiple routes to success, allowing everyone to be on the edge of their seat right to the end.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Command Cards, Hand Management, Income, Increase Value of Unchosen Resources, Negotiation, Race, Voting

name: Patch: The Card Game – Volume One
description:
Patch: The Card Game is a tool to let players explore their modular synthesis skills in a fun way.

The game can be played solo or as a multiplayer game.

Separate and shuffle the Abstraction cards into their own pile. Shuffle the Progression a Abstraction cards into another pile. Draw at least one Abstraction card and start patching, following the rule set by that card. The Abstraction card should stay in play for reference.

At some interval (eg. every 5min), draw a card from the Progression/Disruption pile and do the actions described on the card before placing it in a discard pile. Repeat this as many times as you like until you feel the patch is finished. If you run out of Progression/Disruptions cards, shuffle the discard pile as your new draw pile.

Patch Battle Royale, or “PBR” for short, is like the multiplayer version of the Basic Game. 2-4 participants is recommended with a single Patch TCG deck. Multiple decks can be combined for more than 4 players, or if desired for 3 or 4 players to have more cards in their hand.

Start with the Basic Game setup and draw one Abstraction card which will be shared for all players.

Each player then gets dealt 5 cards from the Progression/Disruption pile (4 cards if there are 4 players).
Everyone starts patching. At some interval, (eg. every 5min), each participant gets to play a single card from their hand. They can play this card on themselves, in which case they do the action. Or, they can play it against another player, in which case that player has to do the action.

The battle concludes 5 minutes after the last cards are played. Patches are auditioned/performed/etc and compared. “Coolest” patch wins.

name: Victory at Sea: Prinz Eugen
description:
The third of the Admiral-Hipper-class of heavy cruisers, Prinz Eugen was named for Prince Eugene of Savoy, and 18th century Austrian general. She saw action during the German operation Rheinübung of 1941, in which, along with Bismarck, she attempted to breakout into the Atlantic to sow chaos amongst merchant convoys. The two ships destroyed the British cruiser Hood and damaged HMS Prince of Wales in the Battle of Denmark Strait. Shortly after, Prinz Eugen put into France to enact repairs following engine difficulties.

Briefly deploying to Norway, she was put out of action for repairs in Germany after being struck by a torpedo from a submarine. In the latter stages of the war, she served as artillery support for the retreating German army from the Baltic Sea.
In May 1945 she was surrendered to the US Navy as a war prize, and was subjected to the nuclear tests of Operation Crossroads. Despite surviving the atomic blasts, she capsized after being towed to Kwajelein Atoll in December 1946. The wreck remains partially visible to this day.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: What's for Dinner
description:
Players are each given a menu of foods that need to be filled on their plate board. Each food piece is laid face down and mixed up, and the game begins. Each player chooses one card, and if it matches an item on their menu, they add it to their plate. If it doesn’t match, they turn it face down and play moves to the next person. Each food item is represented on one card, with the exception of entrees, which are split up onto two cards. Players will need to find both halves in order to complete their meal.

While each menu requires certain foods, drinks and desserts are not menu-specific, so a player may take any they find. If on a later turn they find another drink or dessert, their turn simply ends.

The only item found on each menu is peas, and there are two cards in the game which state “Please Pass the Peas”. If a player finds one, they are allowed to take peas from another player who has them on their plate. If no player has peas, they may hold the card until either they find peas, or an opponent does. Once a “please Pass the Peas” card is used, it is removed from play. The first player to successfully fill their plate with all required menu items wins.

name: Tank Board Game
description:
Tank Board Game is a board game of armored battles of WW2. Its central focus is armor with minimal infantry rules. The attacking player tries to capture 3 of the defender’s 4 towns by game turn 15, while the defender tries to keep 2 of his towns.

Players move their tanks on a square grid gameboard trying to get a clear shot at the thinner side or rear armor plate of the enemy tank. Players can also move their tanks to higher-level positions and shoot down onto the enemy tank’s thinner top. When a shot is taken, the tank's ability to destroy the other tank depends on its gun's penetration at target range, the thickness of the armor plate hit (turret/hull: front, side, rear, or top), and the angle the shell hits (level shot or falling shot & full-face or quarter hit). Shot resolution is simplified using 3 randomly drawn chits (hit/miss, hit location, and critical hit) and then a quick table to find the effective armor vs. the gun’s penetration. Armor plate thickness and gun penetration are all historical based.

The “Starter Rules” include only tank vs tank direct-fire combat. The “Advanced Rules” cover tank hunters, armored cars, self-propelled guns, armored personnel carriers, towed guns and aircraft. They cover indirect fire, rockets, and close infantry combat. In addition, they cover mechanical reliability, smoke, mines, demolitions, pontoon bridges, airborne, weather, and an optional concealment rule.

A total of 24 scenarios are provided: eight “Starter” scenarios and 16 historical “Advanced” scenarios. The starter scenarios include common favorites: M-4 vs Panther, T34 vs Panther, and M-4 vs T-34 (Korea). The historical scenarios start with the invasion of Poland with an optional armored train, and end with “Into Germany” putting armored goliaths against each other. Scenarios are designed to provide near-balanced fun games featuring 30-40 tanks and supporting units of the period, with the “feel” of the campaign in which the scenario took place. Two gameboards (Northern Europe and North Africa), 295 units of 163 types, as well as markers and chits are provided.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Critical Hits and Failures, Grid Movement, Interrupts, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Movement Points, Simulation, Square Grid

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Khainite Shadowstalkers
description:
The Daughters of Khaine are a fearsome cult that exults in the spilling of fresh blood. Honouring the Lord of Murder, these aelven warriors fight to fulfil the aims of their true mistress, the Shadow Queen Morathi.

Emerge from the shadows to cut down those who would oppose the will of Morathi with the Khainite Shadowstalkers! This warband set allows you to field these aelven killers in your battles, containing:


9 multipart plastic Khainite Shadowstalkers miniatures – 1 Shroud Queen/Shroudblade, 4 Shroudblades with Cursed Swords, 1 Shroudblade with Umbral Spear, 1 Slaughtershade, and 2 Darkflame Warlocks
A Khainite Shadowstalkers abilities card, allowing you to unleash the distinctive and deadly battle tactics of this warband in your games
7 fighter cards for seeing your rules at a glance, plus divider cards for tracking your tokens


What’s more, these deadly warriors are available for use in your Daughters of Khaine Warhammer Age of Sigmar army thanks to a free warscroll available in the Downloads tab.

This set is supplied with 1x Citadel 40mm Round Base and 9x Citadel 28.5mm Round Bases.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Flying Frog DiceFest 2020 Goody Box
description:
A promotional box of goodies made for sale during the virtual DiceFest held in 2020.

The promotional box includes:
For Shadows of Brimstone

The Lost Marshals Enemy Record Sheet
Cartwright's Trusty Pistol - Mine Legendary Artifact (First legendary artifact) - Promo 337
Black Fang Hatchet - Canyons Artifact - Promo 269
Veteran Preacher miniature with Sculpted Base


Harvester Otherworld Threats

Harvesters - Belly of the Beast Otherworld Threat Card - Promo 488
Harvesters - Forest of the Dead Otherworld Threat Card - Promo 489


Trederran Raiders Otherworld Threats

Trederran Raiders - Belly of the Beast Otherworld Threat Card - Promo 490
Trederran Raiders - Forest of the Dead Otherworld Threat Card - Promo 491



For Fortune & Glory

Heroic Survival Card - Event - Promo 032
Shroud of Menace - Villain Event - Promo 033



For A Touch of Evil

Heroic Survival Card - Event - Promo 065
Shroud of Menace - Mystery - Promo 066



For Last Night on Earth

Heroic Survival Card - Hero Deck - Promo 069
Shroud of Menace - Zombie Deck - Promo 070



For Invasion from Outer Space

Heroic Survival Card - Hero Deck - Promo 009
Shroud of Menace - Martian Deck - Promo 010



Other:
